Job_title: Supply Chain Administrative Assistant - Waterbury, Connecticut
Job_description:
Supply Chain Administrative Assistant - Waterbury, Connecticut

Company: Portmeirion Group USA

Position Title: Supply Chain Administrative Assistant

Location: Waterbury, CT

Schedule: Full Time

About the Company: A major force in the home fashion industry, Portmeirion Group USA encompasses the world-renowned brands of Portmeirion, Spode, Royal Worcester, Pimpernel, Wax Lyrical and Nambe ́. We are a market leader with a worldwide reputation for high quality and innovatively designed tableware, giftware, home fragrance and personal care. For further information about the Portmeirion Group, please visit our website: www.portmeiriongroup.com

Job Description: Portmeirion Group is seeking an entry-level energetic, highly driven professional to support our supply chain team in this cross-functional administrative role. Our department focuses on teamwork, efficiency, and rising to the challenge of meeting increasing demands in the everchanging world of the global supply chain. The ideal candidate can work independently to prioritize a high volume of tasks with competing deadlines in a fast-pasted environment while maintaining a positive attitude.

The successful candidate needs to be meticulously detail-oriented and exceptionally organized with excellent time management skills and an analytical mind. We need a quick learner with willingness to assist in all areas, from clerical duties to warehouse support. Excel and data entry skills are non-negotiable requirements and essential to day-to-day responsibilities. This position reports to the Senior Manager of Supply Chain.

Responsibilities:

Creates and tracks purchase orders through each stage of the process, from vendor acknowledgment to receipt of product.

Communicates directly with suppliers to track and maintain reporting on vendor shipments.

Checks order acknowledgments, shipping labels, and barcodes for accuracy.

Gathers data to create excel reports and graphs as needed to provide updates and status details to management.

Organize and maintain item, account, and vendor data within ERP system and shared documents.

Performs a wide range of administrative duties including, but not limited to creating and formatting spreadsheets, maintaining detailed records, and filing systems, scanning documents, and organizing general day-to-day operations.

Provides support as needed to the Supply chain team and management with daily administrative activities, month-end reporting, and special projects.

Collaborates with customer service, shipping/receiving, and other departments as needed.

Other duties as assigned.

Skills:

- Detail-oriented with a focus on accuracy

- Sense of urgency with the ability to effectively prioritize

- Strong organization, multitasking, and planning skills

- Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Requirements:

Experience

-Administrative or data entry experience required

- Intermediate skills in Microsoft Excel required (Data Analysis, Pivot tables, Vlookup)

Education

- Bachelor's degree preferred

Benefits

Benefits: 401(k), 401(k) matching, Employee discount, Medical, Dental, Vision, Life and, Disability insurance. Paid time off.

Pay: $40,000.00 - $45,000.00 per year

Summary

The Data Analytics Specialist, under the general direction of the Director of Information Technology, and in accordance with good business practices and established procedures, will gather, manage, analyze, and report data from internal Organ Procurement Organization (OPO) systems and external industry systems. Analyze data to establish baseline performance metrics. Produce internal and external reports and assist with publication initiatives. Make recommendations for process improvement initiatives. Provide continuous monitoring of local donation activity data and regular reports to leadership. Promote efficiency throughout the organization utilizing creative and innovative thinking to develop, analyze and verify statistical measures.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities

Responsible for the integrity and quality of data within the Information Technology (IT) infrastructure to support operations, management and decision-making. Actively participate in cross departmental initiatives ensuring data is efficiently organized, managed and distributed. Enable strategic use of enterprise-wide information for cross-functional organizations and teams.
Provide data related services throughout the organization. Consult with leadership and workforce on process measures, evaluation techniques, as well as, current and potential IT related solutions.
Verify organ and tissue donor statistics in the electronic medical record system while using analytical tools.
Assist with process improvement where data or IT infrastructure is integral to the improvement. Monitors and participate in the compilation of OPO quality measures.
Ensure data collection processes are consistent, repeatable, and appropriate throughout the organization.
Assist with internal and external reporting requests and requirements.
Validates and analyzes various data, metrics, and information via business intelligence (BI), statistical and quality tools.
Analyze all organ and tissue recovery data and produces reports regarding activity, outcome, and recommended improvement areas.
Assist with the tracking of organizational metrics to support the success of the organization’s strategic efforts.
Facilitates team-based problem solving and multidisciplinary team use of various data-driven process improvement techniques such as Process Mapping and Root Cause Analysis. Applies business logic and ask questions that are not necessarily apparent.
Supports organizational survey processes with analysis, tracking and developing of survey data for both internal and external partners.
Develop and maintain specialized datasets and systems for recording and tracking appropriate data and statistical information.
Creates and distributes standardized and special reports, summaries, and analyses.
Organizes appropriate resources, organizational priorities and manages systems as related to data activities.
Maintains monthly scorecards and dashboards for the organization to ensure compliance with performance measures.
Integrates features and tools of Office 365 into the IT infrastructure.
Maintains a continuous and independent education on cutting-edge statistical techniques and tools.
Other duties as assigned.

Qualifications, Education & Experience


Bachelor’s Degree (preferred);
Minimum 2 of years’ experience in business analysis, and/or a quality improvement role;
Five years of experience with an organ and/or tissue procurement agency (preferred); or
An equivalent combination of education and experience.
Strong attention to detail and accuracy (required).
Ability to approach work conscientiously and methodically.
Ability to exercise initiative and sound judgment.
Understanding of basic statistics (required).
Demonstrated organizational skills required and ability to see tasks through to completion (required).
Strong interpersonal skills and ability to work both independently and as part of a team (required).
Working knowledge of medical terminology and medical records/procedures (preferred).
Demonstrated knowledge of and ability using a Personal Computer (PC), related Microsoft Office software and other report writing and BI software.

The Operations Database Administrator is accountable for overseeing the day-to-day activities of the geographic information system database including direct supervision of records support personnel, cable locators and internet support personnel; scheduling of their work assignments and projects and review of such assignments. Principal accountabilities also includes management of database application architecture, programming, troubleshooting and security of the outside and inside plant facility records, GIS database, mapping systems and engineering design systems integration. The Operations Database Administrator must exercise independent and discretionary judgement when investigating, gathering and summarizing information to optimize efficiency for the benefit of the department and the Company.

ACCOUNTABILITIES

Oversees daily scheduling of work assignments issued to the staff
Reviews, monitors and analyzes needs of applicable personnel based on immediate and future demands
Processes all daily departmental paperwork and reports
Oversees daily posting of verified data or in-service and closed graphic and non-graphic work order information to the GIS database.
Oversees daily posting of in-service, verified or closed COE work order data to the appropriate COE records database.
Oversees daily posting of in-service, verified or closed Plant Condition Reports and Plant Work Orders to the appropriate records base.
Oversees the daily integration of data between various data systems as well as data integration from and to other systems, including but not limited to GPS data and data from external sources.
Oversees daily USA procedures, coordination and scheduling of cable locates
Oversees internet support staff ensuring high quality local technical support for internet subscribers
Understands and accepts the necessity for reporting to work, on time, and is ready and able to perform the duties and responsibilities of the position on a daily basis
Proactive involvement in the Company’s Safety Program, including compliance with all rules and regulations, and for continuously practicing safety while performing their duties
Proactive involvement of all staff in the Company’s ongoing customer satisfaction programs
Duty Supervisor responsibilities

Qualifications

Bachelor degree, emphasis in GIS, database management, electronic engineering, land surveying or related field desirable
3 years as an OSP engineer, OSP Technician, Line Assigner, CAD Operator, or similar position, where duties correspond with the essential and periodic functions of this position
Supervisory experience desirable. Data Maintenance, Database Management, Promoting Process Improvement, Presenting Technical Information, Database Design, Reporting Skills, Quality Focus, Technical Understanding, Attention to Detail, Thoroughness, Requirements Analysis

E-commerce healthcare training company seeks full-time Data Manager to lead our team in the processing, loading and quality checking the marketing leads we acquire and add to our database.

These qualified marketing prospects are the lifeblood of our company. You will have the important job of managing the processes and staff that are responsible for the capture, completion, and accuracy of all marketing prospects added to our system. This process supports our marketing team and drives the majority of our company’s revenue.

Your day-to-day duties will range from diving in and processing actual prospect records before they are loaded to setting strategic goals for your team to ensure our prospect database continues to grow.

Key Responsibilities:

Manage the acquisition, validation, tagging, and formatting of new email marketing prospects.
Work closely with marketing team to optimize prospect volume and results
Coordinate between departments to ensure deadlines are met
Prioritize data so that the highest quality prospects are processed first
Meet monthly volume and accuracy goals
Front-line management of data processing team of 2 (1 onsite and 1 offsite)
Audit work to ensure accuracy and quality of data before loading
When needed, jump in and process prospects with your team to ensure goals are met
Solve problems as they arise to keep prospects moving

Requirements:

Values: Buy in and to our company values
Experience: 3+ years’ experience as data project manager (or similar job), preferably supporting marketing functions
Computer: EXCELLENT MS Excel skills

MS Dynamics and SQL a massive plus, but not required.

Healthcare Knowledge: Although not completely necessary, it would be hugely beneficial
Details: Track numerous details under tight deadlines with minimal errors.
Change: Ability to shift gears quickly.
Location: North Naples office (partially remote may be possible after time)
Deadlines: Meet numerous deadlines
Management: Strong problem-solving, multitasking and prioritization skills. You never give up.
Communications: Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Auditing: Ability to utilize key indicators to identify problems – then take action to resolve.
Strategy: Regularly examine current processes to identify opportunities to improve speed and accuracy.

Company Core Values: Own it, People Matter, Persistent Optimism, and Results

Our entire team moves fast and never shies away from a challenge. We are definitively a glass entirely full group. This doesn’t mean that we have our heads in the clouds. We live in reality, driven by data and numbers. When mistakes happen (which they do), we own them. Then, we use what we’ve learned and do it right the next time. We respect each other, but say what needs to be said. We work hard so we can have a balanced life. With that said, when we are here we are results-oriented and driven.

This role is a chance to use your talent and expertise to make a visible difference in our company growth. The opportunity to work with a dedicated, talented, fun team that love their jobs, thrive on results and really enjoy coming to work each day (life is too short to simply go through the motions). We even have a company dog (who is hypoallergenic).

We’re looking for a rock star to join our team that can make a real difference in our company success. So, if you have the skills and meet the requirements in this posting and if you want to work somewhere that appreciates you and the work you do, is fast-moving, positive and results driven – we would love to have you join our team!!!!

Job Summary: Job Summary: The Quality Assurance and Data Coordinator provides clinical quality assurance, coordinates data, project management and performance support to the Chief Medical Officer/Vice President of Quality and to the Quality Director. The incumbent will be responsible for a broad range of coordinator duties and will provide high-level support for the Medical and Quality Services, as directed by the CMO/VP Quality and/or Quality Director, to ensure efficient accomplishment of key tasks and hospital initiatives.

Promotes, leads, and supports hospital-wide quality improvement processes and initiatives through analysis of data, investigation, follow-up, and report generation of patient events and patient and/or family complaints, integration of multiple healthcare providers’ impact to patient care, and knowledge of various state and other agency regulations in the overall management and required improvement processes regarding the provision of quality care and compliance with regulatory agency requirements throughout the hospital system.
Performs detailed medical record quality indicator data review and chart reviews. Also assists monitoring of Event Reporting under the guidance of the Quality Director. Assists with other quality improvement studies, surveys and risk management activities.
Manages and coordinates administrative activities to ensure efficient and effective time management in order to consistently meet deadlines.
Provides internal and external communication, analysis of documents, preparation of research reports, and responds to all requests in a timely and efficient manner. Contributes to the execution of the department vision and strategies by identifying and executing improvement opportunities.
Leads and facilitates the identification of key measures, data analysis, process improvement, and the implementation of redesigned processes for system clinical and operational functions. Regularly monitors data and assists department managers in the development of data measures and associated action plans.
Maintains a tracking system and performs regular follow-up to assure proper completion of projects and plans.
Consults with service line teams and committees on outcomes, results, and improvement planning.
Must be able to problem-solve, use excellent judgement and be competent in decision-making.
Strong organizational skills and ability to prioritize multiple tasks seamlessly with a strong attention to detail.
Must exhibit excellent verbal and written communication skills, as well as very strong interpersonal skills and the ability to build relationships with key stakeholders.
Must be trustworthy, proactive and self-directed, and have the ability to incorporate creative approaches to various projects by taking initiative and working independently.

Education Requirements:

Required: Associate's Degree in nursing

Preferred: Bachelor’s Degree in nursing or nursing administration and training on Accreditation and Regulatory Agencies. Training/education in Clinical Quality Improvement.

Licensure/Certification Registration Requirements:

Required: NYS Licensed Practical or Registered Nurse

Preferred: Certification as Quality Auditor, Six Sigma, Quality Improvement Associate, or Quality Assurance.

Required Experience: Two (2) years of experience in Quality Improvement and Nursing in a hospital setting. Detail-oriented quality assurance specialist. Experience with implementation of corrective action programs. Excellent computer competence, including experience with databases and Microsoft Office. Analytical Skills, thoroughness, problem-solving and decision-making skills, customer service competency, ability to work in a team, outstanding interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills. Must be thorough and exhibit excellent judgement. Ability to work independently.

Preferred Experience: Five (5) to ten (10) years of experience in a healthcare setting. Experience developing and implementing quality assurance policies, conducting tests and inspections, identifying process and procedure issues, and presenting solutions.

Millennium Print Group "MPG", a subsidiary of The Pokémon Company International, is in The Research Triangle Park area of North Carolina.

Since its inception in 2014 under the current executive team, the Millennium Print Group has assembled a dedicated and highly talented staff of print professionals and has built a world-class organization that is customer focused, market-competitive, and quality driven.

Our unique ability offers a variety of services specializing in trading specialties and collectible cards. Since 2019, MPG has nearly tripled in size.

Currently, MPG is seeking to hire an experienced Variable Data Programmer for our location at 9301 Globe Center Dr, Morrisville, NC 27560. If you possess the required skills and experience as outlined below, please submit your resume for consideration.


RESPONSIBILITIES

Receive information from customers and create excel files for variable data to feed into variable data software.
Oversee, evaluate, and calibrate equipment, systems, and procedures used in the development and production of products.
Collaborate with other departments for change management, for developing regulatory documentation, and for cleaning validation activities monitoring.
Develop manufacturing processes to ensure proper scale up and design verification/validation.
Ensure that process improvements are evaluated and implemented through the change control management process.
Develop and maintain databases for tracking test results, validation activities, and/or validated systems.
Lead multiple projects with minimal oversight.
Take responsibility for all aspects of data management to include tracking and validating data.
Ensure accuracy and quality of data.
Complete other assigned projects and tasks.


MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS

Knowledge of various variable data software (XMPie, HP SmartStream)
Advanced Microsoft Excel Skills
Intermediate math skills
Experience in variable data programming
Exceptional attention to detail
Ability to work independently and with multiple teams
Experience in print industry is preferred.


COMPENSATION & BENEFITS

MPG offers a leading-edge compensation package which includes the following:

A highly competitive compensation "above the industry" commensurate with experience which includes an annual incentive bonus plan
100% Employer-paid medical, dental base plan, vision, life/AD&D, and short-term and long-term disability, while subsidizing premiums for medical, dental, and vision for employee dependents
401(k) Plan with up to a 4% (dollar for dollar) Employer match
Health Savings/Flexible Spending Account options
Paid time off, including 9 company-paid holidays
Employee Assistance Program
And, much more!


For more information, please visit our Company Website at https://mprintgroup.isolvedhire.com/jobs/

Millennium Print Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer

Full Time, Flexible weekday schedule. 36 hours/week.

Pay Range is between $23.21-$34.80/hr, depending on years of relevant and like experience.

Boulder Community Health is a Certified Level II Trauma Center. In 2022, we celebrated the 100thanniversary of the founding of our organization. We are honored to hold the awards of 2021 U.S. News & World ‘Best Hospitals for Maternity Care’, 2019 Best Medical Facility from Boulder Weekly, and Best Local Employer from Daily Camera. Come be part of an independent, community-focused health system; feel good knowing that your work will make a difference in people’s lives and positively contribute to the community.

POSITION SUMMARY

Coordinates the cancer data management system to promote quality care for the cancer patients at Boulder Community Health. Maintains compliance with the requirements for an approved cancer program and national accreditation program for breast centers set forth by the American College of Surgeons Commission on Cancer. Maintains compliance with the requirements for mandatory statewide reporting set forth by the Colorado Cancer Registry and Department of Public health.

JOB QUALIFICATIONS

Education or Formal Training

Accredited Record Technician (RHIT) or Registered Record Administrator (RHIA) preferred. Certified Tumor Registrar (CTR) required. ICD-9 Coding, cancer staging and word-processing. Expertise required with Excel spreadsheets and CNExT (or similar automated cancer registry system) ACOS web-based data upload process including but not limited to the National Call for Data (NCDB) and the Facility Identifiable data (FIPS level 1 & 2). State of Colorado Public Health and Environment compliance with state and federal laws mandating data collection and compliance in the research of those diagnosed with and treated for cancer. The Cancer Registry is responsible for guarding the hospitals compliance and fostering a cohesive relationship with the State liaisons and personnel and providing documentation to them upon request, to evidence the hospitals compliance with the state and federal statutes.

Special Qualifications (Licensure, Registration, etc.)

Bachelor or Associate Degree in health information technology are related field preferred. Certified Tumor Registrar (CTR) required.

Knowledge, Skill and Ability

Knowledge of all American College of Surgeons and State of Colorado requirements for Cancer Registry accreditation process. Working knowledge of all levels of accreditation and evidence of experience with standards.
Evidence of ability to produce an annual report and comply with procedures for reporting to the state as required by American College of Surgeons.
Demonstrated ability for successful completion of ACOS accreditation survey.
Demonstrated excellent communication skills:
Writing ability including accurate grammar and spelling as evidenced by concise and clear report writing, compilation and organization of annual reports, preparation of tumor conference agendas, and synopses of data.
Verbal skills as evidenced by ability to communicate with all members of the health care team, the state tumor registry and patients when appropriate.
Demonstrated ability to execute a successful breast & cancer conference.
Demonstrated ability to accurately analyze and abstract patient records with an average time of 60 minutes or less per abstract.
Detail-oriented with ability to make independent decisions and use critical thinking skills.
Demonstrated ability to execute accomplishment of ACOS required registry data studies
Demonstrated ability to execute scientific studies leading to sound data to be presented to the Cancer Committee as a source of outcomes analysis.
Demonstrated ability to keep apprised of the ever-changing policies and procedures of the state of Colorado and the data reporting elements involved in this process.
Demonstrated ability to research and comply with changing federal agency regulations.
Demonstrated ability to stay up to date with regulatory and complementary agencies to adjust hospital abstracting when a specific precedent has been changed or set. The agencies include but are not limited to; coding schemes (CPT, ICD-0-3, ICD-9-CM), Surveillance Epidemiology & End Results (SEER), American Joint Commission on Cancer (AJCC).
Must have knowledge and ability to perform required aspects of the computer and its programs: follow-up letters, statistical reports, Colorado State Cancer Registry reporting and other required medical and cancer data.

Experience

At least five years of experience as a cancer data registrar in an ACOS accredited Cancer Program.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Assists in developing and maintaining cancer program standards by ACoS/COC and NAPBC.
Coordinates maintenance of appropriate files, reports and other cancer related data to ensure approval standards by the American College of Surgeons and the Colorado State Cancer Registry. Preparing graphs and statistics.
Prepares cancer reports and statistical data of the cancer program and breast center activities to administration, physician, outside agencies and/or Colorado State Cancer Registry.
Develops and implement changes in cancer registry policies and procedures to ensure CoC and NAPBC requirements
Monitors quality data (including periodic audits) to ensure data quality and compliance with state and CoC and NAPBC requirements.
Coordinates, plans, attends, documents, and promotes attendance at all Tumor Conferences.
Schedules a minimum of 4 Cancer Committee meetings a year on the medical staff calendar.
Drafts Cancer Committee agendas to represent each standard outlined by the ACOS. Allocate time on the agenda for each coordinator and specialty to give report, at the designated intervals required by the ACOS, if not more often.
Serves as a member of the Cancer Committee.
Coordinates Cancer Registry abstractors and oversight of all of their encompassing cancer registry activities.

About Boulder Community Health and Boulder, Colorado

Uncompromising medical excellence delivered with respect and compassion. Since 1922, Boulder Community Health has built a strong reputation on these values. As community-owned and operated not-for-profit hospital and clinic locations, we remain dedicated to the evolving needs of our citizens and providing access to high-quality care. Nestled in the foothills of the Rocky Mountains, the Boulder lifestyle is conductive to enjoying the outdoors and brings a fresh perspective to healthcare practice. Surround yourself by natural beauty and an active, life-embracing community. Position Details:

Summary of Duties:

This position is responsible for the development, implementation and management of systems used to collect research data for the Paul G. Allen School for Global Health (SGH) at Washington State University. This position interacts with a broad range of researchers to gather requirements for data collection and storage, and then designs, implements, and maintains these systems. Working as an intermediary between the School for Global Health and the College of Veterinary Medicine's Veterinary Information Systems unit, this position will also assist in the preparation of data sets for analysis and will act as the primary support contact for a REDCap instance supporting both domestic and international research programs, as well as other data collection systems. Infrequent international travel to assist international research programs may be necessary in this position.

To support WSU's ability to attract talent in a competitive job market, this recruitment has been approved for a hiring incentive/moving allowance payment of up to one month's salary.


Depending on your level of experience, you may begin as a IT Data Management-Entry or a IT Data Management- Journey.


To be considered for a IT Data Management-Entry, applicants must have:

Position requires a Bachelor's degree in a related technology field. Any combination of relevant education and experience may be substituted for the educational requirement on a year-for-year basis.

Salary: Range #02iT, $5114-$6879 Commensurate with Qualifications and Experience.

Title: 482DM-YN - IT Data Management - Entry

Business Title: IT Data Management

Location: WSU PULLMAN CAMPUS

To be considered for a IT Data Management-Journey, applicants must have:

Position requires a Bachelor's degree in a related technology field AND 3 year(s) of professional experience. Any combination of relevant education and experience may be substituted for the educational requirement on a year-for-year basis.

Salary: Range #06iT, $6672-$8973 Commensurate with Qualifications and Experience.

Title: 483DM-NN - IT Data Management - Journey

Business Title: IT Data Management

Location: WSU PULLMAN CAMPUS

Required Qualifications:

Experience with relational database systems and a working knowledge of structured query language (SQL).

Effective communications and interpersonal skills.

Authorization to work in the US.

Preferred Qualifications:

Experience with REDCap.

Strong understanding of database design.

Experience developing, maintaining, and managing IT applications and systems

Knowledge and experience with HTML, and CSS.

Knowledge and experience with Python, R, C# or other programming languages.

Experience with restful web services.

ETL processing design, planning, testing, and production implementations.

Data warehousing experience.

Experience with Tableau and\or Power BI.

Additional Information:

Department Name: Information Services
City, State, Zip: Pullman, WA 99164

company: Response: Support for Survivors of Domestic and Sexual Abuse
Job_description:
Office and Data Manager Job Description

Job Summary: Response is a non-profit in Aspen that works with survivors of domestic and sexual abuse. The office and data manager is responsible for managing the Response office and data collection and reporting as well as supporting the fundraising and outreach functions of the organization. (part time considered for the right applicant).

Responsibilities:

1. General Office:

Performs the full range of administrative duties for the office, including office management, maintaining office supplies and equipment. Answers incoming calls; assists visitors; handles mail.
Maintains agency files, ensures payment requests are submitted to the executive director, processes reports and renewals.
Works with vendors and other agencies to ensure the highest level of service.
Paying bills and processing payments.
Support other staff as needed.

2. Crisis Helpline:

Communicating with volunteer advocates with updates and scheduling to ensure that crisis helpline is adequately staffed.
Maintains volunteer and back up staff records and individual hours.
After completing the 30-hour volunteer advocate training, may be asked to work up to one week per month on the crisis line for evenings and a full weekend (additional compensation).

3. Fundraising and Outreach

Maintains Response website and social media outlets with accurate and timely postings.
Maintains donor database for fundraising and outreach efforts.
Provide logistical support for all Response events including volunteer management, soliciting donations, working with sponsors, marketing and more.
Works with executive director to create email and print newsletters on a regular basis.

4. Grant and Data Management

Coordination of Response’s annual grant calendar.
Assist executive director with grant reporting and tracking.
Coordination of program evaluation systems.
May include grant writing and proofing under the supervision of the executive director.
Maintains organizational databases and is responsible for overall records management.

Qualifications:

At least three years of work in an office setting.
Strong computer skills: Microsoft office, including Excel and Word and database experience.
A professional office manner and careful attention to detail.
The ability to maintain confidentiality and a calm manner when dealing with people in crisis.
A strong team player who is flexible with time and duties as they evolve.
Passionate about Response’s mission, culturally sensitive and trauma informed.
Background check and work verification required.
Ability to work 9 am -5 pm at the Aspen office (only applicants with housing in the Roaring Fork Valley will be considered)
Bilingual language skills (English and Spanish) preferred.

General Physical Requirements:

Hearing and vision corrected to normal ranges; able to work in high-stress situations; able to use the telephone and able to function in an office environment, including operation of office equipment.

Salary Range: $$27-$30/hour depending on experience. Benefits after 90 day trial period: 10 days of vacation per year, 11 paid holidays, 78 hours of wellness leave, health insurance, health spending account and retirement contribution.

To Apply: Send a short letter explaining why you would be a good fit for this position and your professional resume. WILL NOT CONSIDER WITHOUT BOTH

Website www.responsehelps.org

Job_description:
Posted
07-Mar-2023

GWS Segment

Full-time

Construction, Data Centers
Location(s)
Charleston - South Carolina - United States of America, Moncks Corner - South Carolina - United States of America, North Charleston - South Carolina - United States of America, Summerville - South Carolina - United States of America
Job Summary
The Datacenter Automation Systems (DAS) team is committed to the successful implementation of autonomous and semi-autonomous vehicles throughout multiple datacenters. CBRE is seeking a full-time, permanent, CAD Operator with experience in MEP design, manufacturing or data center robotics-centric automation solutions. The DAS CAD Operator will report to the Client-approved location:
Moncks Corner, SC - full time / on site
The DAS CAD Operator requirements may vary according to Client-determined assignments, but most content relates to creating detailed designs for industrial automation equipment and systems in the DAS robotics portfolio at the Client's data centers. This position is part of a multi-disciplinary team creating engineering documentation and design drawing packages. The individual will collaborate with project engineers, technical writers, project managers, and other CAD/BIM Operators. Ideal candidates would be familiar with establishing and managing a design environment. Ideal candidates must be comfortable communicating regularly via video conference, email and internal ticketing systems.

Job Duties:
Acquire clear understanding of product requirements by reviewing, understanding, interpreting and revising technical specifications, blueprints and engineering illustrations, mockups, and prototypes.
Ability to read and interpret design standards and specifications, blueprints, drawings, redlines, etc
Coordinate the CAD design for Navigation Tape and GeoMarker installation package
Installation Drawings
Navigation DesignLayout
GeoMarker datum development
Material Takeoff
Working understanding of construction design package development for field installation.
Ability to translate existing field conditions from documentation and redlines to revise/edit design drawing packages.
Ability to learn software such as Lucidchart to generate shape files for navigation translated from design drawings. .
Capable of managing shifting design production to coordinate with field installation schedules.
Coordinate file management with 3rd party teams for document file transfer.
Maintain audits of latest design revisions against floor plan modifications.
Ability to perform repetitive field measurement tasks for long durations such as bending, kneeling, squatting ,walking, climbing stairs, etc.
Must have excellent organizational skills
Ability to communicate effectively, both orally and in writing

Other duties as assigned.

SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES

No formal supervisory responsibilities in this position.

QUALIFICATIONS

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.

Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

EDUCATION and EXPERIENCE

Bachelor's degree in Architecture, Engineering, Construction Management, or related field. Minimum two or more years' construction administration, architecture, engineering or similar experience.

Preferred experience with some data center infrastructure projects. Experience in mission critical data centers is a strong plus. Preferred experience with robotic process automation.

CERTIFICATES and/or LICENSES

Working towards or eligible for licensure as either a Professional Engineer or Registered Architect is desired.

COMMUNICATION SKILLS

Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Strong organizational and analytical skills. Ability to provide efficient, timely, reliable and courteous service to customers. Ability to effectively present information.

FINANCIAL KNOWLEDGE

Requires knowledge of financial terms and principles. Ability to calculate intermediate figures such as percentages, discounts, and/or commissions. Conducts basic financial analysis.

REASONING ABILITY

Ability to understand and carry out general instructions in standard situations. Ability to solve problems in standard situations. Requires intermediate analytical and quantitative skills.

OTHER SKILLS and ABILITIES

Intermediate skills with Microsoft Office Suite. Ability to read and understand architectural drawings. Working knowledge in MS Project is helpful. Knowledge of leases, contracts, and construction practices preferred. 3+ years of minimum proficiency in the use of AutoCAD and Revit. Knowledge of Best Management Practices CAD/BIM environment. Autodesk Software - CAD BIM Solidworks BIM360 etc.

Basic knowledge of the entitlement/permitting process and construction delivery methods and agreements. Some familiarity with construction best practices, general building codes, and various building types and systems. Passion for being detail oriented and highly organized.

SCOPE OF RESPONSIBILITY

Decisions made with general understanding of procedures and company policies to achieve set results and deadlines. Errors in judgment may cause short-term impact to co-workers and supervisor.

Job_title: KIPP NYC Senior Associate, Student Enrollment - Data & Reporting
Job_description:
Company Description


KIPP NYC Public Schools is a non-profit network of free, public charter schools that prepares students for success in college and life. In 1995 we started our first middle school, KIPP Academy, in The Bronx. Our goal was to graduate students with the strength of character and academic abilities needed to succeed in high school, college and beyond – and in so doing, to prove what is possible for all students. Today, our New York City network is comprised of eight elementary schools, nine middle schools, one high school, and KIPP Forward, a comprehensive support program for our alumni. KIPP NYC Public Schools currently serves more than 9,350 students and alumni and has a staff of more than 850. KIPP NYC is continuing to grow and opened two new middle schools and an elementary school August 2021!

Position Overview

The KIPP NYC Senior Associate, Student Enrollment - Data & Reporting is an essential role in making KIPP NYC’s student enrollment data accessible for all organizational levels in our region. They will support and maintain the development of tools, dashboards and protocols to align school and regional teams toward key enrollment goals and benchmarks, including attendance, retention, and application. Additionally, the Senior Associate, Student Enrollment - Data & Reporting will support regional and school teams with real time data requests and serve as lead for internal CRM systems such as SchoolMint and Hubspot.

This position is based out of the NYC office and may require local travel to our NYC schools. The Senior Associate will report to the Director, Student Enrollment on the KIPP NYC Regional Operations team



Job Description


General Duties and Responsibilities

Regional Systems and Support

Develop and manage dashboards and tracking systems created for school and network-based teams
Create a year-long regional calendar of the key events for student enrollment data collection and analysis
Support the internal use and iteration on CRMs or data visualization through SchoolMint, Hubspot, Google Suite, and/or Tableau
Continuously improve processes to promote efficiency and accuracy of data collection and reporting structures for student enrollment, including the accuracy of ongoing student enrollment records across ATS and Powerschool
Support any student enrollment data compliance requests received from other teams within our regional team

School Support

Provide actionable guidance and partnership to the Community Outreach team in monitoring trends and forecasting against targets
Support the creation and systematization of key regional school-facing processes to produce reliable, quantitative results to be shared across the enterprise.
Analyze historical trends to create benchmarks for key projects
As needed, provide in-person (school based) recruitment and enrollment support during critical times in the year (i.e. admissions lottery, first two weeks of the school year, etc.)


Qualifications

Associate’s degree required, Bachelor’s degree preferred.
2+ years of work experience, experience in Data preferred
Demonstrated intermediate/ advanced skills in Microsoft Office & Google Suite, especially data analysis and presentations using Microsoft Excel and/or Google Sheets
Knowledge of database systems and data management, DOE systems and SchoolMint highly preferred
Strong organization skills with high attention to detail and accuracy
Strong written and presentation skills, as well as demonstrated ability to communicate using data in a clear, concise, and accessible manner to inform decisions and planning
Meticulous attention to detail with an ability to produce high-quality work in a dynamic, fast-paced Environment
Strong interpersonal skills, with the ability to develop productive working relationships with multiple stakeholders across the organization
Demonstrated passion for and a commitment to the KIPP mission for high-quality public education and the character traits we value

Additional Information


Compensation and Benefits:

KIPP NYC offers a competitive salary ranging from $71,070 to $81,370. Salary ranges at KIPP NYC are standardized based on role level and role function. Individual salaries are determined through a lens of equity, accounting for years of experience relevant to the role and scope of responsibilities, and are benchmarked against others within the same salary band.

KIPP NYC offers a generous benefits package including, but not limited to, the following:

Robust benefits that include medical, dental, and vision.
403(b) retirement plan with 50% match after 6 months.
Generous Time-Off aligned with school calendar
Up to 12 weeks 100% parental leave.
Bright Horizon Back-up Child and Elder care.
Employer paid Life Insurance and Short term/Long term disability.
Employee incentives including 8 Weeks paid Sabbatical after 10 years, annual professional development funds, and tuition reimbursement.

This description is intended to describe the type of work being performed by a person assigned to this position. It is not an exhaustive list of all duties and responsibilities required by the employee.

KIPP NYC LLC is an anti-racist organization that believes in the importance of being diverse, equitable, and inclusive. We are committed to creating a welcoming environment that includes employees with diverse backgrounds and experiences. We believe that enables us to better meet our mission and values while serving students and families throughout New York City. BIPOC, women, gender expansive, LGBTQIA+, veterans, and persons with disabilities are encouraged to apply.

KIPP NYC LLC is an Equal Opportunity Employer. KIPP NYC LLC is committed to the principles of equal employment opportunity for all employees and applicants for employment.

Visions In Education is seeking a highly skilled person who analyzes, prepares, audits, monitors and performs complex work in the development, control and analysis of the Visions enrollment data and systems, student assessment, special education fiscal matters, and student information systems. The position will be responsible for supervision of enrollment services, assessment and evaluation staff, team of business analysts, supervision of staff and use of time/talents; serves as a department liaison with Technology Department staff reviewing procedures, processes and software to promote efficiency; directs and coordinates educational research and evaluation including analysis and interpretation of various internal metrics, systems and data; responsible for supporting special education integration with SEIS and our student information systems, related state reporting related to data collected and managed within our various information systems. In addition, serves as Project manager for Charter renewal process, annual LCAP compliance, WASC accreditation process, annual SARC reporting; responsible for ensuring organizational Board Policies are kept current, ensuring that all organizational annual notification responsibilities are met; acts as Liaison between Instructional Services and Business services to ensure full compliance with all federal and state categorical requirements.

In general, this position will work a hybrid schedule of 3 days at our office in Carmichael, CA and 2 days from home. However, depending upon the needs of the department this schedule is subject to change.

We have a very generous, competitive benefits package that includes 100% employer-paid Medical/Dental/Vision (single), Retirement (CalPERS), Vacation days, Sick days and Holiday (22 which includes 2 weeks of paid time off over the holiday season).

REQUIREMENTS:

A four year college degree from an accredited university in business, accounting or financial management or related field.
A Masters In Business Administration is highly desirable.
Minimum of three years of experience leading and/or managing staff in achieving organizational objectives.
Increasingly responsible experience in math, business, accounting or other related fields including systems testing, data collection and analysis, preferably in a K-12 educational setting.
Previous public and/or charter school experience is highly desirable.
Project Management certification and/or experience is highly desirable.

Please attach a resume, 2 letters of reference (required by external and internal candidates), and a cover letter detailing your experience which qualifies you for the position.

CHARACTERISTICS OF THE CLASS

Under general direction, analyzes, prepares, audits, monitors and performs complex work in the development, control and analysis of the Visions enrollment data and systems, student assessment, special education fiscal matters, and student information systems; responsible for supervision of enrollment services, assessment and evaluation staff, team of business analysts, supervision of staff and use of time/talents; serves as a department liaison with Technology Department staff reviewing procedures, processes and software to promote efficiency; directs and coordinates educational research and evaluation including analysis and interpretation of various internal metrics, systems and data; responsible for supporting special education integration with SEIS and our student information systems, related state reporting related to data collected and managed within our various information systems. In addition, serves as Project manager for Charter renewal process, annual LCAP compliance, WASC accreditation process, annual SARC reporting; responsible for ensuring organizational Board Policies are kept current, ensuring that all organizational annual notification responsibilities are met; acts as Liaison between Instructional Services and Business services to ensure full compliance with all federal and state categorical requirements.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

Any one position may not include all the duties listed nor do all the listed examples include all tasks that may be found in positions of this class.

Participates in the development of efficient processes and procedures related to posting, editing and reporting student enrollment, enrollment metrics, enrollment projects and staffing.
Initiates and participates in the research, collection, and compilation of data for reports, projections and estimates.
Creates, reviews, analyzes and audits financial data, reports related to enrollment processing, special education fiscal matters, enrollment staff productivity metrics, SEIS system integration and reporting, student enrollment data to ensure completeness, accuracy and compliance with policies, procedures and other state & federal reporting requirements.
Coordinates in the preparation and audit of weekly enrollment information, special education fiscal matters and relevant reconciliations.
Coordinates annual reports to Senior leadership regarding compliance with annual notifications, title funding compliance,
Leads annual process to have consultants audit our Board Policies and required notifications to ensure full compliance with all applicable laws and regulations.
Acts as Project manager to support WASC accreditation with other organizational leaders.
Acts as Project manager with development of annual LCAP reporting requirements.
Acts as Project manager with other organizational leaders on all matters related to Charter renewal.
Develops, analyzes, evaluates, maintains and audits internal controls on enrollment processing and staff performance metrics to ensure enrollment goals are met.
Partners with Human Resources to provide recruitment/selection processes, professional supervisory practices, address employee questions/issues, and handle complaints and investigations that comply with employment laws and school policies, procedures and regulations.
Participates with various meetings as required for the areas of responsibility.
Manage staff and staffing needs.
Mentors, guides and trains assigned staff to ensure department and customer service goals are achieved and that leadership and teamwork are developed and practiced.
Serves as a liaison with management and staff to coordinate enrollment, staffing matters, student assessment matters, ensure compliance with pupil teacher ratios, ensure staffing needs are aligned with enrollment goals, ensure special education fiscal matters, procedures, processes, tracking and reporting are in full compliance with best practices and fiscally compliant.
Serves as a liaison with Non-Public Agencies to ensure special education invoicing and service logging are in full compliance with best practices and fiscally compliant.
Identifies and recommends policy and procedural improvements and suggestions for organizational effectiveness to management.
Develops training materials for student enrollment, student assessment and reporting procedures and processes.
Oversees the development and presentation of students testing data to staff and other stakeholders, and ensures appropriate student assessment training is delivered to administrative staff and teachers on reading and understanding test score results and how it impacts the student.
Prepares graphs, diagrams, and charts for statistical analysis and makes presentations at workshops and training sessions as required.
Ensures Assessment and Evaluation Manager works with instructional administrators for assistance in the selection of test site coordinators and proctors.
Ensures Assessment and Evaluation Manager manages and tracks all technology assets under supervision.
Acts as a liaison (or assigns a designee) between Visions and the San Juan Unified School District with regards to student assessment, charter renewal and SEIS reporting and reconciliations.
Assists and provides input in the development of various software applications related to Visions’ student information system and other related systems as necessary.
Runs reports and performs tests on student enrollment, special education, student assessment and related data and processes to verify accuracy of student records in the system(s) and to identify system errors; consults with the Technology Department and other stakeholders to ensure accuracy.
Trains department staff on the use of a variety of data systems.
Reviews, develops and/or writes policies and procedures related to student attendance, SEIS reporting and department functions.
Provides leadership efforts to manage student information and other related systems; system configuration, user access management, training, etc.
Monitors and reviews federal, state and district student and school data: 1) To ensure accuracy and compliance with program procedures and regulations. 2) To communicate indicators of program success and areas needing improvement on a regular basis. 3) To review data, make informed predictions, and offer recommendations to address schoolwide program improvement.
Manage Student Information System(SIS) extracts in support of improved reporting, practices and systemization.
Works with the Executive team to report out internal reviews of various internal departments.
May act as project manager for internal reviews of various internal departments systems, processes and workflows to promote best practices and organizational optimization.
Assist with management of relationship with SIS and other related vendors
Responsible for the configuration of SIS from user perspective (new processes, assignment of permissions, account creation, Lead CT and staff training with new system.
Manage, support permissions for users in SIS, SEIS, Launchpad and related systems.
Manage all efforts regarding Independent reporting requirements: 1) Student Assessment, 2) SEIS/Student Information System Integration, 3) Integration with internal/external systems related to areas of responsibility, 4) Reporting requirements: a) TOMS integration, b) SEIS integration, c) Enrollment, d) Special Education fiscal matters
Keeps informed on trends and changes in legislation applicable to charter school management/operations, student assessment, enrollment management, technology and data management and makes recommendations for change.
Provides additional support /training for staff development.
Attends meetings, in-service training, workshops, classes and conferences relating to areas of responsibility.
Supervises, manages and trains the Enrollment Services Manager, Assessment and Evaluation Manager, analysts and related staff.
Provides oversight and management of Enrollment Services, Student Assessment, special education fiscal matters and related processes and systems.
Maintains confidentiality.
Performs other duties as assigned.

QUALIFICATIONS-EDUCATION, TRAINING AND EXPERIENCE:

A four year college degree from an accredited university in business, accounting or financial management or related field.
A Masters In Business Administration is highly desirable.
Minimum of three years of experience leading and/or managing staff in achieving organizational objectives.
Increasingly responsible experience in math, business, accounting or other related fields including systems testing, data collection and analysis, preferably in a K-12 educational setting.
Previous public and/or charter school experience is highly desirable.
Project Management certification and/or experience is highly desirable.

SKILLS, KNOWLEDGE AND ABILITIES:

Knowledge of or ability to learn, interpret and apply Visions’ objectives, policies, procedures, rules, regulations and operations.
Knowledge of or ability to learn and use applicable sections of the California Education Code, charter law and other pertinent laws.
Skill and ability to think strategically while having the skills to handle day-to-day details and problems.
Skill and ability to use logical, systematic thinking while managing multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment and subject to frequent interruptions.
Skill and ability to participate in strategic business planning with management and others.
Strong organizational, planning, management, partnering and team building skills.
Skill and ability to plan, organize, coordinate and prioritize workload, handle multiple tasks simultaneously, work under pressure, work with priorities/deadlines subject to changes and frequent interruptions and maintain quality and quantity of work with a high degree of accuracy.
Ability to provide innovative recommendations/solutions.
Skill in collaborative problem-solving.
Ability to motivate and train others.
Strong communications skills both verbal and written to present complex/controversial ideas and recommendations in a clear and concise manner.
Ability to effectively articulate policies and programs, demonstrate ability to resolve concerns/questions, while using tact and diplomacy.
Ability to facilitate meetings, present information and develop and deliver presentations.

Ability to be flexible and work in a changing environment.
Ability to work confidentially with discretion.
Knowledge, skill and ability to use a wide variety of office equipment including but not limited to: personal computers, associated software programs, e-mail, Internet, copiers, calculators, and telephones.

OTHER QUALIFICATIONS:

Willingness to work irregular hours/days including evenings, weekends, holidays, and on-call for emergencies.

Job Description:

SQL Database QA/QC Manager – Laramie, WY

Trihydro, one of the top environmental and engineering consulting firms in the country, has an opening for a SQL database QA/QC manager. The role is a part of our Air and Process Services Team and assists with reviewing and analyzing leak detection and repair (LDAR) data and extending data with third-party sources. If you have database experience and enjoy working with collaborative teams, we encourage you to apply.
As a SQL database QA/QC manager, you will work with the LDAR QA/QC team to use different software applications, regularly use SQL Server Management Studio (SSMS), and read and understand environmental air quality regulations to assess data accuracy and quality. You will also serve as a liaison for routine and ad-hoc data reporting requests and provide first-line-of-support LDAR software help desk functions.
The preferred candidate will be based in our Laramie, WY office. However, remote options may be considered.
We are looking for someone who has:
Extensive experience with SSMS and ad-hoc query writing
Experience formulating efficient T-SQL queries, views, and stored procedures to prepare data reports
The ability to read, understand, and verify data in a variety of formats
A knack for business process improvement to keep pace with an evolving industry
Proficiency in Microsoft Office programs such as Excel, Word, and Outlook
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Attention to detail and accuracy
Time management and organization skills
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills to interact effectively with team members
Positive employment history with a demonstrated commitment to safe work practices
Dependable work practices with the ability to excel in a team environment
This job is for you if:
You desire career-growth opportunities and are interested in playing an integral role in a growing team and company.
You value working with others to achieve goals that make a difference to our clients and our communities.
You assume ownership of your work and take pride in producing high-quality deliverables.
At Trihydro, our approach to work is professional, honest, and dedicated. You’ll find a company culture that is committed to excellence, nurtures collaboration and growth, and still finds plenty of time for fun—often outdoors. Some of the benefits of joining our team include:
Comprehensive health insurance (medical, dental, vision, and prescription)
401(k) retirement plan, including a discretionary 6% match by Trihydro
Generous paid time off including vacation, flex, sick, holiday, and paid family leave
Wellness program, including reimbursement for a gym membership or related expenses
Staff mentoring and opportunities for professional growth
Trihydro is humbled to have received an honorable mention in Outside Magazine’s “Best Places to Work” list. Our 500+ professionals work on meaningful environmental and engineering projects that make a difference for clients and communities. Trihydro’s offices extend from Alaska to Florida, and our team members live and work within minutes of outdoor recreation. As a team of geologists, engineers, ecologists, and scientists, our culture is rooted in a love for the outdoors.

Beam Suntory is Crafting the Spirits that Stir the World. Rooted in two centuries of family heritage, Beam Suntory has evolved into the world's third largest leading premium spirits company ... where each employee is treated like family and trusted with legacy. With our greatest assets - our premium spirits and our people - we're driving growth through impactful marketing, innovation and an entrepreneurial spirit. Beam Suntory is a place where you can come Unleash your Spirit by making an impact each and every day.




The following position is open in Chicago, IL., - Data Scientist - Supply Planning




What makes this a great opportunity?




As a world leader in premium spirits, Beam Suntory inspires human connections. Consumers from all corners of the globe call for the company's brands, including the iconic Jim Beam and Maker's Mark Bourbon brands, Suntory Whisky Kakubin and Courvoisier Cognac, as well as world renowned premium brands including Knob Creek, Basil Hayden's and Legent Bourbon; Yamazaki, Hakushu, Hibiki and Toki Japanese Whisky; Teacher's, Laphroaig and Bowmore Scotch Whisky; Canadian Club Whisky; Hornitos and Sauza Tequila; EFFEN, Haku and Pinnacle Vodka; and Sipsmith and Roku Gin.




Beam Suntory was created in 2014 by combining the world leader in bourbon and the pioneer in Japanese whisky to form a new company with a deep heritage, passion for quality, innovative spirit and vision of Growing for Good. Headquartered in Chicago, Illinois, Beam Suntory is a subsidiary of Suntory Holdings Limited of Japan. Our culture is anchored deeply in a set of core values, including our East-Meets-West Culture, Yatte Minahare spirit, Giving Back to Society, Delighting Consumers, responsibly and Embracing Diversity & Inclusion.




Role Responsibilities




The Data Scientist – Supply Planning role combines a background in Sales & Operations Planning (Integrated Business Planning - IBP) with a deep understanding of data science. The Data Scientist will be self-motivated and exhibit excellent critical thinking skills, the ability to synthesize complex problems and create solutions. The ideal candidate will have more than just knowledge or skill set, as they also have a “can do" and “we over me” mindset to find solutions. This position will collaborate with the Supply Planning Analytics, S&OP CoE and Leadership, Regional S&OP teams, IT, and Commercial in the BUs across all three global regions to support the data and analytics needs for the implementation of the business transformation program.




CORE RESPONSIBILITIES

Partner with Global S&OP functional areas (Supply Planning, Commercial, and Fulfillment) to optimize our processes as part of the Global Supply Planning team.
Implement process improvement initiatives that drive improvements to the metrics and streamline the Supply Chain
Utilize a diverse array of technologies and tools as needed, to deliver insights, optimize processes, and develop automation
Manage the analytics platform, build capabilities, support global user adoption of analytics and process adherence, develop and maintain technical documentation; work closely with IT for Data Engineering
Work closely with the technical community to drive an SAP IBP team of business users globally, allowing for internal problem-solving capabilities, a high degree of end-user acceptance
Partner with the business to understand the market segmentation strategies and develop visualization, models using machine learning (e.g. classification, clustering, regression) incorporating ABC-XYZ segmentation, and statistical analysis methods such as time-series analysis, statistical inference
Desgin and integrate a global Inventory Management to provide end-to end Supply Chain visibility to Deep dive large into demand/supply planning and supply chain data to explain change, develop insights, and provide business recommendations to improve attainment, adherence, inventory management , and other key metrics.
Perform exploratory data analyses, generate and test working hypotheses, prepare and analyze historical data, and identify patterns
Lead and mentor a team of data scientists, and analysts
Process structured, unstructured and semi-structured data and apply data cleaning



Qualifications & Experience

Advanced Degree or equivalent experience in Operations Research, Industrial Engineering, Statistics, Applied Mathematics
3-5+ years of experience with at least 2+ years in experience in a supply chain discipline with demonstrated End to End understanding of Supply Chain interdependencies for a CPG or Spirits company.
Excellent problem solving, analytical, written and verbal communication skills across many levels of the organization.
communications and presenting to senior leadership.
Experience with S&OP Planning tools like SAP IBP, SAP APO (DP and SNP) highly preferred
Experience with Google Cloud Platform, SAP HANA strongly preferred
Strong experience with Python/R, SQL, Power BI, Tableau
Experience with operations research, statistics, linear programming, constraint programming. 3+ years of hands-on experience in developing and deploying optimization, predictive and prescriptive, machine learning models
Ability to use collaborative programming tools like Git
Ability to manage multiple projects and prioritize competing requirements




At Beam Suntory, people are our number one priority, and we believe our people grow together in diverse and inclusive environments where their unique insights, experiences and backgrounds are valued and respected. 63911BR
Orthopedic Surgery and Research

Job Posting Description

The Musculoskeletal Informatics Group (https://www.musculoskeletal.ai/) in the Department of Orthopedic Surgery at Boston Children's Hospital and Harvard Medical School has an immediate opening for a motivated Research Assistant (RA) to work with a multidisciplinary team of biomedical engineers, orthopedic surgeons, and computer and data scientists to develop Natural Language Processing (NLP)-based tools for processing medical records. This role contributes to the development of centralized patient database and disease specific registries. This opportunity is primarily focused on translational research with immediate impact on clinical care of patients with a range of musculoskeletal conditions, through publication of novel findings and development of computational tools used by clinicians.

Principal Duties and Responsibilities

Use machine learning approaches (e.g., natural language processing) to process clinical notes. Develop algorithms to pre-process the clinical data for development of machine learning pipelines. Develop machine learning pipelines to assist risk and outcomes prediction.
Development of patient selection and text extraction pipelines, and development and fine tuning of negation and new entity recognition algorithms. Conduct literature searches and reviews, compiling information for journals and suggesting uses for new techniques to the P.I. Attends courses, lectures and conferences to further own knowledge of research and laboratory techniques, consulting with other researchers and technicians to exchange information.
Assist in the process of data collection and analysis using varied instrumentation and software; provide proper documentation and organization to ensure integrity and organization of collected data.
Apply basic statistical knowledge; understand, interpret, and describe complex data by preparing graphs and tables.
Participate in the preparation, review, and submission of manuscripts and abstracts for publication.

Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree
Experience in NLP feature engineering and modeling (e.g., text classification, entity recognition, entity extraction, question answering)
Experience with SoTA modeling techniques (such as transformers, BERT, etc)
Experience taking an NLP project from concept to production
Building deep neural networks with modern tools, such as PyTorch or Tensorflow
Expertise with Python
One Journal publication or peer-reviewed conference paper or projects with public code repositories
Research experience and practical knowledge of research principles is required whether through previous internship, work experience, or coursework. Experience with healthcare datasets is a plus
Excellent critical thinking skills are required.
Work requires the ability to communicate effectively both orally and in writing.

Job Description:

We are looking for a detail-oriented Data Entry Specialist to join our Venue Research team in Henderson, Nevada.

Who We Are

In 2007, two pretty sharp brothers decided to bootstrap a new business venture using their poker winnings to fund it. A week before inception, one brother got a fox red Labrador retriever puppy and named him Red. He quickly became the center of their universe and the name Red Dog Media was officially born.

Today, Red Dog Media focuses on internet marketing; specifically performance marketing, search engine marketing, landing page optimization, and conversion rate optimization. What started with four employees has grown to over 40 people over the past 15 years.

Culture + Core Values

Our core values are woven throughout our entire interview process in order to gauge whether a candidate is a good cultural fit. There are several initiatives that keep the core values at the forefront of our culture. A few examples are: being discussed in 6 month reviews; our employee appreciation program; and being an integrated part of our company’s operating system.

Our Core Values:

Be Curious - Having a high level of engagement; Digging into problems; Not being satisfied with good enough; Being open to new ideas; Not being a know-it-all.

Be a Problem Solver - This is what separates the doers from the dreamers. It’s about executing and getting the important stuff done. A problem solver prioritizes, organizes, and simplifies. They are detail-oriented to make sure it's done right.

Be a Championship Teammate - While a "team player" is collegial, a champion teammate is much more. They have the drive to succeed, work hard, come prepared, hold themselves accountable to high standards, elevate those around them, and are coachable.

Be Better Than Yesterday - Do you bring more skills to the table today than a year ago? How do you plan to be better a year from now? We work in a fast-paced competitive industry. If we stagnate, we’ll get left behind. This applies at the company and personal level. Growth and improvement need not be only in technical skill sets; personal growth can be even more valuable. We embrace positive change and stretch ourselves to grow both personally and professionally.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Job Functions

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential function of the job satisfactorily.

% TIME

•

Data Analytics - Support the design, development and use of advanced data analytics and tools to meet customer and business needs. Analyze data, formulate and communicate insights. Perform basic analysis of large and diverse datasets, such as advanced metering data, hydro operational data, etc. Programmatically evaluate noisy data and develop automated analytics processes. Explore data sources, processes, uses and definition. Clean, process and translate data into model designs that are tested, refined, moved to production and maintained.

40%

•

Business Intelligence - Support the design, development and use of new and existing business intelligence processes and reporting tools. Conduct quality assurance checks. Create recurring reports. Develop reporting dashboards. Perform ad-hoc requests as assigned, etc. Provide direct support of business intelligence tools, data environment, performance reporting metrics, and financial data cubes. Test, monitor, validate and publish business intelligence content.

25%

•

Reporting, Communications & Collaboration - Perform basic ad-hoc requests, including data analytics, reporting needs, and process improvements and automations. Provide data analytics insights and expertise and actively participate on Data Analytics and Business Intelligence core team. Collaboratively work and communicate with members of cross-functional teams and internal stakeholders.

20%

•

Project Teams - Participates on project teams performing individual assignments. Coordinates and facilitates project team meetings. May lead data analytics, business intelligence initiative, or research efforts of a limited nature.

15%

Additional Responsibilities

•

Maintain regular and predictable attendance: Perform related duties and responsibilities as required. Comply with District policies. Complete all required training. Maintain a working knowledge and comply with District safety procedures and specific safety requirements of this position, and those in accordance with applicable provisions of the Revised Code of Washington (RCW) and Washington Administrative Code (WAC). Employees with access to confidential employee records and information are required to restrict access from any unauthorized person, except on a need to know basis.

QUALIFICATIONS

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Data Analyst I: Post Secondary Education

in mathematics, engineering, business, information technology, management information systems, or related field required

The educational entry requirements are listed below. Equivalent experience (year for year) may substitute for required education.

in mathematics, engineering, business, information technology, management information systems, or related field required

Master's Degree Preferred

Minimum Experience

Minimum experience requirements are listed below. Experience requirements are additive to education requirements. Additional education may not substitute for experience.

Data Analyst I

This is the entry-level role in data analytics and business intelligence. College graduates with demonstrated skills in designing, developing, and implementing technology solutions to support user needs, data analytics, corporate performance reporting, and dashboards

Data Analyst II

3+ years progressively responsible experience in a data analytics or business intelligence role with demonstrated examples of designing, developing and implementing technology solutions to support user needs, complex data analytics, corporate performance reporting, and dashboards is required

Experience related to the area of the organization this role will support, such as asset management or hydro operations desired

Data Analyst III

5+ years progressively responsible experience in a data analytics or business intelligence role with demonstrated examples of designing, developing and implementing technology solutions to support user needs, complex data analytics, corporate performance reporting, and dashboards is required.

- Experience related to the area of the organization this role will support, such as asset management or hydro operations is desired.

Data Analyst Senior

7+ years progressively responsible experience in a data analytics or business intelligence role with demonstrated in-depth experience designing, developing and implementing technology solutions to support user needs, including complex data analytics in a variety of subjects, corporate performance reporting, and development of dashboards required

Experience related to the area of the organization this role will support, such as asset management or hydro operations preferred

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

•

Working knowledge of data analytics around large production data and operational datasets using a variety of techniques using mathematics and statistics.

•

Working knowledge of quantitative analysis and programming techniques.

•

Working knowledge of analytics, data mining, and data cleansing.

•

Knowledge of data warehousing/business intelligence best practices, methodologies, standards, and data architectures.

•

Knowledge of operating systems, relational database design, logical data modeling, data warehousing, and relational database management systems.

•

Familiarity with management decision making subjects and concepts, such as finance and accounting.

•

Familiarity with process improvement techniques such as six sigma or similar.

•

Strong interpersonal and teamwork skills to solve problems creatively.

•

Good communication skills that can effectively communicate complex subjects to a variety of audiences.

•

Strong customer service skills and orientation.

•

Detail oriented with a high level of intellectual curiosity.

•

Strong logic and reasoning skills.

•

Strong critical thinking skills.

•

Able to analyze data and issues in a disciplined, structured and analytical manner, and leverage various tools and techniques such as mathematics, statistics and data science to create solutions.

•

Able to formulate a solution to a business problem, translate it into requirements or quantitative terms using analytical tools, analyze the results, iteratively refine the solution and effectively communicate results.

•

Ability to translate user requests into functional and technical requirements and effectively communicate with both the end user and technical team.

•

Ability to utilize information in both quantitative and qualitative form to inform development of actions.

•

Able to identify and weigh strengths and weaknesses of alternative solutions.

•

•

•

Ability to work collaboratively on a team.

•

Ability and desire to solve problems and develop solutions.

•

Ability to accept constructive feedback.

•

Must enjoy the challenge and nuances of applying technology solutions to complex and often imperfect datasets.
