Purpose and Scope of Job:

Primarily responsible for planning level production flow in the Machine shop. Monitoring performance in individual cells compared with plan, and make adjustments as necessary, based on changing business needs. Analyzing production data to make recommendations for changes in materials and process management.

Essential Functions (other duties may be assigned:

Create weekly & monthly production plan for SMA’s manufacturing areas, using data from Sumitomo’s IT system, as well as input from other functional areas, such as Customer service, Distribution center, and Assembly planners.
Create & maintain customized schedules for each manufacturing area, with input from Manufacturing Engineering, Maintenance and Machine shop management.
Manage Make vs Buy queries (ME queue) with support from Manufacturing Engineering.
Periodically run a variety of reports to assist Machine shop management with identifying potential production problems and delays.

Data Analyst functions:

Analyze material usage expectations in the machine shop. Use this to make informed recommendations for planning, inventory control, & material purchasing decisions.
Assist Manufacturing management with analysis of tooling & supplies usage, as well as other targeted budget items.

Minimum Qualifications:

At least 6 years of data analysis and production planning experience, OR 4-year degree in Mechanical / Industrial Engineering / Mathematics or related field.
At least 4 years of daily experience in using MS Excel to analyze large amounts of data, and the ability to present such data in formats appropriate to groups with varying computer skills.
Ability to understand & interpret complex engineering drawings and GD&T.
Strong problem solving skills.

Work Conditions & Physical Environment:

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions.

Must have the ability to sit for extended periods of time; exhibit manual dexterity to dial a telephone, to enter data into a computer terminal/typewriter; to see and read a computer screen and printed material with or without vision aids; hear and understand speech at normal levels and on the telephone; speak in audible tones so that others may understand clearly in person and on the telephone; ability to

understand and follow oral and written instructions; physical agility to lift up to 50 pounds. The noise level in the work environment is usually very loud. This position is designated as safety- sensitive. (Referenced Document Number 218001, SMA’s Corporate Policies Procedure Manual, 33.0 Drug and Alcohol Use Policy).

Position Summary/Position

Under the direction of the Data Science Systems Manager, the Data Scientist II is responsible for modeling complex institutional problems, discovering insights and identifying opportunities using statistical, algorithmic, mining and visualization techniques. In addition to advanced analytic skills, this role is also proficient at integrating and preparing large, varied datasets, architecting specialized database, and computing environments, and communicating results.
Collaborating closely with Data Science Developers, this role will partner with our business stakeholders to identify ways to augment and enhance our data in order provide insight beyond what can be gleaned from the data we have today.

Major Functions (Duties and Responsibilities)

1. Lead and drive cross functional data science projects from beginning to end: build relationships with partner teams, frame and structure questions, collect and analyze data.
2. Apply descriptive and predictive analytics to help drive insights and business decisions.
3. Apply a diverse set of tactics such as statistics, quantitative reasoning, and machine learning to research and produce insights.
4. Work with data engineering and data solutions teams to ensure proper data tracking is set up for features and support debugging and development of new ETL processes.
5. Build deep-dive analyses and eventually machine learning models to better forecast risk across the portfolio for our contracts and claims activity.
6. Support business operations, finance, quality systems, and other internal teams by building analytics and reporting to understand overall business performance and increase organizational efficiencies
7. Manage tests for specific provider and generate data to build out case studies and messaging strategies.
8. Designs experiments, test hypotheses, and build models.
9. Conducts data analysis and moderately complex algorithm.
10. Works with Institute stakeholders to identify the business requirements and the expected outcome.
11. Works with and alongside business analysts by suggesting other products of interest to the client.

Job_title: Program & Data Manager - DBH Prevention & Education
Job_description:
Davis Behavioral Health (DBH) is seeking a full-time Program & Data Manager to oversee program planning, implementation, evaluation, and reporting for Prevention & Education efforts in Davis County. The ideal candidate possesses excellent communication skills, is meticulous, creative, and is a strong team player.

Essential Functions

The essential functions assigned to the Program & Data Manager include, but are not limited to the following:

Gather, track, evaluate, and report on Prevention & Education efforts on the program, coalition, and county levels.
Create visual materials such as print and digital marketing, reporting charts, and infographics to market programs and highlight effectiveness.
Write and report on grants to support the Prevention & Education efforts in Davis County
Work with the Prevention Coordinator to illustrate the significance of prevention to key stakeholders, and strategize how to continue to grow support, funding, and community reach.
Oversee and manage all aspects of scheduling, set up, facilitation, and follow-up for DBH sponsored Prevention & Education programs, as well as community events, on occasion.
Supervise program instructors and childcare staff, and provide them support, training, and professional development.
Coordinate with the Prevention Team regarding Prevention & Education programming needs across the county, as well as in individual schools and coalition areas.
Work with Diversity Coordinator regarding potential program barriers and solutions for diverse populations within Davis County

Preference may be given for candidates who use his/her own recovery experience and training to assist consumers.

Schedule

This position works in an office setting 40 hours per week. May be required to work occasional evening hours and weekends, as needed. Limited remote work may be allowed. There will be periodic travel required.

The successful candidate will primarily work a Monday through Friday day schedule but will be required to be flexible to attend required meetings, trainings, and other events associated with the role of Program and Data Manager as well as to oversee and supervise the prevention and education efforts, which mostly take place in the evening hours.

Compensation

The starting annual wage for the successful candidates is outlined below:

$55,000.00 per annum for candidates with a Master's degree (exempt FLSA status)
$21.00 per hour for candidates with a Bachelor's degree (non-exempt FLSA status)
Spanish-language incentive stipend (paid bi-weekly) available. Must pass a verbal Spanish-language proficiency assessment to qualify.

Under the direction of the Data Science Systems Manager, the Data Scientist II is responsible for modeling complex institutional problems, discovering insights and identifying opportunities using statistical, algorithmic, mining and visualization techniques. In addition to advanced analytic skills, this role is also proficient at integrating and preparing large, varied datasets, architecting specialized database, and computing environments, and communicating results.
Collaborating closely with Data Science Developers, this role will partner with our business stakeholders to identify ways to augment and enhance our data in order provide insight beyond what can be gleaned from the data we have today.

1. Lead and drive cross functional data science projects from beginning to end: build relationships with partner teams, frame and structure questions, collect and analyze data.

4. Work with data engineering and data solutions teams to ensure proper data tracking is set up for features and support debugging and development of new ETL processes.

Job_description:
Description
VP of Sales

The Vice President of Sales is responsible for acquiring new accounts and achieving overall revenue growth.
The position requires excellent communication skills including in-person, phone and writing skills.
The goal of this position is to offer clients and prospects a new perspective on how they can best utilize our SaaS solutions. This will be accomplished by having an in-depth understanding of an account’s business, what brings them value and leveraging that information to deliver an irresistible message.

Candidates will teach prospects about how our solutions will benefit them and will tailor their communication to suit different prospects. The candidate will demonstrate expert knowledge regarding our suite of products and services and their useful application across various Public Finance Capital
Markets participants, including the Sell-side and Buy-side.

The VP-Sales will manage the sales cycle from cold-calling through contract negotiation and closing, with a bit of ongoing client account management when needed.

This position works closely with, and will report to the President of the company.

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities

Networks and partners with customers - both over phone and in person - to build confidence and develop win/win solutions; proactively stays on top of additional sales opportunities while navigating through customer organizations, balances frequency of contact with potential for new sales.
Effectively manages the territory by allocating appropriate time to prioritize goals of managing renewals as well as developing both cross-sell and new business sales opportunities when needed.
Uses appropriate interpersonal skills to consistently build trust and confidence with users, key contacts, and internal resources; communicates and interacts effectively with internal

Operations and Product teams to achieve company revenue goals.

Exhibits solid knowledge of the Capital Markets, both Sell-side and Buy-Side, and has experience selling data, technology and software services into this marketplace, knowledge of Municipal

Bond Markets is a big plus.

Knowledge of Product Management Lifecycle and the effort required to bring new so lutions to market.

Responsibilities

Generate new business sales by in person visits, as well as phone and web meetings.
Demonstrate the value of products and solutions to both new prospects and existing clients
Obtains territory information regarding market intelligence and penetration
Manage and coordinate all customer-related issues
Uses Salesforce to manage sales cycle pipeline and participate in weekly sales performance reports discussions

LISCR, LLC, a Dulles, Virginia-based maritime international shipping company, is looking to complement its Commercial/Business Development Department by hiring a management level member who will use analytical skills, procedures and tools to support senior management with in-depth review of all areas of business operations and procedures. The Senior Manager, Data Analytics, is responsible for providing the necessary analysis for executive level management to improve the company’s competitiveness, profitability, growth, and performance across a broad spectrum of criteria.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

Competition Analysis

Analyze, the shipping industry for macro trends such as the economics of the world shipping fleet such as growth, newbuildings, scrapping, lag and lead economic indicators;
Predict opportunities for company growth, additional sources of revenue, and analysis of raw data to provide conclusions, presentations and graphs; and
Provide risk analysis for potential problems in the fleet, competitive analyses, as well as looking at business trends and attrition analysis that might present risk for the company.

Financial Analysis

Collaborate with C-Suite by conducting financial analysis of company’s budget, business and accounting ratios;.
Provides executive Dashboards; and
Provide high level financial forecasts.

Support Regional Offices

Lead the creation of price comparisons for regional managers with a focus to minimize the required discounts to win the business;
Lead the creation of China port due savings calculations and analysis;
Creates client Target lists for regional managers based on flags, countries and other target criteria;
Collaborate with the CRM team with the creation of reports to analyze the efficiency of the regional offices; and
Review and update business development goals by analyzing marketing/sales results and variances; identifying trends; recommending actions.

Goal setting for Regional offices

Set the annual regional office goals in regards to vessel registrations and new client’s acquisition;
Monitor the regional goals on a regular basis; and
Ensure that the regional offices receive the support and information required to reach the goals.

Strategic planning

Collaborate with C-Suite by helping to draft the strategic plan; and
Provides action items based on the strategic plan and ensures follow-up.

Other

Increase commercial department and company-wide productivity by developing automated applications; eliminating duplications; coordinating information requirements;
Provide detailed, and timely, information to management by assembling and summarizing data; preparing reports; making presentations of findings, analyses, and recommendations;
Performs other duties and projects as required; and
Acts as business consultant by managing and/or providing support to maritime, manning and corporate special projects.

General Qualification Guidelines:

Experience, Education and Certification

Undergraduate degree in business administration, finance or economics; Master’s degree preferred
Further qualifications such as CFA, CPA
Five years of experience in finance, economics or business consulting
Project management experience preferred
Maritime industry experience preferred

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

Economic forecasting and financial analysis skills
Understand budgets and basic accounting principles
Ability to enter and retrieve data from both Access and Oracle system
Project management skills
Adequate understanding of the maritime industry, seafarer manning and offshore corporate registries
Be service-minded, self-motivated and detail oriented
Ability to operate as a team leader and work in a team environment
Ability to organize and prioritize work, delegate effectively and meet deadlines
Be an effective written and verbal communicator with ability to develop and present promotional information in a business environment
Proficient knowledge of Microsoft Office applications (with expert/very high level of ability in Excel) and use of general office equipment
Speak, write and understand English
Able to lift approximately 15 – 20 lbs

LISCR, LLC offers a complete benefit package and generous leave policy. Compensation is commensurate with experience. Please submit your resume and a cover letter indicating your compensation requirements via this posting. LISCR is an E-Verify employer. EOE

Job_title: Adjunct Instructor for Data Science Courses
Job_description:
Adjunct Instructor for Data Science Courses

Supervisor: Dean and/or Chair

Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

Develops and teaches Computer Science courses in Data Science, Machine Learning, and AI at graduate level. Desirable candidates should have experience in teaching courses related to these areas.
Teaches students effectively and maintains office hours for student consultation in accordance with procedures outlined by SFBU.
Provides students with a written course syllabus that are in compliance with SFBU requirements.
Participates in program-level learning assessment. Participation includes helping articulate learning outcomes, choosing/administering measures, evaluating student performance, and suggesting changes to improve student learning.
Maintains accurate and complete course records to meet required accreditation standards.
Performs professional activities and assumes professional responsibilities as agreed upon with the school dean and works with colleagues to achieve shared goals and visions.
Uses knowledge of diverse communities and learning styles and can incorporate a diversity of delivery of such learning styles in instruction.
Utilizes technology to facilitate learning and access data, maintain records, generate reports, and communicate with others.
Meets teaching assignments in accordance with the System’s calendar and contractual obligations.
Complies with SFBU board policy, state and federal policy, and the faculty code of conduct as appropriate.
Serves on and attends university committees as assigned.
Attends and participates in the Faculty Assembly meetings. Contributes to the initiatives led by the Faculty Assembly or the Academics Administrative Team.
Attends departmental, divisional, and college-wide meetings where appropriate or as required by supervisor.
Participates in his/her own professional development plan. Plans must be created by the third week of the first semester taught in a calendar year. Progress must be supplied prior to the end of each semester taught
Remains current in academic or program discipline, including maintaining licensure, certification, or continuing education requirements where appropriate.
Receives training or stay current in technological or pedagogical advances that promote student learning.
Promotes the college in the community by participating in a variety of marketing activities.
Be available to students via email, phone, or personal (or virtual) conferences. The method of contact and hours of availability should be clearly communicated to supervisors and to students through the course syllabus each trimester.
Assign grades and maintain course/student records in accordance with SFBU policies and submit grades and records by the established deadlines.

Job Requirements and Qualifications:

· Prepare the course syllabus and teach the assigned course(s), usually 3 hours per week.

· Expertise in subjects related to Data Science, Machine Learning, and Artificial Intelligence. Work experience in these areas is required.

Have a good understanding of best practices and pedagogy for leading in-person, online, and hybrid course environments.
Demonstrate ability to promote academic integrity.
Position requires excellent communication, presentation, and teaching skills.
Must possess the ability to follow university, federal, and state policies and regulations.
Must possess the ability to, and genuine interest in helping the students, and sensitivity to, and understanding of, the diverse academic, socioeconomic, and cultural/ethnic backgrounds of the students.

Education and Experience:

Master’s degree in a field related to Data Science, Machine Learning, and AI.
Experience in teaching relevant Computer Science subjects at the graduate level preferably using Python programming language.
Three years of professional experience using skills related to these subjects
Experience in teaching courses, conducting professional training, or lecturing/presenting to groups of people

Preferred

Doctoral degree in a field related to Data Science, Machine Learning, and AI
Able to commute to SFBU campus (Fremont, CA) to deliver lectures in person (typically, one day each week for 3 hours per course).
At least five years of professional experience and two (or more) years of experience in teaching Computer Science courses at the graduate/advanced level
Knowledgeable in setting up and utilizing the Canvas LMS (learning management system) in teaching courses

Physical Characteristics:

Must be able to lift and carry up to 20 lbs.
The employee is required to crouch, walk, reach, grasp, carry, and push.
The employee is occasionally required to sit or stand for long periods.

This job description is not a contract between SFBU and the employee. SFBU has the right to change the employee’s job duties at its discretion.

Hamilton College invites applications for the position of Data Science/Analysis Research Librarian in the Library and Information Technology Services (LITS). The Data Science/Analysis Research Librarian will provide research support and introduce cutting-edge data analysis tools and methodologies to LITS patrons as a member of the Research and Instructional Design (R&ID) Team where research and technology experts work together to support faculty and students with research and teaching. The R&ID Team provides an inclusive, respectful, and responsive service point, works collaboratively to meet exciting research challenges, supports learning communities, and introduces and facilitates the use of innovative technologies through consultation and instruction.

In addition, the Data Science/Analysis Research Librarian will focus on assisting a diverse audience of social science faculty and students with collection or creation, processing, and analysis of data. The Data Science/Analysis Research Librarian will refer or work with others in LITS and with LITS partners to support visualization, preservation, access, and reuse of data with the purpose of informing social science research and helping undergraduate students understand important social science concepts.

We are seeking a creative and analytical individual who enjoys variety in their work, thrives on working with others to solve challenging data-related problems, and is committed to lifelong teaching and learning of data analysis and technical skills. The position will serve as library liaison to one or more academic departments, based on data analysis needs and the individual’s educational background.

Responsibilities Include:

Research, Teaching, and Learning Support:

Actively participate in supporting diversity, equity, and inclusion in the Hamilton community.
Provide research support to the Hamilton faculty and students in the social sciences, members of the public, and the larger scholarly community.
Collaborate with faculty, educational technologists, and other academic partners to provide instructional design support and promote digital and information literacy in the social sciences and across the curriculum.
Serve as primary liaison to assigned academic departments, programs, and academic resource centers.
Participate in the ongoing training and mentoring of the R&ID student tutors.
Build collections in multiple formats to support the academic goals of the college.
Maintain and apply a current awareness of best practices in teaching and learning, especially as related to data analysis and digital and information fluencies.
Develop and maintain library resource guides for faculty and students.
Engage in a variety of professional development activities.
Participate in other duties and responsibilities as assigned.

Data Science/Data Analysis:

Uses advanced skills with data analysis, data cleaning/wrangling/normalization, regular expressions, web scraping, and APIs to support and collaborate with researchers on data-related research.
Retrieve/manipulate complex data from a variety of sources; transfer data between platforms for use in multiple computing environments.
Work closely with and provide direct assistance to students in data science/analysis including workshops or other instruction.
Assists with in-class instruction of statistic-based labs in the social sciences.
Assist students with research projects and course assignments that require data analysis.
Works collaboratively with others in LITS and with LITS partners such as the Quantitative & Symbolic Reasoning Center (QSR), Oral Communication Center (OCC), and the Writing Center.
Assist in the choice, application, and interpretation of quantitative research methods, and with the use of statistical software needed to implement these methods.
Works consistently to enhance technical skills and develop proficiency with new data analysis tools and techniques.
Develops services in response to needs of faculty and students in the social sciences, LITS priorities, and diverse Hamilton populations.
Build effective working relationships with faculty and students.
Identifies, evaluates and recommends new and emerging data analysis research tools and methods for social science students and faculty, and LITS.
Qualifications
ALA-accredited master’s degree in Library or Information Science, and/or related advanced degree in quantitative social science; extensive coursework in economics and econometrics.
Equivalent combination of education, training, and experience will be considered.
Experience conducting social science research at the graduate level.
Experience providing data-related services in a library or research setting, either one-on-one or in a classroom setting.
Intermediate to expert experience with R and STATA; experience with SPSS and SAS highly desirable.
Proficiency with at least one programming language (such as Python or Java) highly desirable.
Demonstrated advanced data skills, including data cleaning/wrangling/normalization, using regular expressions, and web scraping.
Knowledge of software and tools supporting the discovery, management, analysis, and visualization of research data; including keeping abreast of current and emerging trends.
Proficiency using tools and programming libraries to support text analysis.
Experience working effectively with a team to plan and complete projects.
Demonstrated ability to work with diverse populations as well as demonstrated commitment to diversity, inclusion, and accessibility.

Job-related qualifications representing the knowledge, skills, and attributes an individual needs to possess in order to perform the job in a satisfactory manner.

Demonstrated ability and experience functioning successfully in a fast-paced environment with a strong service orientation.
Ability to work collegially and communicate effectively with colleagues, faculty, and students.
In-depth knowledge of a wide range of information sources and technologies, especially data science/analysis.
Superior teaching skills.
Curiosity about how technology is affecting research and teaching, and enthusiasm for collaboration with faculty and students in a liberal arts context.
Excellent writing, problem-solving, and presentation skills.
Demonstrated aptitude for quickly learning new tools and technologies.
Application Instructions

Please submit a cover letter, resume and contact information for three professional references. Please address your cover letter to Dr. Nhora Serrano, Associate Director for Digital Innovation, Learning and Research. In your cover letter, please describe your experiences with diversity and inclusion and your potential to support Hamilton's commitment to the same. Consideration of candidates will begin March 20th, 2023 and continue until the position is filled.

LITS is committed to creating an accessible, supportive environment and an educational experience that recognizes diversity and cultural competence as integral components of academic excellence. Candidates who can contribute to that goal are encouraged to apply and to identify their strengths in this area.

Hamilton College (www.hamilton.edu) is a residential liberal arts college located in the Mohawk Valley of upstate New York. Applicants with dual-career considerations can find other Hamilton and nearby academic job listings at www.upstatenyherc.org, as well as additional information at https://www.hamilton.edu/dof/faculty-development/resources-for-prospective-or-new-faculty/opportunities-for-spouses-or-partners (Opportunities for Spouses or Partners).

To apply to this job, click Apply Now

Data Center Customer Operations Technician

Equinix is the world’s digital infrastructure company, operating 245+ data centers across the globe and providing interconnections to all the key clouds and networks. Businesses need one place to simplify and bring together fragmented, complex infrastructure that spans private and public cloud environments. Our global platform allows customers to place infrastructure wherever they need it and connect it to everything they need to succeed.

We are a fast-growing global company with 80 quarters of growth. Through our innovative portfolio of high-performance products and services, we have created the largest, most active global ecosystem of 10,000+ companies, including 2,000+ networks and 3,000 cloud and IT service providers in 32 countries spanning six continents.

Joining our operations team means that you will be at the forefront of all we do, maintaining critical facilities infrastructure as part of a close-knit team delivering best-in-class service to our data center customers. We embrace diversity in thought and contribution and are committed to providing an equitable work environment. that is foundational to our core values as a company and is vital to our success.

Job Summary

Data Centers are considered Critical Facilities. This means that we support hospitals, laboratories, public safety centers. Simply put - We cannot go dark. In this crucial role, you will be responsible for fixing and installing sophisticated circuits and performing custom installations.

Responsibilities

ACUPOLL Precision Research is a 30+ year market research firm that leverages innovative market research survey methods to drive client innovation and marketing success, so clients, their companies, and their communities thrive. We’ve maintained strong growth for several years by offering a wide variety of research solutions that delight our clients large and small across consumer products, health care, private equity, consulting, and other industries. We’ve helped nine clients achieve Top 10 U.S. launches in recent years. Our culture is friendly, casual, non-bureaucratic, and hard-working with current employees averaging 10+ years with the company. Employees work from home 4 days/week (local employees are a plus).

The Role- Asst. Director- Operations & Analytics

We are looking for an experienced data enthusiast to assist our VP in the group responsible for creating research reports- tabulating data, creating visuals, and any advanced analyses- without having to write analyses or manage clients. This role primarily handles in-depth or more complex research reports, but also helps the VP to lead important strategic initiatives, automation, and other efforts across the department.

Specific responsibilities include:

Developing the best data analysis plan for research projects to address client learning needs
Accurate and expeditious survey data review, compilation, and tabulation
Application of advanced research techniques/analyses to provide greater insight, both those developed by ACUPOLL as well as any additional techniques you can contribute
In collaboration with the Account Manager (who writes the questionnaire and verbal report analysis), creation and editing of Powerpoint reports and at times dashboards, that most effectively communicate the story and learnings to clients and ensures all project objectives are met
Survey programming as needed and skill set allows
Working with the VP to lead projects in process improvement, standardization, visualization, training, analytics development, and/or other areas

This job is for you if you are/have:

Must have experience working in a market research/insights role where survey research is your primary focus
Experienced (5+ years) in advanced market research survey tabulation software and creating Powerpoint reports/visuals
Proven leadership and analytic skills to manage complex studies and lead training and initiatives within the group
Strong people and communication skills to work with a diverse team
Familiar with a variety of research study types (e.g. concept/package/ad testing, idea/messaging/claims screening and optimization, A&Us, tracking/brand health, segmentation, etc.) and a variety of analytic techniques (e.g. MaxDiff, TURF, Discrete Choice/Conjoint, Drivers Analysis, etc.)
Desiring a career in the operations and analytics space
Demonstrated success as an efficient/high-volume producer able to juggle 3-4 projects simultaneously
Positive attitude, great work ethic, attention to detail, responsiveness, effective communicator, commitment to delivering for the client and team, and passion for continuous constructive improvement

Experience with SPSS or other analytic software, Sawtooth, Forsta/Confirmit programming/visualization, or Visual Basic is a plus

The benefits of working with us:

Competitive base compensation and bonus
Health, dental, and vision insurance
Work from home flexibility (1 day/week in-office required on-going, 2 days/week during on-boarding)
Competitive PTO, holidays including 4 day weekends for Memorial Day, July 4th, and Labor Day
Wide variety of research in a mid-size, collaborative company that constantly works to advance/innovate for clients

Established for over 50 years, Yamazen Inc. is a leading importer and distributor of quality CNC manufacturing solutions, including machine tools, automation/robotics, injection molding machines, metalworking products, repair parts and service. Headquartered in Elk Grove Village, IL with 13 regional technical centers across the US, we service manufacturers in the automotive, aerospace, construction equipment, medical, and I.T. industries.

Yamazen has an immediate opening for a Master Data Specialist. This position will be responsible for the creation and maintenance of Master Data that are fundamental to business processes that touch and influence the customer experience. Also responsible to build a policy and a procedure for master data entry and updates. Relevant systems and processes include, but are not limited to, ERP, eCommerce, WMS, and CRM. This position will work closely with managers from various departments, Business Process Key Users and everyday users of these systems to execute data creation and maintenance processes to meet the expected service and quality levels.

Collect and validate data identified on requests for creation and maintenance
Process, update, and distribute newly created materials, data records, and results
Seek a high degree of accuracy and efficiency with master data requests; process requests in accordance with current master data standards and processes
Share suggestions for process improvement and effective enhancements in support of an enhanced customer experience
Support ad hoc efforts to mass create or change master data in support of new product launches, business process changes, or other project work
Process mass changes utilizing master data procedures
Help to identify data cleansing opportunities and take initiative to correct data quality problems
Balance the incoming queue of new requests with unplanned needs to support Project and Launch deadlines
Run requested data quality and data analysis requests or reports in support of customers, both internal and external
Participate in testing and development of new tools and reports in support of data quality
Identify and escalate any trends and patterns with data requests or integrity

Experience working within Dynamics BC preferred

Customer focused with an emphasis on clear communication
Adapt easily to changing environments and system enhancements
Microsoft Excel and office suite required
Day to day use and familiarity with databases and database processes preferred.

company: America's Poison Centers (formerly American Association of Poison Control Centers - AAPCC)
Job_description:
America's Poison Centers (formerly, American Association of Poison Control Centers - AAPCC)

Position: Associate, National Data Services
Type: Full-Time, salaried
Location: Arlington, Virginia (potential for telework based upon specific qualifications and circumstances)
Compensation: Commensurate with experience, plus excellent benefits
Closing Date: Applications will be accepted until the position is filled
Start Date: 1st Quarter of 2023

To Apply: Please submit the following items. No phone calls, please.

1) Your resume
2) A cover letter describing specifically how your skills, goals, and experience are a good fit for this position
3) (Optional) Examples of your professional work that supports your application. Examples must be entirely your own work product and not edited by others.

Summary: This is an opportunity to work for a national organization that provides public health data and surveillance analysis to various entities (e.g., government, academia, media, and private sector). America’s Poison Centers (formerly known as American Association of Poison Control Centers – AAPCC) owns the National Poison Data System (NPDS), the only comprehensive, near real-time database of toxic exposure data collected by all 50 states and territories. America’s Poison Centers partners with database administrators to continuously maintain and enhance NPDS. We are looking for a highly organized, proactive professional to take a lead role in helping to manage our work with NPDS vendors as well as the enhancements to our national data licensing initiatives. This includes quality assurance, data provisioning, data visualizations, and management of website content (research/citation libraries). You will work with Board members, Poison Center directors, and Poison Center staff as well as our government and private partners.

Our Organization: We represent the nation’s 55 Poison Centers (PCs), which provide 24 hours a day, 7 days a week, 365 days a year expert information and treatment advice to the public. The PCs upload their case data to NPDS, data is uploaded approximately every 8 minutes. NPDS has more than 74 million case records, product-specific data about more than 450,000 products, and can detect/track poison exposure outbreaks. Each year, PCs manage more than 2.5 million cases about medications, consumer products, animals, environmental hazards, food-related, and other healthcare issues. America’s Poison Centers accredits PCs, certifies specialists in poison information, and coordinates national-level poison education and prevention programs. America’s Poison Centers partners with federal agencies such as HRSA, CDC, FDA, and DEA as well as private industry, to support public health initiatives (opioids, COVID, etc.,). We are a 501(C)(3) organization.

Position Description: America’s Poison Centers seeks an entry level, full-time professional to support the work of its National Data Services Team. This position is excellent for a recent college graduate with at least two years of relevant academic or professional experience, seeking to gain experience in the national public health data sector. Key responsibilities will include a selection of the duties below:

1. Collaborate with our national Clinical Manager to triage, understand and execute data licensing inquiries from public health, government, and researcher organizations as well as Poison Centers and private companies.
2. Lead the creation and execution of deliverables on America’s Poison Centers federal government data services contracts.
3. Perform quality control procedures on datasets before provisioning to licensees, as needed.
4. Assist in promoting and refining the infrastructure around new data licensing opportunities.
5. Schedule and attend important committee and department meetings.
6. Regularly update America’s Poison Centers’ websites
7. Create and maintain a library of published literature and citations that use NPDS data
8. Administrative tasks (e.g., maintain project management tracking and document repositories, take notes at key meetings, keep track of action items, write and distribute minutes, etc.)
9. Other operational and mission-related duties

Travel
COVID restrictions permitting, overnight travel is typically expected at least three times each year: For America’s Poison Centers annual Poison Center Leadership Meeting (PCLM), which is 3-4 days between February and April, and for the annual North American Congress of Clinical Toxicology (NACCT), which is 4-5 days between September and October, and for an annual meeting with CDC-based NPDS stakeholders in Atlanta, GA. Each of those events typically requires a commitment of evening and weekend work. Some additional conference or meeting travel may be requested as required by contract deliverables, but no other evening or weekend work is expected. In addition, the person in this position will periodically be asked to attend conferences around the country as an exhibitor to promote NPDS. Overall, travel is not expected to exceed 15%.

Qualifications: The ideal candidate will have a demonstrated interest in assisting with the utilization of data (in particular, clinical and/or poisoning data) to positively impact public health and:

Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field, such as Public Health, Health Informatics, Health Data, Health

Administration, Biomedical Sciences, etc. required. Candidates without a Bachelor’s degree and 5 years’ highly relevant experience may be considered.

Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field, such as Public Health, Health Informatics, Health Data, Health Administration, Biomedical Sciences, etc. required. Candidates without a Bachelor’s degree and 5 years’ highly relevant experience may be considered.
Relevant professional experience
Superb organizational skills and an eye for detail
A highly collaborative approach with a positive, team-oriented attitude
A proactive work style with a resourceful approach to the work place
Be a fluent user of Microsoft Office Suite, including Word, PowerPoint, Excel, and Access. Experience using Microsoft Outlook for contacts, email, and calendars is preferred but not required. Experience using Adobe Pro for private health information (PHI) is preferred but not required.

While not required, special consideration will be given for candidates with experiences in any of the following areas:

Nonprofit public health association experience
CDC, FDA, or other public health agencies
Poison information, National Poison Data System and/or clinical toxicology

Relevant education and/or internships may be substituted for experience.

Summit Carbon Solutions is an innovative company which is developing and building the world’s largest carbon capture and storage project in the upper Midwest over the next several years. We are a dynamic and highly entrepreneurial team that is expanding rapidly. We are looking for a smart, flexible, and high-energy individual to join our team. Position Summary:
The data architect will join our Information Technology team to enable and equip our customers with actionable insights by designing, building, and supporting data integration between systems using ETL tools and maintaining a data catalog while also supporting the data reporting team with data acquisition and transformations into our data warehouse.

Duties and Responsibilities:

Analyze and organize raw data, cataloging fields and entities
Build data systems and pipelines using ETL tools (i.e., FME, GLUE, Synapse and/or MuleSoft)
Evaluate business needs and objectives with report writers and report consumers
Conduct complex data analysis and collaborate on reporting with BI developers
Prepare data for prescriptive and predictive modeling
Build algorithms and prototypes
Identify opportunities for data acquisition and determine data update velocity

Graduate degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Informatics, Information Systems, or another related field
5-10 years of experience in a data engineer or architect role
A successful history of manipulating, processing, extracting value form large, disconnected data sets
Experience can include using:
SQL and NoSQL databases
Data pipeline and workflow management tools
AWS cloud services: EC2, EMR, RDS, Redshift
Azure cloud services: Synapse, CloudSQL, Azure DataLake
Stream processing systems: Storm, Spark Streaming, etc.
Object oriented/object function scripting languages: Python, Java, C++, Scala, ext.
A firm understanding of API
Experience performing root cause analysis on internal and external data and processes to answer specific business questions and identify opportunities for improvement
Experience using Power BI a plus

Essential Functions
Assesses student abilities as related to desired educational goals, objectives, and outcomes.

Participates in in-service and staff development activities and staff meetings as required or assigned.

Looking for more than just a job? MKD Electric offers careers. Rewarding careers at that! We provide excellent benefits, training, educational opportunities, and promote from within the company.
For over twenty years, we have designed, built, installed, and maintained our clients’ systems, projects, and facilities with a wide range of service offerings. We focus on safety, value, and quality as well as building and maintaining lasting relationships with a variety of national clients in renewables, data centers, oil and gas, food and beverage, manufacturing, chemical, and pharmaceutical fields. Quickly moving into other industries, we are a fast-paced and agile company looking for a best-in-class Data Center Electrician willing to roll up their sleeves and exude a passion for the field.
MKD Electric is seeking an Data Center Electrician with data center experience. As part of this role the successful candidate will be responsible for inspecting, repairing, installing, modifying, and maintaining electrical systems, circuits and equipment in data centers and other mission critical facilities.


What you will do…


Install, maintain, and repair electrical equipment such as transformers, switchboards, controllers, circuit breakers, motors, conduit systems, power and control circuits and other transmission equipment
Use and interpret blueprints, drawings, schematics, or other specifications to plan work and / or troubleshoot electrical systems and components
Measure, cut, bend, and install conduit/wire
Assist with mentoring junior (apprentice) electricians
Requisition material, tools and equipment and maintain inventory
Troubleshoot issues and make recommendations to resolve the situation
Respond to emergency power and back-up systems failures
Effectively communicate status of, issues, recommendations, etc. to management
Provide timely and completed documentation of work performed
Must be willing and able to work overtime, be on site at odd hours and participate in an on-call rotation.

What you will need to succeed…


High School Diploma or GED
Virginia Journeyman Electrician license
4+ years of experience working within the data center industry
Valid driver’s license in good standing
Problem solving skills
Excellent communication and time management skills
Ability to multi-task
Knowledge of national electric code
Knowledge of OSHA safety guidelines and practices
Ability to understand and follow MOP & SOW’s
OSHA 30 Certified
Able to understand and read electrical blueprints, schematics and one-line diagrams
LOTO experience working with highly redundant and complicated electrical distribution systems
Ability to perform duties in a professional manner and appearance.
Ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks, changing priorities as necessary
Ability to work under time pressure and adapt to changing requirements with a positive attitude
Effective oral and written communication skills as required for the position
Ability to be self-motivated, proactive and an effective team player
Ability to interact effectively and professionally with all levels of employees, both management and staff alike, vendors, clients, and others
Strong written and verbal communication skills with excellent presentation skills
Working knowledge of Microsoft Excel, Microsoft Word, and Outlook applications
Possess strong organizational and time management skills

Physical demands…

Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Must be able to carry and transport up to 60 pounds up to 20 feet.

Requires standing for extended period with frequent stretching, reaching, walking, and stooping, pushing and/or pulling in an environment that may be cold, hot, noisy, and wet and may have fumes or odors.

What you’ll love about us…
MKD employees are the company’s greatest assets. JOB DESCRIPTION
Rooted in the agricultural industry, we bring data to life through laboratory analysis and innovative reporting solutions. Our laboratory network and field teams provide an expansive array of analyses and consulting services to help you make data-driven management decisions.
From farmers to municipalities, your success is ours.


*DATA ENTRY SPECIALIST
*


SUMMARY STATEMENT
Perform data entry duties with impeccable attention to detail and remarkable accuracy. Delegate data entry overflow as appropriate. Maintain client database information.
Provide support to client services procedures.
To maintain good attendance is a condition of employment and an essential function of your job. To abide by all URUS and VAS policies and procedures relevant to this position


RESPONSIBILITIES


Perform data entry procedures ensuring accuracy and timeliness.
Provide entry of sample information into LIMS software.
Generate laboratory information sheets and disperse appropriately.
Issue add tests and reruns as requested and follow through on process.
Perform corrections of data entry errors in LIMS software.
Delegate data entry overflow to Data Entry Clerks and Client Service Representatives as appropriate.
Establish new accounts and maintain client database in CRM, LIMS and financial software.
Assist with client services procedures as required.
Offer timely solutions to client inquiries.

Description
*
A Career at Rheem: Where Comfort Is Your Calling*
At Rheem, we’re dedicated to bringing comfort to people’s lives. And, as a leading global manufacturer of heating, cooling and water heating equipment, we’re innovating all-new ways to deliver just the right temperature while saving energy, water and supporting a more sustainable future. It’s an exciting challenge that requires a team of talented, passionate people with a diverse set of skills. From engineers to accountants, sales professionals to support experts, Rheem depends on people to power our innovations. Join Rheem, and help shape the future of products that impact people’s lives—every day.
The Sales Analyst I will be responsible optimizes the company's sales strategies by analyzing trends, preparing forecasts, and evaluating current performance to sales goals. Assists the Sales Managers in identifying sales opportunities and developing tactics to grow market share in assigned product category and channels.
This position will serve our Water Heater Division and is a field- based within an assigned territory. (Wisconsin)
WHAT YOU'LL DO:

Work closely with Demand Planning and Market Management on sales forecasts for assigned product categories and channels.
Work closely with Sales Managers, Product Managers and Market Managers to document market opportunities for new and existing products.
Conduct weekly, monthly, and yearly sales analysis for regions, territories, markets, customers, and category segments.
Monitor sales budgets and trends to ensure that key performance indicators are met.
Utilize DSS and MTMS to generate reports requested by Sales Managers.
Develop sales presentations for customer meetings and web content.
Provide market share analysis support for marketing management.
Develop and maintain customer profitability matrices.
Partner with Marketing and other functions to mine sales data for trends.
Analyze data and create reports, presentations, and data visualizations to communicate analysis and recommendations.
Manage customer’s inventory and ordering systems and recommend changes as needed to maintain customer KPI.
Track orders and shipments as needed.
Maintain and update customers product information pages.
Learn and utilize customer’s ordering and data management systems.
Provide analytical and reporting support to multiple internal departments.
Provide product and customer order support to dealer locations

Qualifications

Business Administration, Marketing or related degree from a college or university; or 2 to 4 years related experience; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
Excellent communication skills, written and verbal, with attention to detail and accuracy.
Proficient computer skills and in-depth knowledge of relevant software such as MS Office Suite.
Demonstrated ability to work well with others in a matrix team environment.
Ability to work cross-functionally across organizations.
Advanced Microsoft Excel skills.
Experience in collecting and presenting statistical data and converting into reports.
Ability to analyze and interpret sales data and summary reports.
Ability to speak effectively before employees and groups of customers.
Advanced mathematical skills including the ability to calculate discounts, percentages, and commissions.
Strong analytical and reasoning skills.
Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions.
Knowledge of Category Management principles and best practices

Data Governance Director

This role is a leadership position, reporting directly to VP level leader of the organization, and is responsible and accountable for leading a team that:

Develops, implements, and enforces organization-wide data governance activities with a focus on establishing and ensuring adherence to the enterprise data governance framework.
Develops a Master Data Management (MDM) strategy inclusive of a data catalog that simplifies data definitions and discovery providing for consistency across platforms and the enterprise.
Responsible for technology that governs structured, multi-structured, and unstructured data across data warehouses and other physical and virtual repositories.
Partners with key stakeholders for results.

Duties and Responsibilities

Full data governance framework ownership for the enterprise inclusive of, people, process, policies, and technology; manage the budget.
Recruit and build a dynamic team of talented analysts and specialists that are “comfortable being uncomfortable” and taking ownership in an ever-changing environment.
Identify, analyze, and leverage utility industry best practices, benchmark studies, and business relationships to measure and improve business processes.
Own and lead the data architecture and related structure.
Work with key stakeholders across the enterprise to enhance functional effectiveness and provide faster business value delivery.
Proactively manage risks and provide optimal performance and throughput.
Provide centralized oversight of data governance for the enterprise to empower users to make faster and smarter decisions.
Provide oversight to assigned project/ program resource or leads large complex initiatives, collaborating with business leaders and managing program delivery across internal IT, third-party vendors, and service providers.
Continued and progressive development and mentorship/coaching.

Required Qualifications for Position

Bachelor's degree in information technology, computer science, data science, mathematics, statistics, economics, engineering, or a related business or quantitative discipline.
10+ years total experience.
3+ years of direct leadership experience building and managing high-performing teams.
Demonstrated ability to initiate and maintain strategic stakeholder relationships to advance business goals.
Experienced navigating matrixed organizations. Proven ability to work departments collaboratively to resolve issues, drive projects to closure, achieve, desired results and successfully implement change.
Strong data governance project management background, with deep knowledge of data quality management, data integration, and data management.
Proficiency with data management or metadata management technology products.
Working knowledge of databases and database structures to enable articulating data concepts between business-focused, functional, and technical data users.
Strong program and project management experience with a proven track record of leading cross-functional IT/Business transformation programs.
Ability to prioritize and manage multiple projects simultaneously and at times competing deliverables.
Inclusive leadership style by proactively seeking out different perspectives both internally and externally.

Preferred Qualifications for Position

Experience leading data governance programs.
Advanced degree in Data Science, Math, MBA, or other related preferred.
Demonstratable experience leading cross-functional teams.
Experience in the roll-out and adoption of governance tools such as Alation, Collibra, Informatica, or Microsoft Purview.
Capable of negotiating and leveraging the influence of operational teams on data management improvement actions.
PMP certification and/or extensive project management experience.

We are currently seeking a Resource Coordinator/Data Analyst to join our team. We are looking for an energetic professional who enjoys working outdoors and values the freedom of working independently. If you enjoy a fast-paced environment and the challenges of a rewarding profession, consider a career in vegetation management with ECI.

Some of the most important characteristics of an ECI Resource Coordinator/Data Analyst is a desire to learn, an ability to adapt, and a commitment to engage in safe, constructive interactions with the public. You are accountable for advancing a culture of safety and excellence while providing quality and value to our customers and clients.

WHAT WE OFFER:

Industry competitive pay.
Company vehicle with fuel card to take to and from home & work.
Medical/Health/Dental/Vision/VOYA/Vacation Accrual/Paid Holidays/EAP eligibility on day one of employment (Full-Time Employees).
401K, life insurance, long-term disability eligibility first of the month after 3 months of service.
Sick Time eligibility on day 90 of employment.
Weekly pay checks and direct deposit.
Participation in Employee Referral Program (must meet eligibility requirements).
Boot and clothing program (company funded).
Ongoing training and assistance with obtaining industry certifications.




WHAT YOU WILL DO:

Provides first level support to internal and external customers for work management software suite and associated programs relating to work unit identification, data input, and invoice reconciliation for vegetation management activities relating to the utility transmission network.
Track defects within production processes and performs root cause analysis for functional issues to develop checklist for recurring problems.
Works to solve organizational problems by analyzing processes, workflows and planning activities to identify opportunities for automation or improvement.
Inputs, tracks, and monitors vegetation-related relay and sustained circuit outages into Work Studio and provides metrics to the Reliability and Performance Standards Team monthly.
Act as a liaison under the utility Information Technology group to work with management software providers to provide timely deliverables, requested upgrades, user licensing allocation, troubleshooting issues, and software implementation to ensure system functionality and continuity.
Maintains user rosters and updated permissions to ensure IT security and integrity of the utility networks.
Provides training assistance and planning guidance to work management software desktop, tablet, and thin client users in both office and field environments.
Maintains metrics, analyzes statistical data, and makes recommendations for budget corrections based on trend analysis.
All other duties and projects as assigned.




WHAT YOU NEED TO HAVE:

5+ years experience administering a multi-user work management software program with an emphasis on bettering the end user experience.
Knowledge of GIS (Geographic Information Systems), programming and cartography including analyzing spatial data through mapping software and other data sets.
Knowledge of database language such as SQL.
Proven work experience as a software Analyst or similar role.
Experience in maintaining a production related software for large number of users.
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.
Customer interface skills and experience.
Strong computer skills and knowledge of QA databases and applications.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Meticulous attention to detail.
Computer skills, including Excel, Word, PowerPoint, GIS.




WHAT WOULD BE AMAZING TO HAVE:

Degree in computer science, geography, surveying, engineering, or related field.
GIS and Database entry skills preferred.
Knowledge of utility forestry, logging or agricultural maintenance a plus.
Being Bi-Lingual (Spanish) is a plus.

A DAY IN THE LIFE OF AN ECI FORESTER:

Working Environment

Work alone in an outdoor field environment; vehicle and foot patrol of utility power lines; remote locations as well as urban, city environment; physical demands and travel from site to site, including walking/hiking on various surfaces including flat, dry, wet, slippery, uneven, rough, steep terrain, hills, and slopes; exposure to noise, dust, grease, and all types of weather and temperature conditions; exposure to hazardous traffic conditions. Reasonable accommodations, if available, may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential job functions.

Physical

The team member must have sufficient physical ability and mobility to work in a field environment; to walk up to 10 miles per day, stand, sit, and operate a motor vehicle for prolonged periods of time; to frequently stoop, bend, kneel, crouch, run, crawl, climb, reach, twist, grasp and make repetitive hand, arm and shoulder movement in the performance of daily duties (e.g., forcefully beat down brush); carry, push and/or pull light to heavy amounts of weight, frequently lift up to 10 lbs. and occasionally lift up to 60 lbs. (sandbags); to operate assigned equipment and vehicles; ability to verbally communicate to exchange information with public; ability to see and hear in normal range with or without correction; operate assigned field equipment, including handheld computer, range finder, fyrake, water backpack, shovel, and traffic cone.

Company Overview

Environmental Consultants (ECI) is a leading provider of vegetation and asset management consulting services to the utility industry. Successful professionals at ECI have come from a variety of backgrounds, including: forestry, arboriculture, natural resource management, biology, landscape maintenance, horticulture, nursery management, environmental sciences, geology, agriculture, parks & recreation management, urban forestry, geography, and more. For more information visit our website www.eci-consulting.com

Applicants must pass a pre-employment drug test and a criminal background check.

All candidates must possess a valid driver's license and have a good driving record.

ECI is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. EOE/AA : Minority/Female/ Vets/ Disabled.

Are you an experienced data analyst/data scientist ready to take on your next challenge? Kum & Go is looking for a Senior Data Analyst to deliver advanced analytic insights and capabilities to understand key drivers of the business and support decision making and planning across the organization. This role will work closely with a variety of teams and departments to perform statistical analyses and predictive modeling to address business challenges and inform strategic initiatives.

What you’ll do

Apply business, analytic, and technical knowledge to meet wide ranging business and strategic needs using techniques such as segmentation, statistical inference, visualization, experimentation, and predictive modeling

Work with large, sometimes disparate data sources to build analytic datasets for analysis and modeling.

Manage assigned projects from inception to completion with a consultative approach: meet with business partners, define the problem/question, formulate an approach, execute the analysis, create recommendations, and present findings to stakeholders

Identify and lead implementation of advanced data solutions, tools, or capabilities to meet strategic needs of the organization and enable self-service frameworks for analytic consumers

What we’re looking for

Excellent analytical, critical thinking, and problem-solving skills

High attention to detail and quality

Ability to manage multiple projects that are at various stages

Comfortable working both independently and collaborating in a team atmosphere

Strong desire to provide quality work while meeting critical deadlines

Highly skilled with statistical software and programming languages such as R, Python, SQL, and SAS and enabling statistical/data science packages such as pandas, scikit learn, H2O, caret, ggplot, and Spark.

Advanced knowledge of statistical (e.g., sampling, regression, PCA, time-series forecasting, hypothesis testing, design of experiments) and machine learning (e.g., neural network, random forest, GBM) techniques

Advanced knowledge of relational databases such as MS SQL Server, Oracle, and Teradata

Working knowledge of cloud technologies such as Azure or AWS

Other key requirements

3+ years of experience in a similar role

Relocation to Des Moines, IA area required

Leadership Competencies

Communication: Delivers clear, effective communication and listens to others

Conceptual/Systems Thinking: Recognizes patterns, trends, themes, and connections in information to develop innovative ideas and solutions

Constructive Engagement: Expresses ideas and disagreements, constructively resolves conflict, and encourages others to do the same

Customer Orientation: Meets the expectations and needs of internal and external customers

Decision Making: Makes good decisions in a timely manner

Empowerment: Takes initiative and solves problems

Talent Development: Maximizes potential and improves overall performance

Influence: Proactively builds relationships and influences others

Analytical Thinking/Problem Solving: Accurately assesses problems and effectively and efficiently arrives at solutions

Strategic Thinking: Understands the current state and is able to visualize the ideal state and how to achieve it

About Kum & Go

At Kum & Go, our purpose is to make days better. We do that by connecting with people. Every day, whether in stores or at our Store Support Center office, we take a people-first approach to developing associates, serving customers, and solving problems. We provide a unique working experience where our associates are given the opportunity to make connections and to have fun along the way. Our culture is supported by our five core values:

Passion - We love what we do, and it shows in our work

Integrity - We do the right thing, even when it is difficult

Teamwork - We believe that greatness is only achieved in unity

Caring - We have genuine compassion for our customers, associates, families, and communities

Excellence - We expect and deliver superior performance

Established in Hampton, Iowa in 1959, Kum & Go is a fourth-generation, family-owned convenience store chain providing a fresh perspective by meeting customers where they are and offering them the choices they deserve. For over 60 years, the company has been dedicated to sharing 10% of all profits back to the communities it serves. The chain is growing, employing more than 5,000 associates in more than 400 stores in 11 states with expansion into three new states and markets (Salt Lake City, Utah, Grand Rapids, Michigan & Boise, Idaho) planned for 2022-2023.

Kum & Go believes in People First. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer building a culture of equity and inclusion.

Job_description:
Part-Time Data Entry Analyst - Solvas Financial Technology

Work you'll do
This is a part-time syndicated loan data entry analyst opportunity supporting the Solvas|Digitize Managed service. Job duties include:

Review syndicated loan notices for manual extraction and data input
Review automated data extraction results
Speed and accuracy when reviewing and/or inputting data
Ability to work independently and without direct supervision while adhering to strict deadlines
Comfortable working in a fast-paced environment
Strong communication skills (both verbal and through email communication)
Excellent analytical skills, attention to detail, and strong organizational skills
This is temporary, hourly position with core hours between 4:00 a.m. and 7:00 p.m. (EST), although other hours may be required based on business need.
Shifts are scheduled in minimum of 4 hour increments and a minimum of 8 hours is expected during peak days (typically 2 - 3 days per month)
The days worked per month are typically 3 to 10 days only. (This is not a regular part-time position and there are regular hours .) Working days are based exclusively on business needs and are expected to be variable.

The Team

Our Financial Technology practice develops and licenses a growing family of proprietary software products and service solutions (see www.deloitte.com/ft ) to assist financial institutions with a number of complex topics such as accounting for credit deteriorated assets and the administration of investments in leveraged loans.

We are looking to add professionals to support our Solvas|Digitize™ solution team ( www.solvasdigitize.com ). Solvas|Digitize is an intelligent automation solution and managed service that is experiencing rapid growth and expansion across various industries and applications.

Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree or 1+ year of relevant work experience
Proficiency with all current technology and Microsoft Office 365 programs, including, but not limited to:
Laptop functionality
Video conferencing software (i.e. Zoom, Microsoft Teams, and Skype)
Ability to utilize multiple web applications (at least 2) simultaneously
Microsoft Teams
Online software programs for data entry
Flexibility in terms of work hours and workdays is required
Ability to find specific data points based on guidance/logical reasoning
Syndicated loan experience is preferred, but is not required
Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the future

For individuals assigned and/or hired to work in Washington State, Deloitte is required by law to include a reasonable estimate of the compensation range for this role. This compensation range is specific to Washington State and takes into account the wide range of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions including but not limited to skill sets; experience and training; licensure and certifications; and other business and organizational needs. At Deloitte, it is not typical for an individual to be hired at or near the top of the range for their role and compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances of each case. A reasonable estimate of the current rate of pay is $20 per hour.

Other details:

Work timing

Part-time, hourly basis with core hours between 4:00 a.m. and 7:00 p.m. Eastern Standard Time on specific days of each month based on business need. Occasional weekend and holiday coverage will be required.

Location

Any U.S. location will be considered for the appropriate candidate; team is located primarily in the New York, Dallas, and Houston metropolitan areas

Travel

Travel will be rare if required at all

Position Summary:

The Business Systems Analyst II will work on projects of diverse scope and complexity and serve as the change agent for warehouse processes. This personal in this position analyzes different distribution processes and assesses the scope and impact of each on business. They will identify and document process charts, information resources, distribution paths, and system specifications. The BA II will also help with workflow & process diagrams and conduct gap analysis. They will device and implement new solutions to problems by utilizing the 3Ps -people, process and program- methodology. Implementation of the suggested solutions will be the key aspect of this position.

Primary Job Functions:

Perform data analysis and conduct research related to distribution center operations to identify variance, discrepancies and gaps; utilize the findings to determine opportunities for improvement and recommend timely corrective actions.
Develop reporting tools and create dashboards using SQL, Crystal Reports and Business Intelligence Software to provide higher visibility and facilitate data driven decision making in daily operations.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to conduct continuous improvement projects following six-sigma and lean manufacturing guidelines for providing high-standard service to customer.
Create project SOPs and documentation for various projects and build a knowledge repository. Also, help develop a culture of data-driven decision making across the organization.
Incorporate big data analysis to help identify trends and patterns in inventory movement across distribution centers.
Be a team player who can wear different hats within various warehousing functions in order to serve the customer better
Analyze and define efficient, cost effective solutions that support business processes and operational requirements.
Independently initiate, identify, research, investigate, analyze, define and document process changes with the aim of increasing productivity and enhancing efficiency.
Understand organization's direction, structure and requirements.
Identify all affected stakeholders for a project; identify overlaps and related processes.
Evaluate alternative operational efficiencies.
Document and refine system modifications.

Secondary Functions:

May assist in development of project plans using the associated project planning tools, which include work plans, schedules, milestones, critical paths, detailed tasks, and deliverables.
Provide status on project milestones, alerting client/project manager of any potential delays.
Provide expertise to cross functional groups, delivers presentations, demonstrations and training for various initiatives and projects.
Assist with the design and implementation of training programs for associated on the newer enhanced processes.
Assist in planning, developing and executing test plans.
Maintain issue logs, tracks/follows up on problems.
Provide knowledge transfer and feedback as appropriate.
Perform other duties as assigned.
Communicate effectively with business users to identify needs and evaluate alternative business solutions with project management.
Continually seeks opportunities to increase customer satisfaction.

Check out some of the required qualifications we are looking for in amazing candidates….

Bachelor's Degree (Master's preferred) in Supply Chain, Logistics Management, Business Administration and/or equivalent work experience.
Strong technical skills in terms of SQL, Crystal and BI tools is a must; also advanced knowledge of Excel, VBA and Macros would be very beneficial.
Strong experience in extracting/mining and modeling data; process mapping and root causing.
Prefer 2-4 years of equivalent work experience defining and implementing business process improvements in supply chain management systems and warehouse management.
Excellent project management skills; ability to manage multiple projects in time bound fashion; 1-2 full project life cycle implementations and go-lives required.
Knowledge of current best practices in Supply Chain Optimization, Transportation and Distribution.
Self-starter who takes initiative and can work with minimal supervision.
