Position Summary

We are seeking an organized and detail oriented individual to join our team as a Database Analyst / Programmer. This position provides analysis, design, implementation, and support of assigned business systems in an efficient and economical manner throughout the company. This individual will assist with gathering specifications, creating, and refining functionality specifications, conducting the analysis and design, programming, testing, documenting, assisting in implementation, and resolving of issues. The ability to work and thrive in a team environment is critical.

Key Responsibilities

Work with Systems Improvement Leader to maintain source code and SQL infrastructure for MRP system.
Work with CFO to maintain source code and SQL infrastructure for ERP system.
Develop and maintain source code for proprietary software.
Design and implement SQL tables and stored procedures.
Assist in the development of key tools that will create efficiencies in various departmental workflows.
Find ways to automate tasks that currently require manual intervention.

Personal Characteristics / Skills

Certain personal characteristics, which are somewhat inherent and difficult to teach, are necessary for long-term success in this role. These include:

Commitment to Life-Long Learning – This person acknowledges the need for life-long learning to continuously adapt to a quickly changing technological environment.
High Motivation – This person is a self-starter and is passionate about overcoming challenges.
Thorough – This person is willing to dig into the details to ensure coding maintains data integrity.
Organized – This person is able to keep large amounts of detail well organized.
Linear Thinking – This person is able to breakdown complex problems into logical and sequential order.
Communication – This person has the ability to explain complex technical concepts and designs to internal customers and provide excellent customer services and end-user support.

Education and Experience

Education

BS degree in Computer Science OR equivalent experience preferred.

Experience

2+ Years development experience with VB.NET and MS SQL.
Experience with C#, JavaScript, HTML5, CSS, ASP.NET, Crystal Reports, Active Reports and networking concepts are a plus.
Experience in dependable fundamentals in object-oriented design, database design, algorithms and data structures.
Experience using Agile methodologies is a plus.
Some experience in UI design and SQL stored procedures is necessary.

Company Information
Merrill Steel is a large-scale market leader in structural steel and heavy plate fabrication with the ability to apply sophisticated paint and fireproofing coatings. The Merrill Steel umbrella encompasses Engineering, Design, Drafting, Manufacturing, Coatings and Delivery via our own workforce and equipment, which ensures the best price and on-time performance, all within our control. All manufacturing is completed in two production facilities, which are located Schofield, WI and Springfield, MO, employing approximately 440 nonunion employees.
Merrill Steel is a family business that was founded in 1962 by Roger W. Hinner. The company has grown and prospered over the years, serving the nation’s structural steel needs for companies such as in automotive, with Ford, General Motors, and Rivian; stadiums and arenas, such as Lambeau Field (Packers), Miller Park (Brewers), Camp Randall Stadium (Badgers), Soldier Field (Bears), U.S. Bank Stadium (Vikings), and Allegiant Stadium (Raiders); and LNG, Power, and Industrial markets, with projects such as Cove Point (LNG), Mitsubishi (Industrial), Keeyask (Hydro) and Four Corners (Power/Plate).

The successful candidate will lead a team of electricians, ensuring all work is completed in accordance with industry standards, company policies, and safety guidelines. Additionally, the candidate will have experience with Building/Electrical Management Systems installations, ensuring all systems are installed and operating efficiently.

6. Attend coordination meetings as required and provide necessary information

18. Other duties as assigned

3. Minimum of 2 years’ experience as a Data Center Superintendent or Foreman

JOB SUMMARY:

Responsible for Electronic Data Interchange (EDI) ingestion, extraction, and reconciliation processes. The EDI II must understand data sets and formats such as XML, JSON, FHIR, and CALINX; as well as ANSI X12 /HL7 standards like 820, 834, 835, 837,277, 278 and 999. The EDI II will create or modify mapping documents based on our overall needs as well as the needs of high-profile projects, analyze requirements, test systems, export data in EDI formats, and be able to load and transform EDI files into accessible data formats. In addition to ingesting and exporting data, the EDI II will work with the business units on how to reconcile data by creating workflows and processes.

ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:

1. Analyzes and defines EDI requirements for data ingestion and extraction

2. Creates workflows for data correction and error processing with business units

3. Performs data load and extraction from/to EDI file formats (XML/JSON/ANSI/HL7/FHIR)

4. Provides advice and education to internal team and vendors concerning EDI guidelines and capabilities.

5. Creates, develops, and produces mapping documents for both ingestion and extraction.

6. Collaborates with programmers and internal staff to develop and test new or modified systems.

7. Follows SDLC lifecycle processes to ensure efficient and effective data utilization for our business.

8. Develops and maintains communication links with trading partners and oversees integration of information.

9. Periodically reviews system to ensure client needs are met; identifies possible modifications as required.

10. Explains gaps and technical concepts for non-technical audiences as well as come up with solutions.

EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE:

· Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Management Information Systems, Public Health, Finance, Business, Economics, or related field required.

· In lieu of a Bachelor's Degree, 5 or more years collecting and breaking down high level EDI designs, fleshing out functional requirements, analyzing data, data mappings, and analyzing inter/intradepartmental processes in mid or large enterprise IT environment(s) required

· 5+ years of demonstrated experience in providing specifications on custom software that span Internet, Intranet, Extranet, integration, EDI and client/server architectures with multiple software development lifecycle's including waterfall and agile

· Must understand relational database concepts, table design and structure, joins, data normalization, and data types.

· Experience with HL7, ANSI, and FHIR standards are required.

· Experience with SQL (TSQL, PostgresSQL, MySQL etc.) is required.

· Experience with web service/API is preferred.

· Experience in Microsoft technologies including TFS, SSRS,TSQL, , .NET/C#, Dynamics365, Azure DevOps.

· Prior experience using ETL tools (Informatica, SSIS, dbt, fivetran etc.), Python, R, and BI visualization (PowerBI, Tableau, Looker etc.) tools a bonus.

· 2-4 or more years experience in a healthcare delivery or healthcare business setting preferred.

· EZCAP experience preferred.

SKILLS/KNOWLEDGE/ABILITY:

Thorough knowledge of MS Office Suite particularly Excel

Team Beebe! One Beebe! Beebe Healthcare is one of the largest employers throughout beautiful Sussex County, DE and we have exciting career opportunities available for qualified professionals.

Revenue Integrity Analyst

Under direction of the Manager of Revenue Integrity, ensures proper day to day operations of the revenue integrity and charge capture process. Primary duties include reviewing charge documents, the charge capture process and revenue reconciliation of departments for accuracy and compliance. Specific: Under direct supervision of the Manager of Revenue Integrity, works to support revenue optimization initiatives. Strong computer skills required with a familiarity around billing and coding strongly preferred. In order to be considered for the position, please visit our website www.beebehealthcare.org to fill out an application.

Requirments:

Five to seven years progressive experiences in healthcare environment required.
Computer literate with Excel spreadsheet skills.
Secondary Education related to health information management, finance, public health, business administration or a related discipline.
Certification as a CCA, CCS, RHIA or RHIT is highly desired.

Responsibilities:

Ensures accurate and timely charge capture methodologies are in place and executed for the assigned work unit, and that they are consistent (in terms of standardization) across pertinent areas/departments as appropriate.
Reconciles charges against source documents to ensure that charges have been captured completely and accurately.
Monitors compliance with internal standards and procedures.
Reports non-compliance issues to proper authority.
Identifies, researches, and analyzes billing errors and/or omissions working with appropriate staff/team member.
Ensures that revisions/corrections are sent to the Patient Business Services team and incorporated in processing systems in a timely manner.
Ensures data flows appropriately between departments and computer systems.
Provides training to staff engaged in billing data entry and related charge capture/reconciliation activities to ensure procedures are understood and that charges are timely, accurate, and completed with proper documentation.
Works efficiently in all Craneware tools assigned and shows demonstrated knowledge of use.
Prepares reports and provides departmental summary information to the Revenue Cycle team which is responsible for ensuring that all charges on a system-wide basis are being captured, charged, and reimbursed appropriately and for overall compliance.
Assists interdepartmental teams in troubleshooting accounts that are being held in A/R due to charging/documentation discrepancies.
Demonstrates personal capabilities in organizational, time management, prioritizing, careful and logical thinking, effective problem solving and decision making skills.
Supports the Revenue Integrity and Patient Business Services functions and initiatives on an as needed basis.

Competencies and skills-Essential:

Clear Communication Skills Both Written and Verbal
Knowledge of Basic Computer Programs
Able to Keep Confidential Information Regarding Patients, Team Members
Able to Withstand Crisis Situations
Has Skills to Provides Customer Service to Patients, Team Members And Visitors
Experience or Completed Courses in Coding

Bachelor's Degree in related field

Job_title: Part-Time Data Entry Analyst - Solvas Financial Technology
Job_description:
Part-Time Data Entry Analyst - Solvas Financial Technology

Work you'll do
This is a part-time syndicated loan data entry analyst opportunity supporting the Solvas|Digitize Managed service. Job duties include:

Review syndicated loan notices for manual extraction and data input
Review automated data extraction results
Speed and accuracy when reviewing and/or inputting data
Ability to work independently and without direct supervision while adhering to strict deadlines
Comfortable working in a fast-paced environment
Strong communication skills (both verbal and through email communication)
Excellent analytical skills, attention to detail, and strong organizational skills
This is temporary, hourly position with core hours between 4:00 a.m. and 7:00 p.m. (EST), although other hours may be required based on business need.
Shifts are scheduled in minimum of 4 hour increments and a minimum of 8 hours is expected during peak days (typically 2 - 3 days per month)
The days worked per month are typically 3 to 10 days only. (This is not a regular part-time position and there are regular hours .) Working days are based exclusively on business needs and are expected to be variable.

The Team

Our Financial Technology practice develops and licenses a growing family of proprietary software products and service solutions (see www.deloitte.com/ft ) to assist financial institutions with a number of complex topics such as accounting for credit deteriorated assets and the administration of investments in leveraged loans.

We are looking to add professionals to support our Solvas|Digitize™ solution team ( www.solvasdigitize.com ). Solvas|Digitize is an intelligent automation solution and managed service that is experiencing rapid growth and expansion across various industries and applications.

Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree or 1+ year of relevant work experience
Proficiency with all current technology and Microsoft Office 365 programs, including, but not limited to:
Laptop functionality
Video conferencing software (i.e. Zoom, Microsoft Teams, and Skype)
Ability to utilize multiple web applications (at least 2) simultaneously
Microsoft Teams
Online software programs for data entry
Flexibility in terms of work hours and workdays is required
Ability to find specific data points based on guidance/logical reasoning
Syndicated loan experience is preferred, but is not required
Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the future

For individuals assigned and/or hired to work in Washington State, Deloitte is required by law to include a reasonable estimate of the compensation range for this role. This compensation range is specific to Washington State and takes into account the wide range of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions including but not limited to skill sets; experience and training; licensure and certifications; and other business and organizational needs. At Deloitte, it is not typical for an individual to be hired at or near the top of the range for their role and compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances of each case. A reasonable estimate of the current rate of pay is $20 per hour.

Other details:

Work timing

Part-time, hourly basis with core hours between 4:00 a.m. and 7:00 p.m. Eastern Standard Time on specific days of each month based on business need. Occasional weekend and holiday coverage will be required.

Location

Any U.S. location will be considered for the appropriate candidate; team is located primarily in the New York, Dallas, and Houston metropolitan areas

Travel

Travel will be rare if required at all

As the nation’s leading bottled water company, BlueTriton Brands is dedicated to providing customers with healthy hydration options. Alongside that, we’re also committed to developing our people – enabling them to make the most of the many elements that help them to succeed. It’s a chance to use your knowledge, skills and experience to shine brightly and achieve your ambitions – all while delivering healthy hydration to millions of customers.

When it comes to leading the industry with the highest standards in quality, BlueTriton Corporate is a vital element of our success. Whether you’re based in finance or Human Resources, Legal, Communications or IT, you’ll be a force for good – someone who is trusted, empowered and supported to make a genuine, lasting impression on our organization.

Job Description


The Director, Enterprise Data Governance reports to the CFO, Product Supply and Business Services and is responsible for providing strategic enterprise data governance leadership across all BlueTriton Brands data domains. This critical role leads the Enterprise Data Management (EDM) team partnering closely with BTB Leadership teams, Data Domain Directors, Business Functional Leaders, and EDM Digital Technology teams to implement and drive improved data quality, data integrity, and data governance.


This role is based out of our Stamford, CT HQ with a hybrid work schedule (3 days a week in office).


In this role you will be responsible for day-to-day operational execution of data governance priorities aligned with digital technology deliverables, including data policies and best practices aimed at achieving the required level of consistency, accuracy, validity, and completeness of enterprise data.




Role And Responsibilities

Develop a vision and strategy for data governance across the enterprise including implementing a data governance framework.
Chair Data Governance Steering Committee responsible for defining data policies and standards
Develop the Data Governance framework including role definitions and accountabilities, charters, progress dashboards, published minutes, decision logs, change controls, data issue management and policies.
Serve as the product leader for metadata management and data quality capabilities, including data cataloging, data lineage, and data quality monitoring
Lead Business Process Management and process modeling governance enterprise wide
Implement data governance strategy, controls, and capabilities including data catalog, metadata management, data quality certification, data quality metrics, reference data management, data domain hierarchy and taxonomy management, reporting and analytics governance, data classification and tagging, data architecture, and data modeling
Design and deliver a data literacy program to educate executives and functional teams on importance of data and drive a data driven organizational culture
Manage stakeholder communication and progress reporting at various levels of the organization including leadership and executives
Participate in development of master data management strategies, implementation roadmaps and business cases.
Promote lean mindset as it pertains to the team’s operational effectiveness and opportunities to continuously improve data quality and data governance across the enterprise.

Qualifications


Minimum Qualifications

Bachelor’s Degree from an accredited university or college.
Minimum 10 years technology experience in data governance, Master Data Management (MDM), and data quality technologies, Data Governance or Enterprise Data Management.
Minimum 10 years Business Operations
Desired Skills

Ability to lead in a highly matrixed environment
Demonstrated continuous improvement experiences
Passionate about driving change and influence transformational change.
Ability to work with cross functional teams to drive operationalization of data governance and data quality products
Hands on experience in solving challenges for master data management, data quality problems or complex data integrations.
Key understanding of the importance of change management in the implementation of data and information management strategies
Ability to manage stakeholder communication and progress reporting at various levels of the organization including leadership and executives
Models’ humility, transparency, and delivers with focus

#LI-Hybrid

BlueTriton Brands is the nation’s leading bottled water company. Our water brands include Poland Spring, Arrowhead, Ozarka, Deer Park, Zephyrhills, Ice Mountain, Origins, Saratoga, Splash, Ac+ion and Pure Life. We’re passionate about creating shared value for society in all kinds of ways: from providing careers and benefits to communities where we operate to environmental stewardship – most notably responsible water management, lightweight packaging and advancing recycling in America. As a valuable part of our team, you’ll receive a competitive total rewards package – something that will provide you with the support you need to thrive both inside and outside of work. It’s not just the work that you’ll find fulfilling here though. As you build a career with us, you’ll receive exactly the kind of benefits you’d expect from a leading name in healthy hydration. The only question is, what elements will help you succeed at BlueTriton Brands?

At InnovaSystems, extraordinary solutions are born through innovative software.

A wholly owned subsidiary of Cydecor, InnovaSystems is a leading provider of information technology and enterprise-level solutions to the Department of Defense, federal, state, and local government agencies, delivering a vital service to support our nation’s National Security Strategy. We engage organizational effectiveness and readiness resulting in reduced costs, increased effectiveness, and accessibility.

As a member of the InnovaSystems team, you will be empowered to do the best work of your career with challenging assignments and collaborative teams that solve real-world problems.

We are currently seeking a SQL-savvy Database Analyst to join our team in Norfolk, VA!

PLEASE NOTE: the successful candidate must be eligible to obtain a DoD-issued security clearance at the secret level and be willing/able to work on-site, as required.

Overview

The Database Analyst will be joining an active team with a great culture of collaboration that administers a COGNOS based application that fused U. S. Navy readiness information from over one hundred sources into a single database structure. Using this data, we are constantly designing and building new reports and new ways to display our data as requested by our customers.

The ideal candidate will be a self-starter and problem solver with a willingness to use your expertise, share it and learn new technologies. From a technical standpoint, strong familiarity with Microsoft SQL is a must.

Primary Responsibilities:

Responsible for daily tasking, participating in scheduled team meetings, and assessment of requirements for database development to support front end BI reporting requirements.
Responsible for creating supporting database solutions, alignment with configuration management, source code development (Stored Procedures), BI report development, and some documentation.
Demonstrates strong interpersonal and problem-solving skills within a multi-disciplinary team of peers.
Demonstrates and executes technical vision in collaboration with Tech Lead, Solution Architect and other team developers.
Requires strong written and oral communication skills, with ability to express ideas and design benefits/drawbacks to technical and non-technical audience.

Required experience:

BS in Computer Science or Engineering plus at least two years’ experience OR a Bachelor’s Degree plus a minimum of four years of experience OR eight years of direct Database Analyst (SQL) experience.

At least two years of hands-on experience related to data analysis and data modeling with the following (or equivalent) technologies:

schema design (relationships, discovery, and normalization), query optimization, SQL, T-SQL, Stored Procedures, triggers, and indexing.
familiarity with administering, designing and developing database systems, data warehousing solutions.
familiarity with big data technologies, especially Spark and Hadoop as well as version control software, especially Git and Azure Repos.
Experience with shell scripting such as PowerShell, bash, or zsh is a plus.
The ability to obtain a Secret security clearance is required.
Cognos BI administration and report building a plus, but not required.

Benefits & Culture

When you join our team, we are committed to enhancing your skills through training and certification programs, as needed, to facilitate your role on the team. Opportunities for advancement and variety are offered through the various projects we create and build for our customers and careers can take on a leadership path or progressive technical track through career and succession planning. At InnovaSystems, we embrace a philosophy of continuous performance management, including relationship building, feedback and recognition and we provide the leadership training and software tools to support these concepts.

Our comprehensive employee benefits offerings include:

Flexible schedule
Company-paid employee development learning and licenses
10 paid holidays + 3 weeks (120 hours) of paid leave annually - hours increase after 3 years of service
401k plan w/ company match and comprehensive benefit package to include health, dental, vision, pet and supplemental insurance plans
Onsite offices with fitness facilities (depending on location)
Social events

You can have a positive impact on the scientific community!

The Civilian Health Solutions operation of the Health Group of Leidos is seeking a Biomedical Data Scientist who will provide technical support to the Congressionally Directed Medical Research Programs (CDMRP) in Frederick, Maryland. This is NOT a laboratory research position.

The CDMRP is a leading funder of research projects across a broad range of medical fields and military health. The Biomedical Data Scientist will work across a diverse variety of research programs in support of the CDMRP’s goal to transform healthcare through innovative and impactful research.

Why Leidos?

Leidos Life promotes excellent work-life balance. You can make an impact and have time for your well-being.

Be a part of a large, dynamic workforce with a broad range of scientific expertise.

Perform extensive quality control procedures on client data.

Populate SQL database with client data accurately and efficiently.

Respond to team member requests regarding data prior to client scientific meetings.

Develop and test new database features prior to release to the client.

Exceptional attention to detail.

Excellent organizational and time management skills.

Strong interpersonal, written, and oral communication skills.

Complete work orders as assigned through the IT Service Desk, Team Manager, and/or Project Managers.


Responsibilities
DATA & VOICE TECHNICIAN RESPONSIBILITIES:

Perform Moves, Adds, and Changes, as assigned, to end user voice and data services with minimal disruption to user and departmental functionality. This includes telephone handsets, and USU physical data connections and other items as assigned.
Provide basic infrastructure technical consultation and advisement for customers pertaining to moves, adds, and changes of physical data connections and telephone service.
Identify and recommend move, add, and change process and procedure improvements to the Team Manager and IT Administration.

Troubleshoot problems regarding end user voice (including handset and voicemail) and basic data connection services.
Troubleshoot and replace telephones and telephone accessories.
Monitor and review inventory levels by physical count, record keeping and/or visual inspection to identify need for purchasing materials, equipment or supplies.
Install Outside Plant copper/fiber optic cabling.
Fusion Spicing/Termination of fiber optic cable
Install security cameras, wireless access point and UPS systems.

IT INFRASTRUCTURE MAPPING AND DOCUMENTATION:

Maintain accurate wire management records of voice station equipment and cable pair assignments. This requires an in-depth knowledge of existing campus infrastructure including tunnels, maintenance holes, fiber optic cabling, copper cabling and node sites.

Gain in-depth knowledge of existing campus infrastructure including tunnels, maintenance holes, fiber optic cabling, copper cabling and node sites.
Daily monitoring and mapping of new and relocated IT infrastructure.

Experience performing data and voice moves adds and changes.
Strong, established track record of exceptional customer service.

Prior USU experience.
Knowledge of USU policies and procedures.
BICSI, NEC or other standards/best-practice installer-level certifications.

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:

Basic computer skills (Data Entry, Word, Excel, Outlook, Internet).
Demonstrated capacity for exceptional interpersonal, organizational, and communication skills (verbal and written).
Attention to detail and follow up.
Willingness to undertake any necessary training needed to perform job functions or to enhance performance.

Ability to train others, both non-technical end-users and technical staff.
Excellent customer service skills.
Ability to complete work orders in an effective and timely manner.

ADA
Employees work indoors and are protected from weather and/or contaminants, but not, necessarily, occasional temperature changes. The employee is regularly required to sit and often uses repetitive hand motions.


University Highlights
Utah State University (USU) was founded in 1888 and is Utahs land-grant and space-grant university. USU is one of only 146 research institutions in the U.S. classified as R1 "very high research activity" by the Carnegie Classification of Institutions of Higher Education. As one of the two premier research institutions in Utah, USU provides a high-quality education at an affordable price. With its main campus in Logan, the university serves approximately 27,500 students, including 24,255 undergraduates and 3,171 graduate students. USU Online has served students from all 50 states and 55 countries for 25 years.

USUs statewide system features three residential campuses, 30 total campus locations, and 23 Extension education centers. The university employs 903 full-time faculty members, 124 executive administrators, and 1,649 full-time support staff. USU offers 115 undergraduate majors, as well as 91 masters and 42 doctoral degrees. Learn more about USU.

A core characteristic of USU is engagement with communities and people in economic development, improvements to quality of life, and human capital. Through the practical application of knowledge, the University and its faculty engage and share expertise with the state, nation, and world, preserving the historical land-grant tradition of partnering with communities to address critical societal issues in the interest of the public good.

The USU main campus is located in beautiful Logan, Utah, a city of about 50,000 situated in a picturesque mountain valley about 80 miles north of Salt Lake City. Outstanding recreational opportunities abound in the nearby mountains and proximate region.

USU is sensitive to the needs of dual career couples and provides a Dual Career Assistance program to support careers for partners who are also seeking employment.

USU endeavors to provide reasonable accommodations to ensure equal access in all aspects of employment to qualified persons with disabilities. To request a reasonable accommodation for a disability, please contact the universitys ADA Coordinator in the Human Resource office at 435-797-0122 or submit a request at hr@usu.edu.

Principal Advisor Business Analysis

A company with a world-class reputation for safety and performance
Excellent opportunity to develop your career and further develop your technical & finance expertise
Hybrid role with flexibility to work from home based in Salt Lake City, UT

About the role

We are looking for a Principal Advisor - Business Analysis to evaluate investment proposals and support capital investment decisions for Resolution, a greenfields copper development project in Arizona. The role requires challenging the business while at the same time generating value-accretive ideas for investment. The focus is supporting the Resolution asset with exposure to the Copper portfolio.

This role provides strategic advice to the Copper business, where you will be able to utilize a broad scope of your financial valuation skills, while building on your industry and business knowledge in order to create world-class strategies, integrated business plans and evaluate asset value and support project, commercial and operational investment decisions. Copper BA teams are based at Salt Lake City, London and Conakry in addition to our current Brisbane, Perth and Montreal hubs

Reporting to the Senior Manager Business Analysis you will be responsible for:

Generating and evaluating business cases for investments proposals, commercial and business development opportunities by building and maintaining valuation models and associated business cases
Working alongside knowledgeable teams such as the study teams, the operations team and the commercial function to structure, develop and challenge investment proposals
Supporting the development of business cases for capital expenditure and project justifications, clearly communicating context and reasoning.
Writing investment committee papers, to present to the Rio Tinto senior management team
Leading the Business Analysis internal review process including preparation of draft investment committee papers and presentation of business case outcomes during reviews
Contributing to the strategy and planning process of Product Groups by conducting analysis, and providing updates on the valuation of assets

About you

To succeed in this role, you will have:

Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field e.g. Engineering, Business, Finance or related discipline.
10 years+ business analysis and commercial experience with large natural resource companies
Experience in managing complex valuation models and provide business insights
Excellent knowledge in financial modeling, with a strong understanding of valuation concepts (e.g. IRR, NPV)
A strategic thinker, a creative outlook combined with practicality and strategic focus.
Outstanding diplomatic negotiation skills in managing stakeholders, ability to influence
Result and excellent oriented, change agent and highly autonomous
A proactive and independent worker
A leader who can manage direct reports by delegating workflow, mentoring and developing skills of junior staff

It will also be beneficial if you have:

Prior experience in mining and metals, oil and gas or other capital-intensive heavy industry a plus (either directly or through professional services)

What we Offer

We are committed to providing our employees with a generous benefits package. Be recognized for your contribution, your thinking, your hard work, and go home knowing you’ve helped the world progress, we provide:

A safety-focused and inclusive working environment
Advantageous salary package with annual cash incentive awards (STIP) for eligible employees
Access to top-tier family-friendly health programs including medical, prescription drug, dental, vision, life insurance coverage, and various voluntary benefits.
Excellent retirement plan including up to 6% defined company contribution; Generous 401k matching program
Generous Rio Tinto employee share program, which allows you to purchase Rio Tinto Company shares.
Comprehensive leave policies which cover all moments that matter in life: PTO (paid time off), paid holidays, and paid bereavement leave.
A favorable child-caregiver leave program (Up to 100% salary top-up)
Discount programs for leisure purposes and access to Virgin Pulse with incentives supporting your wellbeing
Ongoing Employee Assistance Program (EAP) for you and your family; to help in addressing educational opportunities, addiction treatment, depression, stress, domestic issues, financial management, and legal concerns.
Our team and industry experts are here to support and work with you to explore your learning potential and career goals

About Rio Tinto

Every idea, every innovation, every little thing the world calls ‘progress’ begins with
a first step, and someone willing to take it: explorers, inventors, entrepreneurs. Pioneers.

For nearly 150 years, Rio Tinto has been a company of pioneers – generations of people spanning the globe, all with the grit and vision to produce materials essential to human progress.

Our iron ore has shaped skylines from Shanghai to Sydney. Our aluminium – the world’s first to be certified “responsible” – helps planes fly and makes cars lighter. Our copper helps wind turbines power cities and our boron helps feed the world and explore the universe.
Our diamonds help us celebrate the best parts of life.

Where you’ll be working

Once in operation, Resolution Copper has the potential to supply nearly 25% of US copper demand and create several thousand direct and indirect jobs in the Pioneer Mining District of Arizona, with an economic value estimated at several billion dollars over the mine life.

The project will rely on a block caving technique to extract the deposit that lies more than 2,000 metres below the surface. This method uses gravity to remove the ore and is the most viable way to recover the resource.

In 2019, the project achieved a significant milestone – issuance of the Draft Environmental Impact Statement (DEIS) by the US Forest Service (USFS). Resolution Copper continues permitting and community engagement activities, shaft and underground development studies, and advancing data collection to further orebody knowledge.

Every Voice Matters

We are committed to an inclusive environment where people feel comfortable to be themselves. We want our people to feel that all voices are heard, all cultures respected and that a variety of perspectives are not only welcome – they are essential to our success. We treat each other fairly and with dignity regardless of race, gender, nationality, ethnic origin, religion, age, sexual orientation or anything else that makes us different.

At Rio Tinto, we particularly welcome and encourage applications from Indigenous Peoples, women, the LGBTQ+ community, mature workers, people with disabilities and people from different cultural backgrounds.

Equal Opportunity Employer M/F/D/V

My name is Alicia. I’m the hiring manager for this position, and I welcome you to join our Emerson family as a Business Data Analyst!

This role will be a great opportunity not only for you to learn cutting edge technologies and techniques, but for you to make a tremendous impact by providing insights that will shape the way we do business.

I believe part of my role as a Manager is to help my employees grow, and to provide the tools and opportunities they need to achieve their goals and objectives.

Professional development is something I am very passionate about, and as part of the role, you will have opportunities for Professional Development, Mentorship, training and Certifications.

If you love to learn, grow and be challenged and if you have a passion for shaping the future, then this role may be for you!

Position Summary:

As a Business Data Analyst, you will have an integral role in adding value and making an impact to the organization by providing meaningful insights that drive business decision-making.

You will use cutting edge technology to transform data into information for analysis in a user-friendly format. You will search out critical data for better definition, conduct analysis with current quantitative techniques, and provide recommendations to enable Flow Controls to better understand its business and market.

In this role, you will work with professionals throughout the organization in a collaborative setting to solve business needs across North America.

AS A BUSINESS DATA ANALYST, YOU WILL:

Support Sales, Operations and Planning with forecasts based on market analysis of customer, market, and company data
Collect, analyze, and evaluate data turning it into usable information that can be interpreted into business intelligence
Partner with key stakeholders to obtain market (Customer, Competitor, and Flow Controls) information
Collaborate with team members to provide effective solutions for our data needs
Create data visualization tools for our business to make intelligent decisions
Using automated tools to extract data from primary and secondary sources
Use statistical tools to identify, analyze, and interpret patterns and trends in complex data sets that could be helpful for the diagnosis and prediction
Actively participate in continuous improvement activities to support business performance
Devise methods to collect and categorize customer, competitor, and Flow Controls data
Identify data errors and make appropriate adjustments to ensure data accuracy
Other duties as assigned by Manager
Demonstrate commitment to Service Level Doctrine and Safety Culture
REQUIRED EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE & SKILLS:
Bachelor’s Degree in Mathematics, IT or Business
Desire and ability to learn new technologies.
Critical thinker with a passion for solving problems.
Self-starter comfortable working independently with limited direction
Legal authorization to work in the United States
PREFERRED EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE & SKILLS:
0-5 years of related experience
Business metric analysis
Must display strong mathematical skills to collect, measure, organize, and analyze data
Knowledge of programming languages like SQL, R, Python
Knowledge of data visualization software like Power BI, Tableau, or Qlik
Knowledge of how to create and apply the most accurate algorithms to datasets
General machine learning experience in topics like regression modeling or classification
Express a systematic and logical approach to problem solving
Must show accuracy and attention to detail
Must display creativity and ability for critical thinking
Must have excellent communication, interpersonal and presentation skills
Must possess a process improvement and problem-solver mentality
Ability to work effectively in teams and interact with all levels of the organization
Ability to handle multiple tasks and meet various deadlines
Clearly understand integrated financial systems and the Microsoft Office Suite
Background in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Information Management, Data Analytics
Project management experience


Flexible Work Schedule - Remote Work Option:

This role has the flexibility of a remote work option up to three days a week. Our teams work together to ensure our chosen work schedules enable our creativity and efficiency as we serve the needs of our customers.

Job_title: VP, Advanced Analytics - Global Fleet Data
Job_description:
What We Need
FLEETCOR is seeking a seasoned analytics, engineering and delivery leader to be the product and engineer owner for the Global Fleet Data COE Advanced Analytics team. The leader will be in charge of building out and growing in house advanced analytics capability in order to support business decision making with data driven models and products. The position will be located in FLEETCOR’s Atlanta headquarters in Buckhead, GA.

The ideal candidate will take lead in creating the data & analytics roadmap for the business, design the operating business/IT support model for the Advanced Analytic team based on understanding of the business objective and existing infrastructure and resources. He/she will engage with stakeholders regularly to prioritize the business needs, and manage end to end development, delivery and integration of the analytics products to generate business value. The candidate will also work with various IT functional teams to develop/improve the enterprise architect/infrastructure/processes around analytics areas, such as cloud operations, Data Engineering, Production Support, etc. The candidate is expected to ultimately drive the advanced analytic function and accelerate the adoption of data driven decision making culture for the business.

How We Work
As the VP of Advanced Analytics, you will be expected to work in a hybrid environment. FLEETCOR will set you up for success by providing:

Assigned workspace in Atlanta, Buckhead, GA.
Company-issued equipment
Monthly home internet stipend

Role Responsibilities

The responsibilities of the role will include:

Creating an overall Data and Analytics Strategic Approach and Analytics COE for Global Fleet business unit
Developing a high performing centralized advanced analytics team including data scientists, data analysts, and business analysts to support business needs
Delivering high quality analytical applications and models focused on data monetization and operational excellence
Translating strategic objectives to concrete analytical questions focused on business-driven outcomes.
Leading solution design, resource planning, business case development of analytic projects, coordinating with business and IT teams through application, product and customer lifecycles
Responsible for end-to-end development, delivery and integration of analytics/data product working with cross-functional teams and various stakeholders, including credit, sales, operation, analytics, IT, etc.
Designing business and IT operating models and processes to drive innovation and be able to quickly react to changing business demands
Collaborating with business stakeholders to develop analytical product roadmap and drive projects from concept to launch in a fast-paced environment
Leveraging Agile methodology to continuously review the business needs, refines priorities, outlines milestones and deliverables, and identifies opportunities and risks.
Developing and maintaining appropriate tracking and reporting of analytic product performance
Collaborating with senior leaders within the ACOE on translating insights and opportunities into actionable models, controlled experiments, or optimizations across ACOE teams.
Preparing documentation, reports, and presentations that explain the outcome of analytic workstreams.
Driving project milestones to completion. Establish and enhance partnerships, define accountability, and lead activities which operationalize key findings.

Qualifications & Skills

5-10 years’ experience in an analytics role, expertise in advanced analytics (data science, Machine Learning, Cloud operations) with balanced technical knowledge, operational experience and business acumen.
5+ years of experience designing and managing analytical projects/teams
Strong programming skills and ability to utilize a variety of data/analytic software/languages/tools.
Experience developing enterprise grade analytics solutions using Cloud platforms (i.e. AWS, Azure, Google Cloud, etc.) and managing analytics solutions at every stage of the analytics lifecycle from ideation to production
Strong communication skills. The ability to successfully comprehend and communicate advanced analytics artifacts, business insights, and resulting implications to non-technical business partners. Ability to work with a diverse team
Deep understanding of data domains, models, and implications for analytics use in at least one industry, including telecommunications, cable, finance, media, advertising, or similar
Deep working knowledge of SDLC methodologies (Agile/Rational)
Hands-on experience in engineering tooling, practices and processes, experience managing projects during engineering and delivery phases
Strong business presence, capable of understanding various business functions and problems, ability to structure a framework to solve those problems
Strong team building and leadership skills…balance of hands-on and effective delegation
Proactive, self-starter with excellent project management skills and the ability to manage multiple tasks effectively
High degree of organization and attention to detail, individual initiative, and personal accountability

Benefits & Perks

Medical, Dental & Vision benefits available the 1st month after hire
Automatic enrollment into our 401k plan (subject to eligibility requirements)
Virtual fitness classes offered company-wide
Robust PTO offerings including: major holidays, vacation, sick, personal, & volunteer time
Employee discounts with major providers (i.e. wireless, gym, car rental, etc.)
Philanthropic support with both local and national organizations
Fun culture with company-wide contests and prizes

Our Company & Purpose
FLEETCOR is a global leader in business payments, laser focused on developing smarter ways for businesses to pay their expenses. Since 2000, FLEETCOR has developed innovative digital solutions that help businesses better track, manage, and pay their expenses. Today, FLEETCOR is an S&P 500 company with hundreds of thousands of customers using our products in over 100 countries. Companies of all sizes, industries and geographies rely on our product portfolio to manage spending more quickly, efficiently and securely than ever before.
We embrace a culture grounded in five key values: integrity, collaboration, innovation, execution and people. These values offer you the opportunity to ‘thrive & grow’ through career development, volunteer, community, and wellness initiatives. This allows you to create a balance between professional goals and personal achievement.

FLEETCOR is also committed to building and nurturing a culture of diversity, inclusion, equality, and belonging by:


Welcoming people of different backgrounds, cultures, ethnicities, genders, and sexual orientations;
Empowering our people to share their experiences and ideas through open forums and individual conversations; and
Valuing each person’s unique perspectives and individual contributions.

Embracing diversity enables our people to “make the difference” as FLEETCOR and its more than 8,000 employees continue to shape the future of global payments. Learn more by visiting www.FLEETCOR.com or following FLEETCOR on LinkedIn.

Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer
FLEETCOR is an Equal Opportunity Employer. FLEETCOR provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants without regard to race, color, gender (including pregnancy), religion, national origin, ancestry, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, language, ancestry, genetic information, veteran and/or military status or any other group status protected by federal or local law. If you require reasonable accommodation for the application and/or interview process, please notify a representative of the Human Resources Department.
For more information about our commitment to equal employment opportunity and pay transparency, please click the following links: EEO and Pay Transparency

Work in a small business environment at a small shop that dismantles vehicles for parts sales as well as cataloging and photographing parts. Summary

The Data Analytics Specialist, under the general direction of the Director of Information Technology, and in accordance with good business practices and established procedures, will gather, manage, analyze, and report data from internal Organ Procurement Organization (OPO) systems and external industry systems. Analyze data to establish baseline performance metrics. Produce internal and external reports and assist with publication initiatives. Make recommendations for process improvement initiatives. Provide continuous monitoring of local donation activity data and regular reports to leadership. Promote efficiency throughout the organization utilizing creative and innovative thinking to develop, analyze and verify statistical measures.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities

Responsible for the integrity and quality of data within the Information Technology (IT) infrastructure to support operations, management and decision-making. Actively participate in cross departmental initiatives ensuring data is efficiently organized, managed and distributed. Enable strategic use of enterprise-wide information for cross-functional organizations and teams.
Provide data related services throughout the organization. Consult with leadership and workforce on process measures, evaluation techniques, as well as, current and potential IT related solutions.
Verify organ and tissue donor statistics in the electronic medical record system while using analytical tools.
Assist with process improvement where data or IT infrastructure is integral to the improvement. Monitors and participate in the compilation of OPO quality measures.
Ensure data collection processes are consistent, repeatable, and appropriate throughout the organization.
Assist with internal and external reporting requests and requirements.
Validates and analyzes various data, metrics, and information via business intelligence (BI), statistical and quality tools.
Analyze all organ and tissue recovery data and produces reports regarding activity, outcome, and recommended improvement areas.
Assist with the tracking of organizational metrics to support the success of the organization’s strategic efforts.
Facilitates team-based problem solving and multidisciplinary team use of various data-driven process improvement techniques such as Process Mapping and Root Cause Analysis. Applies business logic and ask questions that are not necessarily apparent.
Supports organizational survey processes with analysis, tracking and developing of survey data for both internal and external partners.
Develop and maintain specialized datasets and systems for recording and tracking appropriate data and statistical information.
Creates and distributes standardized and special reports, summaries, and analyses.
Organizes appropriate resources, organizational priorities and manages systems as related to data activities.
Maintains monthly scorecards and dashboards for the organization to ensure compliance with performance measures.
Integrates features and tools of Office 365 into the IT infrastructure.
Maintains a continuous and independent education on cutting-edge statistical techniques and tools.
Other duties as assigned.

Qualifications, Education & Experience


Bachelor’s Degree (preferred);
Minimum 2 of years’ experience in business analysis, and/or a quality improvement role;
Five years of experience with an organ and/or tissue procurement agency (preferred); or
An equivalent combination of education and experience.
Strong attention to detail and accuracy (required).
Ability to approach work conscientiously and methodically.
Ability to exercise initiative and sound judgment.
Understanding of basic statistics (required).
Demonstrated organizational skills required and ability to see tasks through to completion (required).
Strong interpersonal skills and ability to work both independently and as part of a team (required).
Working knowledge of medical terminology and medical records/procedures (preferred).
Demonstrated knowledge of and ability using a Personal Computer (PC), related Microsoft Office software and other report writing and BI software.

Full Time, Flexible weekday schedule. 36 hours/week.

Pay Range is between $23.21-$34.80/hr, depending on years of relevant and like experience.

Boulder Community Health is a Certified Level II Trauma Center. In 2022, we celebrated the 100thanniversary of the founding of our organization. We are honored to hold the awards of 2021 U.S. News & World ‘Best Hospitals for Maternity Care’, 2019 Best Medical Facility from Boulder Weekly, and Best Local Employer from Daily Camera. Come be part of an independent, community-focused health system; feel good knowing that your work will make a difference in people’s lives and positively contribute to the community.

POSITION SUMMARY

Coordinates the cancer data management system to promote quality care for the cancer patients at Boulder Community Health. Maintains compliance with the requirements for an approved cancer program and national accreditation program for breast centers set forth by the American College of Surgeons Commission on Cancer. Maintains compliance with the requirements for mandatory statewide reporting set forth by the Colorado Cancer Registry and Department of Public health.

JOB QUALIFICATIONS

Education or Formal Training

Accredited Record Technician (RHIT) or Registered Record Administrator (RHIA) preferred. Certified Tumor Registrar (CTR) required. ICD-9 Coding, cancer staging and word-processing. Expertise required with Excel spreadsheets and CNExT (or similar automated cancer registry system) ACOS web-based data upload process including but not limited to the National Call for Data (NCDB) and the Facility Identifiable data (FIPS level 1 & 2). State of Colorado Public Health and Environment compliance with state and federal laws mandating data collection and compliance in the research of those diagnosed with and treated for cancer. The Cancer Registry is responsible for guarding the hospitals compliance and fostering a cohesive relationship with the State liaisons and personnel and providing documentation to them upon request, to evidence the hospitals compliance with the state and federal statutes.

Special Qualifications (Licensure, Registration, etc.)

Bachelor or Associate Degree in health information technology are related field preferred. Certified Tumor Registrar (CTR) required.

Knowledge, Skill and Ability

Knowledge of all American College of Surgeons and State of Colorado requirements for Cancer Registry accreditation process. Working knowledge of all levels of accreditation and evidence of experience with standards.
Evidence of ability to produce an annual report and comply with procedures for reporting to the state as required by American College of Surgeons.
Demonstrated ability for successful completion of ACOS accreditation survey.
Demonstrated excellent communication skills:
Writing ability including accurate grammar and spelling as evidenced by concise and clear report writing, compilation and organization of annual reports, preparation of tumor conference agendas, and synopses of data.
Verbal skills as evidenced by ability to communicate with all members of the health care team, the state tumor registry and patients when appropriate.
Demonstrated ability to execute a successful breast & cancer conference.
Demonstrated ability to accurately analyze and abstract patient records with an average time of 60 minutes or less per abstract.
Detail-oriented with ability to make independent decisions and use critical thinking skills.
Demonstrated ability to execute accomplishment of ACOS required registry data studies
Demonstrated ability to execute scientific studies leading to sound data to be presented to the Cancer Committee as a source of outcomes analysis.
Demonstrated ability to keep apprised of the ever-changing policies and procedures of the state of Colorado and the data reporting elements involved in this process.
Demonstrated ability to research and comply with changing federal agency regulations.
Demonstrated ability to stay up to date with regulatory and complementary agencies to adjust hospital abstracting when a specific precedent has been changed or set. The agencies include but are not limited to; coding schemes (CPT, ICD-0-3, ICD-9-CM), Surveillance Epidemiology & End Results (SEER), American Joint Commission on Cancer (AJCC).
Must have knowledge and ability to perform required aspects of the computer and its programs: follow-up letters, statistical reports, Colorado State Cancer Registry reporting and other required medical and cancer data.

Experience

At least five years of experience as a cancer data registrar in an ACOS accredited Cancer Program.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Assists in developing and maintaining cancer program standards by ACoS/COC and NAPBC.
Coordinates maintenance of appropriate files, reports and other cancer related data to ensure approval standards by the American College of Surgeons and the Colorado State Cancer Registry. Preparing graphs and statistics.
Prepares cancer reports and statistical data of the cancer program and breast center activities to administration, physician, outside agencies and/or Colorado State Cancer Registry.
Develops and implement changes in cancer registry policies and procedures to ensure CoC and NAPBC requirements
Monitors quality data (including periodic audits) to ensure data quality and compliance with state and CoC and NAPBC requirements.
Coordinates, plans, attends, documents, and promotes attendance at all Tumor Conferences.
Schedules a minimum of 4 Cancer Committee meetings a year on the medical staff calendar.
Drafts Cancer Committee agendas to represent each standard outlined by the ACOS. Allocate time on the agenda for each coordinator and specialty to give report, at the designated intervals required by the ACOS, if not more often.
Serves as a member of the Cancer Committee.
Coordinates Cancer Registry abstractors and oversight of all of their encompassing cancer registry activities.

About Boulder Community Health and Boulder, Colorado

Uncompromising medical excellence delivered with respect and compassion. Since 1922, Boulder Community Health has built a strong reputation on these values. As community-owned and operated not-for-profit hospital and clinic locations, we remain dedicated to the evolving needs of our citizens and providing access to high-quality care. Nestled in the foothills of the Rocky Mountains, the Boulder lifestyle is conductive to enjoying the outdoors and brings a fresh perspective to healthcare practice. Surround yourself by natural beauty and an active, life-embracing community. Enjoy state-of-the-art facilities and equipment along with competitive compensation and benefits, including health/dental/life, tuition reimbursement, on-site fitness center, Employee Wellness, Employee Activities & Discounts, and many more!


Location: Boulder Community Health · Oncology Services Admin
Schedule: Full-time, Days - 8 hour shifts, M - F, flexible schedule

E-commerce healthcare training company seeks full-time Data Manager to lead our team in the processing, loading and quality checking the marketing leads we acquire and add to our database.

These qualified marketing prospects are the lifeblood of our company. You will have the important job of managing the processes and staff that are responsible for the capture, completion, and accuracy of all marketing prospects added to our system. This process supports our marketing team and drives the majority of our company’s revenue.

Your day-to-day duties will range from diving in and processing actual prospect records before they are loaded to setting strategic goals for your team to ensure our prospect database continues to grow.

Key Responsibilities:

Manage the acquisition, validation, tagging, and formatting of new email marketing prospects.
Work closely with marketing team to optimize prospect volume and results
Coordinate between departments to ensure deadlines are met
Prioritize data so that the highest quality prospects are processed first
Meet monthly volume and accuracy goals
Front-line management of data processing team of 2 (1 onsite and 1 offsite)
Audit work to ensure accuracy and quality of data before loading
When needed, jump in and process prospects with your team to ensure goals are met
Solve problems as they arise to keep prospects moving

Requirements:

Values: Buy in and to our company values
Experience: 3+ years’ experience as data project manager (or similar job), preferably supporting marketing functions
Computer: EXCELLENT MS Excel skills

MS Dynamics and SQL a massive plus, but not required.

Healthcare Knowledge: Although not completely necessary, it would be hugely beneficial
Details: Track numerous details under tight deadlines with minimal errors.
Change: Ability to shift gears quickly.
Location: North Naples office (partially remote may be possible after time)
Deadlines: Meet numerous deadlines
Management: Strong problem-solving, multitasking and prioritization skills. You never give up.
Communications: Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Auditing: Ability to utilize key indicators to identify problems – then take action to resolve.
Strategy: Regularly examine current processes to identify opportunities to improve speed and accuracy.

Company Core Values: Own it, People Matter, Persistent Optimism, and Results

Our entire team moves fast and never shies away from a challenge. We are definitively a glass entirely full group. This doesn’t mean that we have our heads in the clouds. We live in reality, driven by data and numbers. When mistakes happen (which they do), we own them. Then, we use what we’ve learned and do it right the next time. We respect each other, but say what needs to be said. We work hard so we can have a balanced life. With that said, when we are here we are results-oriented and driven.

This role is a chance to use your talent and expertise to make a visible difference in our company growth. The opportunity to work with a dedicated, talented, fun team that love their jobs, thrive on results and really enjoy coming to work each day (life is too short to simply go through the motions). We even have a company dog (who is hypoallergenic).

We’re looking for a rock star to join our team that can make a real difference in our company success. So, if you have the skills and meet the requirements in this posting and if you want to work somewhere that appreciates you and the work you do, is fast-moving, positive and results driven – we would love to have you join our team!!!!

Manage unforeseen circumstances that occur and provide relevant feedback to Client / CBRE management where necessary.

Job Summary
The Datacenter Automation Systems (DAS) team is committed to the successful implementation of autonomous and semi-autonomous vehicles throughout multiple datacenters. CBRE is seeking a full-time, permanent, CAD Operator with experience in MEP design, manufacturing or data center robotics-centric automation solutions. The DAS CAD Operator will report to the Client-approved location:
Moncks Corner, SC - full time / on site
The DAS CAD Operator requirements may vary according to Client-determined assignments, but most content relates to creating detailed designs for industrial automation equipment and systems in the DAS robotics portfolio at the Client's data centers. This position is part of a multi-disciplinary team creating engineering documentation and design drawing packages. The individual will collaborate with project engineers, technical writers, project managers, and other CAD/BIM Operators. Ideal candidates would be familiar with establishing and managing a design environment. Ideal candidates must be comfortable communicating regularly via video conference, email and internal ticketing systems.

Job Duties:
Acquire clear understanding of product requirements by reviewing, understanding, interpreting and revising technical specifications, blueprints and engineering illustrations, mockups, and prototypes.
Ability to read and interpret design standards and specifications, blueprints, drawings, redlines, etc
Coordinate the CAD design for Navigation Tape and GeoMarker installation package
Installation Drawings
Navigation DesignLayout
GeoMarker datum development
Material Takeoff
Working understanding of construction design package development for field installation.
Ability to translate existing field conditions from documentation and redlines to revise/edit design drawing packages.
Ability to learn software such as Lucidchart to generate shape files for navigation translated from design drawings. .
Capable of managing shifting design production to coordinate with field installation schedules.
Coordinate file management with 3rd party teams for document file transfer.
Maintain audits of latest design revisions against floor plan modifications.
Ability to perform repetitive field measurement tasks for long durations such as bending, kneeling, squatting ,walking, climbing stairs, etc.
Must have excellent organizational skills
Ability to communicate effectively, both orally and in writing

Other duties as assigned.

SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES

No formal supervisory responsibilities in this position.

QUALIFICATIONS

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.

Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

EDUCATION and EXPERIENCE

Bachelor's degree in Architecture, Engineering, Construction Management, or related field. Minimum two or more years' construction administration, architecture, engineering or similar experience.

Preferred experience with some data center infrastructure projects. Experience in mission critical data centers is a strong plus. Preferred experience with robotic process automation.

CERTIFICATES and/or LICENSES

Working towards or eligible for licensure as either a Professional Engineer or Registered Architect is desired.

COMMUNICATION SKILLS

Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Strong organizational and analytical skills. Ability to provide efficient, timely, reliable and courteous service to customers. Ability to effectively present information.

FINANCIAL KNOWLEDGE

Requires knowledge of financial terms and principles. Ability to calculate intermediate figures such as percentages, discounts, and/or commissions. Conducts basic financial analysis.

REASONING ABILITY

Ability to understand and carry out general instructions in standard situations. Ability to solve problems in standard situations. Requires intermediate analytical and quantitative skills.

OTHER SKILLS and ABILITIES

Intermediate skills with Microsoft Office Suite. Ability to read and understand architectural drawings. Working knowledge in MS Project is helpful. Knowledge of leases, contracts, and construction practices preferred. 3+ years of minimum proficiency in the use of AutoCAD and Revit. Knowledge of Best Management Practices CAD/BIM environment. Autodesk Software - CAD BIM Solidworks BIM360 etc.

Basic knowledge of the entitlement/permitting process and construction delivery methods and agreements. Some familiarity with construction best practices, general building codes, and various building types and systems. Passion for being detail oriented and highly organized.

SCOPE OF RESPONSIBILITY

Decisions made with general understanding of procedures and company policies to achieve set results and deadlines. Errors in judgment may cause short-term impact to co-workers and supervisor.

Job_description:
Office and Data Manager Job Description

Job Summary: Response is a non-profit in Aspen that works with survivors of domestic and sexual abuse. The office and data manager is responsible for managing the Response office and data collection and reporting as well as supporting the fundraising and outreach functions of the organization. (part time considered for the right applicant).

Responsibilities:

1. General Office:

Performs the full range of administrative duties for the office, including office management, maintaining office supplies and equipment. Answers incoming calls; assists visitors; handles mail.
Maintains agency files, ensures payment requests are submitted to the executive director, processes reports and renewals.
Works with vendors and other agencies to ensure the highest level of service.
Paying bills and processing payments.
Support other staff as needed.

2. Crisis Helpline:

Communicating with volunteer advocates with updates and scheduling to ensure that crisis helpline is adequately staffed.
Maintains volunteer and back up staff records and individual hours.
After completing the 30-hour volunteer advocate training, may be asked to work up to one week per month on the crisis line for evenings and a full weekend (additional compensation).

3. Fundraising and Outreach

Maintains Response website and social media outlets with accurate and timely postings.
Maintains donor database for fundraising and outreach efforts.
Provide logistical support for all Response events including volunteer management, soliciting donations, working with sponsors, marketing and more.
Works with executive director to create email and print newsletters on a regular basis.

4. Grant and Data Management

Coordination of Response’s annual grant calendar.
Assist executive director with grant reporting and tracking.
Coordination of program evaluation systems.
May include grant writing and proofing under the supervision of the executive director.
Maintains organizational databases and is responsible for overall records management.

Qualifications:

At least three years of work in an office setting.
Strong computer skills: Microsoft office, including Excel and Word and database experience.
A professional office manner and careful attention to detail.
The ability to maintain confidentiality and a calm manner when dealing with people in crisis.
A strong team player who is flexible with time and duties as they evolve.
Passionate about Response’s mission, culturally sensitive and trauma informed.
Background check and work verification required.
Ability to work 9 am -5 pm at the Aspen office (only applicants with housing in the Roaring Fork Valley will be considered)
Bilingual language skills (English and Spanish) preferred.

General Physical Requirements:

Hearing and vision corrected to normal ranges; able to work in high-stress situations; able to use the telephone and able to function in an office environment, including operation of office equipment.

Salary Range: $$27-$30/hour depending on experience. Benefits after 90 day trial period: 10 days of vacation per year, 11 paid holidays, 78 hours of wellness leave, health insurance, health spending account and retirement contribution.

To Apply: Send a short letter explaining why you would be a good fit for this position and your professional resume. WILL NOT CONSIDER WITHOUT BOTH

Position Details:

Summary of Duties:

This position is responsible for the development, implementation and management of systems used to collect research data for the Paul G. Allen School for Global Health (SGH) at Washington State University. This position interacts with a broad range of researchers to gather requirements for data collection and storage, and then designs, implements, and maintains these systems. Working as an intermediary between the School for Global Health and the College of Veterinary Medicine's Veterinary Information Systems unit, this position will also assist in the preparation of data sets for analysis and will act as the primary support contact for a REDCap instance supporting both domestic and international research programs, as well as other data collection systems. Infrequent international travel to assist international research programs may be necessary in this position.

To support WSU's ability to attract talent in a competitive job market, this recruitment has been approved for a hiring incentive/moving allowance payment of up to one month's salary.


Depending on your level of experience, you may begin as a IT Data Management-Entry or a IT Data Management- Journey.


To be considered for a IT Data Management-Entry, applicants must have:

Position requires a Bachelor's degree in a related technology field. Any combination of relevant education and experience may be substituted for the educational requirement on a year-for-year basis.
