Job Description

Position Title: Development Data Manager
Reports to: Director of Philanthropy
Position Status: Full-Time, Requires Flexible Hours, Hybrid schedule with in-person and virtual. This position requires a quiet workspace for privacy while on remote.

Position Summary:
The Development Data Manager will work closely with the fundraising team, finance team, and executive director to support the fundraising goals of United Way’s dynamic organization. The Development Data Manager is responsible for developing and maintaining donor contact records, campaigns, funds, appeals and solicitations. The position will be responsible for managing department’s mailings, submitting corporate grants, and support of events and volunteer projects.

Development Responsibilities:

Serves as administrative support to the fundraising team and executive director, including scheduling meetings, creating, and managing calendar invites, preparing supporting materials, and sending reminders.
Completes and tracks corporate grant applications in collaboration with fundraising and community impact teams.
Problem solves special situations with finance team.
Coordinates and prepares mail merges, appeals, acknowledgments, awards, thank yous, and other resource development correspondence.
Supports and participates in organizational activities and/or special events.

Duties may include assisting with the planning and execution of the project and working registration table always ensuring volunteers have a meaningful experience.

Responsible for management of campaign material inventory and supplies to ensure adequate supplies are available to support workplace giving campaigns.
Participates in training, webinars, and seminars to keep abreast of industry and system’s best practices and enhancements.
Lead coordination and communications with other Global fundraising accounts and regional United Way’s when there is a company with locations in other

United Way service areas,

Responsible for preparing, coordinating, and delivering campaign materials to companies.
Send correspondence, manage RSVPs and prepare materials for annual

Employee Campaign Coordinator trainings.

Complete yearly DBII report to United Way Worldwide by deadline.
Pull donor information and provide ongoing campaign status as requested.
Assist with the prospecting, research and outreach for current and new partners.
Take meeting minutes for Resource Development committee and provide to

Committee Chair and Director in a timely manner.

Assist with Resource Development Strategic Plan efforts and follow through on its completion.

Responsibilities within Customer Relationship Management System (CRM):

Primary responsibility for creating and updating campaign giving pages.
Provide regular data entry to ensure accurate reporting of all fundraising efforts including maintaining accurate corporate and individual donor records in CRM database.
Maintains quality of data including accurate company and individual donor records in CRM database.
Processes all fundraising and campaign transactions such as, match requests and workplace contributions.
Carry out creation of envelopes for miscellaneous, individual, corporate and employee pledge posting.
Compiles necessary data and backup documentation for invoices and reports.
Assists with campaign data management and provides reports as needed; to include but not limited to campaign performance, communication, donor information, compilation of recognition names for leadership giving roster and statistical analysis.
Provides research and reconciliation for third-party processed accounts to ensure accuracy of reporting.

Qualifications - Education and Experience:

Associates degree or 2 years’ experience in similar role.
1 year experience using Salesforce a must.
A background in finance is helpful.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

Strong organization and time management skills with ability to multi-task.
Ability to maintain confidentiality.
Proficiency in Salesforce, Microsoft Office including Word, Excel, and Power

Point is a must.

Must have the ability to perform mail merges and learn new applications quickly.
Excellence grammar, spelling, and proofreading skills.
Understanding of and commitment to the mission, vision, and goals of United

Way.

Additional Requirements:

Position requires local travel. Valid driver’s license and reliable transportation is required. Vehicle insurance and up to date registration is required. Travel mileage is reimbursable at the approved IRS rate.
Ability to lift 30 pounds.

Mohawk Valley Area does not discriminate on the basis of age, race, color, creed/religion, disability, national origin, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, pregnancy, marital status, familial status, military and veteran status, domestic violence victim status, arrest and/or criminal conviction status, genetic predisposition or carrier status, and any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

Full Time, Flexible weekday schedule. 36 hours/week.

Pay Range is between $23.21-$34.80/hr, depending on years of relevant and like experience.

Boulder Community Health is a Certified Level II Trauma Center. In 2022, we celebrated the 100thanniversary of the founding of our organization. We are honored to hold the awards of 2021 U.S. News & World ‘Best Hospitals for Maternity Care’, 2019 Best Medical Facility from Boulder Weekly, and Best Local Employer from Daily Camera. Come be part of an independent, community-focused health system; feel good knowing that your work will make a difference in people’s lives and positively contribute to the community.

POSITION SUMMARY

Coordinates the cancer data management system to promote quality care for the cancer patients at Boulder Community Health. Maintains compliance with the requirements for an approved cancer program and national accreditation program for breast centers set forth by the American College of Surgeons Commission on Cancer. Maintains compliance with the requirements for mandatory statewide reporting set forth by the Colorado Cancer Registry and Department of Public health.

JOB QUALIFICATIONS

Education or Formal Training

Accredited Record Technician (RHIT) or Registered Record Administrator (RHIA) preferred. Certified Tumor Registrar (CTR) required. ICD-9 Coding, cancer staging and word-processing. Expertise required with Excel spreadsheets and CNExT (or similar automated cancer registry system) ACOS web-based data upload process including but not limited to the National Call for Data (NCDB) and the Facility Identifiable data (FIPS level 1 & 2). State of Colorado Public Health and Environment compliance with state and federal laws mandating data collection and compliance in the research of those diagnosed with and treated for cancer. The Cancer Registry is responsible for guarding the hospitals compliance and fostering a cohesive relationship with the State liaisons and personnel and providing documentation to them upon request, to evidence the hospitals compliance with the state and federal statutes.

Special Qualifications (Licensure, Registration, etc.)

Bachelor or Associate Degree in health information technology are related field preferred. Certified Tumor Registrar (CTR) required.

Knowledge, Skill and Ability

Knowledge of all American College of Surgeons and State of Colorado requirements for Cancer Registry accreditation process. Working knowledge of all levels of accreditation and evidence of experience with standards.
Evidence of ability to produce an annual report and comply with procedures for reporting to the state as required by American College of Surgeons.
Demonstrated ability for successful completion of ACOS accreditation survey.
Demonstrated excellent communication skills:
Writing ability including accurate grammar and spelling as evidenced by concise and clear report writing, compilation and organization of annual reports, preparation of tumor conference agendas, and synopses of data.
Verbal skills as evidenced by ability to communicate with all members of the health care team, the state tumor registry and patients when appropriate.
Demonstrated ability to execute a successful breast & cancer conference.
Demonstrated ability to accurately analyze and abstract patient records with an average time of 60 minutes or less per abstract.
Detail-oriented with ability to make independent decisions and use critical thinking skills.
Demonstrated ability to execute accomplishment of ACOS required registry data studies
Demonstrated ability to execute scientific studies leading to sound data to be presented to the Cancer Committee as a source of outcomes analysis.
Demonstrated ability to keep apprised of the ever-changing policies and procedures of the state of Colorado and the data reporting elements involved in this process.
Demonstrated ability to research and comply with changing federal agency regulations.
Demonstrated ability to stay up to date with regulatory and complementary agencies to adjust hospital abstracting when a specific precedent has been changed or set. The agencies include but are not limited to; coding schemes (CPT, ICD-0-3, ICD-9-CM), Surveillance Epidemiology & End Results (SEER), American Joint Commission on Cancer (AJCC).
Must have knowledge and ability to perform required aspects of the computer and its programs: follow-up letters, statistical reports, Colorado State Cancer Registry reporting and other required medical and cancer data.

Experience

At least five years of experience as a cancer data registrar in an ACOS accredited Cancer Program.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Assists in developing and maintaining cancer program standards by ACoS/COC and NAPBC.
Coordinates maintenance of appropriate files, reports and other cancer related data to ensure approval standards by the American College of Surgeons and the Colorado State Cancer Registry. Preparing graphs and statistics.
Prepares cancer reports and statistical data of the cancer program and breast center activities to administration, physician, outside agencies and/or Colorado State Cancer Registry.
Develops and implement changes in cancer registry policies and procedures to ensure CoC and NAPBC requirements
Monitors quality data (including periodic audits) to ensure data quality and compliance with state and CoC and NAPBC requirements.
Coordinates, plans, attends, documents, and promotes attendance at all Tumor Conferences.
Schedules a minimum of 4 Cancer Committee meetings a year on the medical staff calendar.
Drafts Cancer Committee agendas to represent each standard outlined by the ACOS. Allocate time on the agenda for each coordinator and specialty to give report, at the designated intervals required by the ACOS, if not more often.
Serves as a member of the Cancer Committee.
Coordinates Cancer Registry abstractors and oversight of all of their encompassing cancer registry activities.

About Boulder Community Health and Boulder, Colorado

Uncompromising medical excellence delivered with respect and compassion. Since 1922, Boulder Community Health has built a strong reputation on these values. As community-owned and operated not-for-profit hospital and clinic locations, we remain dedicated to the evolving needs of our citizens and providing access to high-quality care. Nestled in the foothills of the Rocky Mountains, the Boulder lifestyle is conductive to enjoying the outdoors and brings a fresh perspective to healthcare practice. Surround yourself by natural beauty and an active, life-embracing community. Enjoy state-of-the-art facilities and equipment along with competitive compensation and benefits, including health/dental/life, tuition reimbursement, on-site fitness center, Employee Wellness, Employee Activities & Discounts, and many more!

Job Description:

SQL Database QA/QC Manager – Laramie, WY

Trihydro, one of the top environmental and engineering consulting firms in the country, has an opening for a SQL database QA/QC manager. The role is a part of our Air and Process Services Team and assists with reviewing and analyzing leak detection and repair (LDAR) data and extending data with third-party sources. If you have database experience and enjoy working with collaborative teams, we encourage you to apply.
As a SQL database QA/QC manager, you will work with the LDAR QA/QC team to use different software applications, regularly use SQL Server Management Studio (SSMS), and read and understand environmental air quality regulations to assess data accuracy and quality. You will also serve as a liaison for routine and ad-hoc data reporting requests and provide first-line-of-support LDAR software help desk functions.
The preferred candidate will be based in our Laramie, WY office. However, remote options may be considered.
We are looking for someone who has:
Extensive experience with SSMS and ad-hoc query writing
Experience formulating efficient T-SQL queries, views, and stored procedures to prepare data reports
The ability to read, understand, and verify data in a variety of formats
A knack for business process improvement to keep pace with an evolving industry
Proficiency in Microsoft Office programs such as Excel, Word, and Outlook
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Attention to detail and accuracy
Time management and organization skills
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills to interact effectively with team members
Positive employment history with a demonstrated commitment to safe work practices
Dependable work practices with the ability to excel in a team environment
This job is for you if:
You desire career-growth opportunities and are interested in playing an integral role in a growing team and company.
You value working with others to achieve goals that make a difference to our clients and our communities.
You assume ownership of your work and take pride in producing high-quality deliverables.
At Trihydro, our approach to work is professional, honest, and dedicated. You’ll find a company culture that is committed to excellence, nurtures collaboration and growth, and still finds plenty of time for fun—often outdoors. Some of the benefits of joining our team include:
Comprehensive health insurance (medical, dental, vision, and prescription)
401(k) retirement plan, including a discretionary 6% match by Trihydro
Generous paid time off including vacation, flex, sick, holiday, and paid family leave
Wellness program, including reimbursement for a gym membership or related expenses
Staff mentoring and opportunities for professional growth

Job_description:
The Administrative Office of

The Supreme Court of Appeals of West Virginia

Position Announcement

DIVISION OF COURT SERVICES

Charleston, West Virginia

Position open until filled.

The Supreme Court of Appeals of West Virginia has an immediate professional opportunity for Process Business Analystin Charleston, West Virginia. This position directly reports to the Director of Court Services of the Supreme Court of Appeals of West Virginia.

Process Business Analyst

Salary Range: $60,000-70,000

Position Summary: This position works with Court personnel, formatting and integrating multiple sources of Court data from different systems to identify trends, data patterns and key areas that require improvements. This position conducts clear and accurate analysis and produces reports for project teams in a concise manner. This position also works with cross-functional teams to develop and deploy clear processes and procedures. This position directly assists Circuit and Family Courts with process improvements, training and reconciliation of financial issues.

Essential Position Duties and Responsibilities:

Develops and maintains process documentation.
Educates employees on how to properly execute those processes.
Understands business analysis of services, business process planning and improvement.
Develops business process review, solution design, functional software configuration, and testing.
User Acceptance Testing for all development
Evaluates business processes to identify opportunities for process improvement.
Gathers business and functional requirements from key stakeholders when needed for application development
Identifies the business needs and provides solutions or steps to the solutions.
Understands the business need and value proposition and can translate and articulate the requirements as a subject matter expert.
Creates and supports design; and documents and maintains processes.
Resolves attorney E-File questions
Resolves advanced service desk tickets
Performs other duties as assigned.

•

Requisite Qualifications, Education, and Credentials:

Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, or related field. Additional years of qualified experience may replace bachelor’s degree.
Minimum two (2) or more years’ experience in working with trial courts as the Clerk or Deputy Clerk, Minimum 2 years experience in Circuit Court Accounting

Preferred Skills and Knowledge:

Basic knowledge in generating process documentation.
Analytical thinking and problem solving.
Detail oriented and committed to a high level of accuracy.
Excellent organizational, interpersonal and consultative skills.
Strong written and verbal communications skills.
Writing unambiguous, verifiable requirements to a testable level (functional and non-functional requirements).
Experience working in cross-functional teams.
Familiarity with Issue tracking and team collaboration tools.
Statistical and/or spreadsheet applications.
Ability to learn, understand and apply new technologies independently and with training.

Licensure Requirements: NA

Working Conditions (Physical/Mental Demands, and Environmental Factors):

Ability to work nontraditional hours as needed.

Continuing Education Requirements:

Maintain current knowledge on judicial developments and trends in judiciary and court administration through participation in a variety of outside programs, state and nationwide.

Performance Metrics:TBD

Criminal Background Check: Successful candidates must submit to criminal background check.

Compensation and Benefits include:

Competitive salary based on experience and qualifications.
Medical Insurance.
Optional Flexible Benefits Coverage (dental, vision, disability, and excess medical).
Life insurance.
Defined benefit pension plan.
Section 457 deferred compensation plan.
12 paid holidays.
Sick leave.

West Virginia Courts

West Virginia has a Unified Court System,under which all state courts, including the Intermediate Court of Appeals, Circuit Courts, Magistrate Courts, and Family Courts, are supervised and administered by the Supreme Court of Appeals. The Supreme Court of Appeals and its Administrative Office are located in Charleston and housed in the State Capitol Complex. More information about West Virginia’s Courts can be found on our website at www.courtswv.gov.

Equal Opportunity in Employment

It is the policy of the West Virginia judiciary to provide equal opportunity in employment for all persons, and to recruit, select, train, promote, retain, and discipline without regard to race, color, sex, age, disability, religion, sexual orientation, or national origin. Further, it is the policy of the West Virginia judiciary to maintain a professional workplace in which individuals are accorded respect, and an environment free of harassment, including verbal or physical conduct that creates an intimidating or hostile environment for any individual on any prohibited basis. As an employer with an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Plan, the Court complies with government regulations and related Equal Employment Responsibilities where applicable.

Application Process

To apply for this position, please send the following completed Court Employment Application (available on Court website at www.courtswv.gov), along with a letter of interest highlighting applicable experience, and a resume, including references.

All positions of the Supreme Court of Appeals of West Virginia are considered at-will and may

be terminated at any time, with or without notice or cause.

Thank you for your interest in employment with the Supreme Court of Appeals of West Virginia.

Overview:

Do you have a passion for technology and are naturally curious? If you have strong interpersonal skills and are driven to learn and grow, then come join and add value at OneNeck IT Solutions as a Data Center Technician – Operations in Waukee, IA.


**Please note this position is considered an essential worker for our business and therefore will be required to work in the data center facility for all working hours.**


This is a full-time opportunity, working Wednesday from 11:00am to 7:00pm CT, Thursday-Friday from 9:00am-7:00pm CT and Saturday from 7:00am to 7:00pm CT.
Responsibilities:

The Data Center Technician - Operations will operate, monitor, measure, and attain OneNeck IT Solutions’ Data Centers Service Level Commitments, and maintain facility appearance and integrity, especially during assigned shift. This role is responsible for providing assistance to customers and projects, as such situations arise. The data center is a critical aspect of the OneNeck business by ensuring availability, business continuity (no disruption), and security for internal and external customers. The data center must maintain high standards for assuring the integrity and functionality of its’ hosted computer environment and support services.

Monitor and Operate Data Centers critical functions and facilities to meet or exceed Service Levels. Monitor, correct, and report observed infractions of security policies and procedures. Detect and dispatch help for trouble situations within non-local facilities, and attempt remote troubleshooting if possible/practical
Measure and record vital statistics and produce appropriate reports, including shift and weekly reports. Record and maintain accurate incident and change records and logs.
Respond physically to trouble situations within the local facility and conduct troubleshooting (including of telecom circuits) as may be required.
Conduct routine walkthroughs of local facility, correcting both appearance and functional imperfections. Chaperone vendors and guests, as may become necessary.
Assist, as available, project activity including any of the following
Installation, termination, testing and labeling of all cross connects (cat5, coax, fiber) in the Data Center.
Moving and installation of cabinets and relay racks.
Hardware installation including: shelves, power strips, rails, cable management, and customer equipment.
Exhibit exemplary workmanship in such performance
Have a working knowledge of the responsibilities of the Data Center Technician – Security, and be able to assist with those responsibilities, as necessary.
Qualifications:

Required Qualifications

Associates Degree -OR- 2+ years professional work experience.
3+ years technical support experience in a data center and/or HVAC environment and/or electrical field -OR- 1+ years of technical support in a OneNeck Data Center Facility (internal only)
Must have and maintain a valid driver’s license and reliable transportation.
Must live within 30 minutes of the data center.
Ability to work Wednesday from 11:00am to 7:00pm CT, Thursday-Friday from 9:00am-7:00pm CT and Saturday from 7:00am to 7:00pm CT.
Must be able to lift and carry equipment up to 75 pounds; climb equipment and walk on rooftops and cat-walks.

Other Qualifications

ITIL Certification or the willingness to pursue certification within 12 months of hire or work with management to pursue a reasonable alternative within 18 months.
Availability to occasionally work extra hours (including weekends) per an on-call basis.
Excellent communications with others, especially regarding technical matters.
Working knowledge of HVAC, Power, Fire, Security building systems operations and safety.
Working knowledge of telecommunications technologies, systems, and circuits.
Data center skills and experience in installing/moving equipment and cabling on a large-scale basis.
Experience working with various networking hardware such as multiplexers, routers, and switches.
Knowledge of common network protocols such as TCP/IP.
Experience with fault isolation and troubleshooting networks including LAN and WAN.
Familiarity with configuring networking equipment such as routers, switches, and hubs.
Experience with data communication issues, including security, resource management, capacity planning, monitoring, and performance.
Ability to work independently and manage multiple priorities and interruptions.

#OneNeck IT Solutions offers multi-cloud solutions, combined with managed services, professional IT services, hardware and local connectivity via top-tier data centers across the country. OneNeck's team of technology professionals deliver secure, modern platforms and applications for organizations embracing data-driven transformation and secure end-to-end solutions.


Employment at OneNeck is subject to post-offer, pre-employment drug testing.
EEO/AA Employer/Vets/Disability.

Job_title: Data Center Automation Systems - Junior CAD Operator
Job_description:
Posted
07-Mar-2023
Service line
GWS Segment
Role type
Full-time
Areas of Interest
Construction, Data Centers
Location(s)
Charleston - South Carolina - United States of America, Moncks Corner - South Carolina - United States of America, North Charleston - South Carolina - United States of America, Summerville - South Carolina - United States of America
Job Summary
The Datacenter Automation Systems (DAS) team is committed to the successful implementation of autonomous and semi-autonomous vehicles throughout multiple datacenters. CBRE is seeking a full-time, permanent, CAD Operator with experience in MEP design, manufacturing or data center robotics-centric automation solutions. The DAS CAD Operator will report to the Client-approved location:
Moncks Corner, SC - full time / on site
The DAS CAD Operator requirements may vary according to Client-determined assignments, but most content relates to creating detailed designs for industrial automation equipment and systems in the DAS robotics portfolio at the Client's data centers. This position is part of a multi-disciplinary team creating engineering documentation and design drawing packages. The individual will collaborate with project engineers, technical writers, project managers, and other CAD/BIM Operators. Ideal candidates would be familiar with establishing and managing a design environment. Ideal candidates must be comfortable communicating regularly via video conference, email and internal ticketing systems.

Job Duties:
Acquire clear understanding of product requirements by reviewing, understanding, interpreting and revising technical specifications, blueprints and engineering illustrations, mockups, and prototypes.
Ability to read and interpret design standards and specifications, blueprints, drawings, redlines, etc
Coordinate the CAD design for Navigation Tape and GeoMarker installation package
Installation Drawings
Navigation DesignLayout
GeoMarker datum development
Material Takeoff
Working understanding of construction design package development for field installation.
Ability to translate existing field conditions from documentation and redlines to revise/edit design drawing packages.
Ability to learn software such as Lucidchart to generate shape files for navigation translated from design drawings. .
Capable of managing shifting design production to coordinate with field installation schedules.
Coordinate file management with 3rd party teams for document file transfer.
Maintain audits of latest design revisions against floor plan modifications.
Ability to perform repetitive field measurement tasks for long durations such as bending, kneeling, squatting ,walking, climbing stairs, etc.
Must have excellent organizational skills
Ability to communicate effectively, both orally and in writing

Other duties as assigned.

SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES

No formal supervisory responsibilities in this position.

QUALIFICATIONS

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.

Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

EDUCATION and EXPERIENCE

Bachelor's degree in Architecture, Engineering, Construction Management, or related field. Minimum two or more years' construction administration, architecture, engineering or similar experience.

Preferred experience with some data center infrastructure projects. Experience in mission critical data centers is a strong plus. Preferred experience with robotic process automation.

CERTIFICATES and/or LICENSES

Working towards or eligible for licensure as either a Professional Engineer or Registered Architect is desired.

COMMUNICATION SKILLS

Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Strong organizational and analytical skills. Ability to provide efficient, timely, reliable and courteous service to customers. Ability to effectively present information.

FINANCIAL KNOWLEDGE

Requires knowledge of financial terms and principles. Ability to calculate intermediate figures such as percentages, discounts, and/or commissions. Conducts basic financial analysis.

REASONING ABILITY

Ability to understand and carry out general instructions in standard situations. Ability to solve problems in standard situations. Requires intermediate analytical and quantitative skills.

OTHER SKILLS and ABILITIES

Intermediate skills with Microsoft Office Suite. Ability to read and understand architectural drawings. Working knowledge in MS Project is helpful. Knowledge of leases, contracts, and construction practices preferred. 3+ years of minimum proficiency in the use of AutoCAD and Revit. Knowledge of Best Management Practices CAD/BIM environment. Autodesk Software - CAD BIM Solidworks BIM360 etc.

Basic knowledge of the entitlement/permitting process and construction delivery methods and agreements. Some familiarity with construction best practices, general building codes, and various building types and systems. Passion for being detail oriented and highly organized.

SCOPE OF RESPONSIBILITY

Decisions made with general understanding of procedures and company policies to achieve set results and deadlines. Errors in judgment may cause short-term impact to co-workers and supervisor.

#INDSJ
CBRE is an equal opportunity employer that values diversity. We have a long-standing commitment to providing equal employment opportunity to all qualified applicants regardless of race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, pregnancy, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, veteran status, political belief, or any other basis protected by applicable law. We also provide reasonable accommodations, as needed, throughout the job application process. If you have a disability that inhibits your ability to apply for a position through our online application process, you may contact us via email at recruitingaccommodations@cbre.com or via telephone at +1 866 225 3099 (U.S.) and +1 866 388 4346 (Canada).

NOTE: Some, but not all, of our positions may have an additional requirement to comply with COVID-19 health and safety protocols, including COVID-19 vaccination proof and/or rigorous testing. If you have questions about the requirement(s) for this position, please inform your Recruiter.

Description
VP of Sales

The Vice President of Sales is responsible for acquiring new accounts and achieving overall revenue growth.
The position requires excellent communication skills including in-person, phone and writing skills.
The goal of this position is to offer clients and prospects a new perspective on how they can best utilize our SaaS solutions. This will be accomplished by having an in-depth understanding of an account’s business, what brings them value and leveraging that information to deliver an irresistible message.

Candidates will teach prospects about how our solutions will benefit them and will tailor their communication to suit different prospects. The candidate will demonstrate expert knowledge regarding our suite of products and services and their useful application across various Public Finance Capital
Markets participants, including the Sell-side and Buy-side.

The VP-Sales will manage the sales cycle from cold-calling through contract negotiation and closing, with a bit of ongoing client account management when needed.

This position works closely with, and will report to the President of the company.

Networks and partners with customers - both over phone and in person - to build confidence and develop win/win solutions; proactively stays on top of additional sales opportunities while navigating through customer organizations, balances frequency of contact with potential for new sales.
Effectively manages the territory by allocating appropriate time to prioritize goals of managing renewals as well as developing both cross-sell and new business sales opportunities when needed.
Uses appropriate interpersonal skills to consistently build trust and confidence with users, key contacts, and internal resources; communicates and interacts effectively with internal

Operations and Product teams to achieve company revenue goals.

Exhibits solid knowledge of the Capital Markets, both Sell-side and Buy-Side, and has experience selling data, technology and software services into this marketplace, knowledge of Municipal

Bond Markets is a big plus.

Knowledge of Product Management Lifecycle and the effort required to bring new so lutions to market.

Demonstrate the value of products and solutions to both new prospects and existing clients
Obtains territory information regarding market intelligence and penetration
Manage and coordinate all customer-related issues
Uses Salesforce to manage sales cycle pipeline and participate in weekly sales performance reports discussions

Job_description:
Supply Chain Administrative Assistant - Waterbury, Connecticut

Company: Portmeirion Group USA

Position Title: Supply Chain Administrative Assistant

Location: Waterbury, CT

Schedule: Full Time

About the Company: A major force in the home fashion industry, Portmeirion Group USA encompasses the world-renowned brands of Portmeirion, Spode, Royal Worcester, Pimpernel, Wax Lyrical and Nambe ́. We are a market leader with a worldwide reputation for high quality and innovatively designed tableware, giftware, home fragrance and personal care. For further information about the Portmeirion Group, please visit our website: www.portmeiriongroup.com

Job Description: Portmeirion Group is seeking an entry-level energetic, highly driven professional to support our supply chain team in this cross-functional administrative role. Our department focuses on teamwork, efficiency, and rising to the challenge of meeting increasing demands in the everchanging world of the global supply chain. The ideal candidate can work independently to prioritize a high volume of tasks with competing deadlines in a fast-pasted environment while maintaining a positive attitude.

The successful candidate needs to be meticulously detail-oriented and exceptionally organized with excellent time management skills and an analytical mind. We need a quick learner with willingness to assist in all areas, from clerical duties to warehouse support. Excel and data entry skills are non-negotiable requirements and essential to day-to-day responsibilities. This position reports to the Senior Manager of Supply Chain.

Responsibilities:

Creates and tracks purchase orders through each stage of the process, from vendor acknowledgment to receipt of product.

Communicates directly with suppliers to track and maintain reporting on vendor shipments.

Checks order acknowledgments, shipping labels, and barcodes for accuracy.

Gathers data to create excel reports and graphs as needed to provide updates and status details to management.

Organize and maintain item, account, and vendor data within ERP system and shared documents.

Performs a wide range of administrative duties including, but not limited to creating and formatting spreadsheets, maintaining detailed records, and filing systems, scanning documents, and organizing general day-to-day operations.

Provides support as needed to the Supply chain team and management with daily administrative activities, month-end reporting, and special projects.

Collaborates with customer service, shipping/receiving, and other departments as needed.

Other duties as assigned.

Skills:

- Detail-oriented with a focus on accuracy

- Sense of urgency with the ability to effectively prioritize

- Strong organization, multitasking, and planning skills

- Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Experience

-Administrative or data entry experience required

- Intermediate skills in Microsoft Excel required (Data Analysis, Pivot tables, Vlookup)

Education

- Bachelor's degree preferred

Office and Data Manager Job Description

Job Summary: Response is a non-profit in Aspen that works with survivors of domestic and sexual abuse. The office and data manager is responsible for managing the Response office and data collection and reporting as well as supporting the fundraising and outreach functions of the organization. (part time considered for the right applicant).

Responsibilities:

1. General Office:

Performs the full range of administrative duties for the office, including office management, maintaining office supplies and equipment. Answers incoming calls; assists visitors; handles mail.
Maintains agency files, ensures payment requests are submitted to the executive director, processes reports and renewals.
Works with vendors and other agencies to ensure the highest level of service.
Paying bills and processing payments.
Support other staff as needed.

2. Crisis Helpline:

Communicating with volunteer advocates with updates and scheduling to ensure that crisis helpline is adequately staffed.
Maintains volunteer and back up staff records and individual hours.
After completing the 30-hour volunteer advocate training, may be asked to work up to one week per month on the crisis line for evenings and a full weekend (additional compensation).

3. Fundraising and Outreach

Maintains Response website and social media outlets with accurate and timely postings.
Maintains donor database for fundraising and outreach efforts.
Provide logistical support for all Response events including volunteer management, soliciting donations, working with sponsors, marketing and more.
Works with executive director to create email and print newsletters on a regular basis.

4. Grant and Data Management

Coordination of Response’s annual grant calendar.
Assist executive director with grant reporting and tracking.
Coordination of program evaluation systems.
May include grant writing and proofing under the supervision of the executive director.
Maintains organizational databases and is responsible for overall records management.

The ability to maintain confidentiality and a calm manner when dealing with people in crisis.
A strong team player who is flexible with time and duties as they evolve.

Job_title: KIPP NYC Senior Associate, Student Enrollment - Data & Reporting
Job_description:
Company Description


KIPP NYC Public Schools is a non-profit network of free, public charter schools that prepares students for success in college and life. In 1995 we started our first middle school, KIPP Academy, in The Bronx. Our goal was to graduate students with the strength of character and academic abilities needed to succeed in high school, college and beyond – and in so doing, to prove what is possible for all students. Today, our New York City network is comprised of eight elementary schools, nine middle schools, one high school, and KIPP Forward, a comprehensive support program for our alumni. KIPP NYC Public Schools currently serves more than 9,350 students and alumni and has a staff of more than 850. KIPP NYC is continuing to grow and opened two new middle schools and an elementary school August 2021!

Position Overview

The KIPP NYC Senior Associate, Student Enrollment - Data & Reporting is an essential role in making KIPP NYC’s student enrollment data accessible for all organizational levels in our region. They will support and maintain the development of tools, dashboards and protocols to align school and regional teams toward key enrollment goals and benchmarks, including attendance, retention, and application. Additionally, the Senior Associate, Student Enrollment - Data & Reporting will support regional and school teams with real time data requests and serve as lead for internal CRM systems such as SchoolMint and Hubspot.

This position is based out of the NYC office and may require local travel to our NYC schools. The Senior Associate will report to the Director, Student Enrollment on the KIPP NYC Regional Operations team



Job Description


General Duties and Responsibilities

Regional Systems and Support

Develop and manage dashboards and tracking systems created for school and network-based teams
Create a year-long regional calendar of the key events for student enrollment data collection and analysis
Support the internal use and iteration on CRMs or data visualization through SchoolMint, Hubspot, Google Suite, and/or Tableau
Continuously improve processes to promote efficiency and accuracy of data collection and reporting structures for student enrollment, including the accuracy of ongoing student enrollment records across ATS and Powerschool
Support any student enrollment data compliance requests received from other teams within our regional team

School Support

Provide actionable guidance and partnership to the Community Outreach team in monitoring trends and forecasting against targets
Support the creation and systematization of key regional school-facing processes to produce reliable, quantitative results to be shared across the enterprise.
Analyze historical trends to create benchmarks for key projects
As needed, provide in-person (school based) recruitment and enrollment support during critical times in the year (i.e. admissions lottery, first two weeks of the school year, etc.)


Qualifications

Associate’s degree required, Bachelor’s degree preferred.
2+ years of work experience, experience in Data preferred
Demonstrated intermediate/ advanced skills in Microsoft Office & Google Suite, especially data analysis and presentations using Microsoft Excel and/or Google Sheets
Knowledge of database systems and data management, DOE systems and SchoolMint highly preferred
Strong organization skills with high attention to detail and accuracy
Strong written and presentation skills, as well as demonstrated ability to communicate using data in a clear, concise, and accessible manner to inform decisions and planning
Meticulous attention to detail with an ability to produce high-quality work in a dynamic, fast-paced Environment
Strong interpersonal skills, with the ability to develop productive working relationships with multiple stakeholders across the organization
Demonstrated passion for and a commitment to the KIPP mission for high-quality public education and the character traits we value

Additional Information


Compensation and Benefits:

KIPP NYC offers a competitive salary ranging from $71,070 to $81,370. Salary ranges at KIPP NYC are standardized based on role level and role function. Individual salaries are determined through a lens of equity, accounting for years of experience relevant to the role and scope of responsibilities, and are benchmarked against others within the same salary band.

KIPP NYC offers a generous benefits package including, but not limited to, the following:

Robust benefits that include medical, dental, and vision.
403(b) retirement plan with 50% match after 6 months.
Generous Time-Off aligned with school calendar
Up to 12 weeks 100% parental leave.
Bright Horizon Back-up Child and Elder care.
Employer paid Life Insurance and Short term/Long term disability.
Employee incentives including 8 Weeks paid Sabbatical after 10 years, annual professional development funds, and tuition reimbursement.

This description is intended to describe the type of work being performed by a person assigned to this position. It is not an exhaustive list of all duties and responsibilities required by the employee.

KIPP NYC LLC is an anti-racist organization that believes in the importance of being diverse, equitable, and inclusive. We are committed to creating a welcoming environment that includes employees with diverse backgrounds and experiences. We believe that enables us to better meet our mission and values while serving students and families throughout New York City. BIPOC, women, gender expansive, LGBTQIA+, veterans, and persons with disabilities are encouraged to apply.

KIPP NYC LLC is an Equal Opportunity Employer. KIPP NYC LLC is committed to the principles of equal employment opportunity for all employees and applicants for employment.

Promote efficiency throughout the organization utilizing creative and innovative thinking to develop, analyze and verify statistical measures.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities

Responsible for the integrity and quality of data within the Information Technology (IT) infrastructure to support operations, management and decision-making. Enable strategic use of enterprise-wide information for cross-functional organizations and teams.
Provide data related services throughout the organization. Consult with leadership and workforce on process measures, evaluation techniques, as well as, current and potential IT related solutions.

Facilitates team-based problem solving and multidisciplinary team use of various data-driven process improvement techniques such as Process Mapping and Root Cause Analysis. Applies business logic and ask questions that are not necessarily apparent.
Supports organizational survey processes with analysis, tracking and developing of survey data for both internal and external partners.
Develop and maintain specialized datasets and systems for recording and tracking appropriate data and statistical information.
Creates and distributes standardized and special reports, summaries, and analyses.
Organizes appropriate resources, organizational priorities and manages systems as related to data activities.
Maintains monthly scorecards and dashboards for the organization to ensure compliance with performance measures.

Maintains a continuous and independent education on cutting-edge statistical techniques and tools.

An equivalent combination of education and experience.

Ability to exercise initiative and sound judgment.
Understanding of basic statistics (required).
Demonstrated organizational skills required and ability to see tasks through to completion (required).
Strong interpersonal skills and ability to work both independently and as part of a team (required).
Working knowledge of medical terminology and medical records/procedures (preferred).
Demonstrated knowledge of and ability using a Personal Computer (PC), related Microsoft Office software and other report writing and BI software.

Your day-to-day duties will range from diving in and processing actual prospect records before they are loaded to setting strategic goals for your team to ensure our prospect database continues to grow.

Job_title: Program & Data Manager - DBH Prevention & Education
Job_description:
Davis Behavioral Health (DBH) is seeking a full-time Program & Data Manager to oversee program planning, implementation, evaluation, and reporting for Prevention & Education efforts in Davis County. The ideal candidate possesses excellent communication skills, is meticulous, creative, and is a strong team player.

Essential Functions

The essential functions assigned to the Program & Data Manager include, but are not limited to the following:

Gather, track, evaluate, and report on Prevention & Education efforts on the program, coalition, and county levels.
Create visual materials such as print and digital marketing, reporting charts, and infographics to market programs and highlight effectiveness.
Write and report on grants to support the Prevention & Education efforts in Davis County
Work with the Prevention Coordinator to illustrate the significance of prevention to key stakeholders, and strategize how to continue to grow support, funding, and community reach.
Oversee and manage all aspects of scheduling, set up, facilitation, and follow-up for DBH sponsored Prevention & Education programs, as well as community events, on occasion.
Supervise program instructors and childcare staff, and provide them support, training, and professional development.
Coordinate with the Prevention Team regarding Prevention & Education programming needs across the county, as well as in individual schools and coalition areas.
Work with Diversity Coordinator regarding potential program barriers and solutions for diverse populations within Davis County

Preference may be given for candidates who use his/her own recovery experience and training to assist consumers.

Schedule

This position works in an office setting 40 hours per week. May be required to work occasional evening hours and weekends, as needed. Limited remote work may be allowed. There will be periodic travel required.

The successful candidate will primarily work a Monday through Friday day schedule but will be required to be flexible to attend required meetings, trainings, and other events associated with the role of Program and Data Manager as well as to oversee and supervise the prevention and education efforts, which mostly take place in the evening hours.

Compensation

The starting annual wage for the successful candidates is outlined below:

$55,000.00 per annum for candidates with a Master's degree (exempt FLSA status)
$21.00 per hour for candidates with a Bachelor's degree (non-exempt FLSA status)
Spanish-language incentive stipend (paid bi-weekly) available. Must pass a verbal Spanish-language proficiency assessment to qualify.

Davis Behavioral Health, Inc.

Davis Behavioral Health's mission is to provide access to quality behavioral healthcare by:

Adhering to principles of choice, safety, transparency, and collaboration with our clients, staff, and partners;
Utilizing evidence-informed practices to best serve our clients; and
Being fiscally wise and responsible.

Davis Behavioral Health understands that excellent clinicians are vital to meeting the standards established by its mission and vision statements.

It is highly preferred that individuals who are interested in obtaining employment at DBH, their spouse, or one of their dependents not be actively receiving services at DBH except for medication management services to eliminate/avoid possible conflicts or uncomfortable boundaries.

DBH understands that excellent employees are vital to meeting the standards established by its mission and vision statements. DBH is committed to excellence in community-based behavioral health treatment, progressive, vital and continually responsive to the needs of the community, and advocates for the behavioral health needs of our clients.

Davis Behavioral Health is an equal opportunity employer.

Required Experience

Minimum Qualifications

Bachelor’s Degree in Public Health, Social Work, Communication, Business, or other related fields, required. Master’s Degree preferred.
Experience with program development and implementation.
Ability to collaborate well with people of all ages and backgrounds.
Must be willing to complete a criminal background check and pre-employment drug screen.
Valid Utah Driver’s License in good standing.
Must have own transportation.

Required Skills and Abilities

Strong, effective, clear, and concise communication skills, both oral and written
Organized and meticulous.
Dependable, with proven ability to work independently and follow-through with responsibilities.
Able to take initiative and solve problems effectively.
Gather, track, evaluate, and report program data.
Analyze and synthesize data into written and visual formats.
Computer skills, including familiarity with the Microsoft Office products, design software such as the Adobe Suite, and ability to learn new systems.
Perform effectively in stressful situations.

Preferred Skills and Abilities:

Knowledge of Prevention & Education programming and framework
Grant writing and management
Create physical and digital marketing materials.
Supervisory experience
Bilingual English/Spanish
Public speaking skills

The selected candidate must successfully pass a pre-employment criminal background check and drug screening. DBH will not hire individuals currently using illegal drugs or abusing alcohol; therefore, making employment at DBH conditional upon successfully passing pre-employment drug screening by providing a valid sample. Candidates who are offered employment are required to report for a drug screen at an Intermountain WorkMed location within 24 hours of being requested to do so by the DBH Human Resources Department.

Davis Behavioral Health works with Federal grants and must comply with the Federal drug laws, including no use of medical marijuana.

Full Time, Flexible weekday schedule. 36 hours/week.

Pay Range is between $23.21-$34.80/hr, depending on years of relevant and like experience.

Boulder Community Health is a Certified Level II Trauma Center. In 2022, we celebrated the 100thanniversary of the founding of our organization. We are honored to hold the awards of 2021 U.S. News & World ‘Best Hospitals for Maternity Care’, 2019 Best Medical Facility from Boulder Weekly, and Best Local Employer from Daily Camera. Come be part of an independent, community-focused health system; feel good knowing that your work will make a difference in people’s lives and positively contribute to the community.

POSITION SUMMARY

Coordinates the cancer data management system to promote quality care for the cancer patients at Boulder Community Health. Maintains compliance with the requirements for an approved cancer program and national accreditation program for breast centers set forth by the American College of Surgeons Commission on Cancer. Maintains compliance with the requirements for mandatory statewide reporting set forth by the Colorado Cancer Registry and Department of Public health.

JOB QUALIFICATIONS

Education or Formal Training

Accredited Record Technician (RHIT) or Registered Record Administrator (RHIA) preferred. Certified Tumor Registrar (CTR) required. ICD-9 Coding, cancer staging and word-processing. Expertise required with Excel spreadsheets and CNExT (or similar automated cancer registry system) ACOS web-based data upload process including but not limited to the National Call for Data (NCDB) and the Facility Identifiable data (FIPS level 1 & 2). State of Colorado Public Health and Environment compliance with state and federal laws mandating data collection and compliance in the research of those diagnosed with and treated for cancer. The Cancer Registry is responsible for guarding the hospitals compliance and fostering a cohesive relationship with the State liaisons and personnel and providing documentation to them upon request, to evidence the hospitals compliance with the state and federal statutes.

Special Qualifications (Licensure, Registration, etc.)

Bachelor or Associate Degree in health information technology are related field preferred. Certified Tumor Registrar (CTR) required.

Knowledge, Skill and Ability

Knowledge of all American College of Surgeons and State of Colorado requirements for Cancer Registry accreditation process. Working knowledge of all levels of accreditation and evidence of experience with standards.
Evidence of ability to produce an annual report and comply with procedures for reporting to the state as required by American College of Surgeons.
Demonstrated ability for successful completion of ACOS accreditation survey.
Demonstrated excellent communication skills:
Writing ability including accurate grammar and spelling as evidenced by concise and clear report writing, compilation and organization of annual reports, preparation of tumor conference agendas, and synopses of data.
Verbal skills as evidenced by ability to communicate with all members of the health care team, the state tumor registry and patients when appropriate.
Demonstrated ability to execute a successful breast & cancer conference.
Demonstrated ability to accurately analyze and abstract patient records with an average time of 60 minutes or less per abstract.
Detail-oriented with ability to make independent decisions and use critical thinking skills.
Demonstrated ability to execute accomplishment of ACOS required registry data studies
Demonstrated ability to execute scientific studies leading to sound data to be presented to the Cancer Committee as a source of outcomes analysis.
Demonstrated ability to keep apprised of the ever-changing policies and procedures of the state of Colorado and the data reporting elements involved in this process.
Demonstrated ability to research and comply with changing federal agency regulations.
Demonstrated ability to stay up to date with regulatory and complementary agencies to adjust hospital abstracting when a specific precedent has been changed or set. The agencies include but are not limited to; coding schemes (CPT, ICD-0-3, ICD-9-CM), Surveillance Epidemiology & End Results (SEER), American Joint Commission on Cancer (AJCC).
Must have knowledge and ability to perform required aspects of the computer and its programs: follow-up letters, statistical reports, Colorado State Cancer Registry reporting and other required medical and cancer data.

Experience

At least five years of experience as a cancer data registrar in an ACOS accredited Cancer Program.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Assists in developing and maintaining cancer program standards by ACoS/COC and NAPBC.
Coordinates maintenance of appropriate files, reports and other cancer related data to ensure approval standards by the American College of Surgeons and the Colorado State Cancer Registry. Preparing graphs and statistics.
Prepares cancer reports and statistical data of the cancer program and breast center activities to administration, physician, outside agencies and/or Colorado State Cancer Registry.
Develops and implement changes in cancer registry policies and procedures to ensure CoC and NAPBC requirements
Monitors quality data (including periodic audits) to ensure data quality and compliance with state and CoC and NAPBC requirements.
Coordinates, plans, attends, documents, and promotes attendance at all Tumor Conferences.
Schedules a minimum of 4 Cancer Committee meetings a year on the medical staff calendar.
Drafts Cancer Committee agendas to represent each standard outlined by the ACOS. Allocate time on the agenda for each coordinator and specialty to give report, at the designated intervals required by the ACOS, if not more often.
Serves as a member of the Cancer Committee.
Coordinates Cancer Registry abstractors and oversight of all of their encompassing cancer registry activities.

About Boulder Community Health and Boulder, Colorado

Uncompromising medical excellence delivered with respect and compassion. Since 1922, Boulder Community Health has built a strong reputation on these values. As community-owned and operated not-for-profit hospital and clinic locations, we remain dedicated to the evolving needs of our citizens and providing access to high-quality care. Nestled in the foothills of the Rocky Mountains, the Boulder lifestyle is conductive to enjoying the outdoors and brings a fresh perspective to healthcare practice. Surround yourself by natural beauty and an active, life-embracing community. Enjoy state-of-the-art facilities and equipment along with competitive compensation and benefits, including health/dental/life, tuition reimbursement, on-site fitness center, Employee Wellness, Employee Activities & Discounts, and many more!

Job_description:
The Administrative Office of

The Supreme Court of Appeals of West Virginia

Position Announcement

DIVISION OF COURT SERVICES

Charleston, West Virginia

Position open until filled.

The Supreme Court of Appeals of West Virginia has an immediate professional opportunity for Process Business Analystin Charleston, West Virginia. This position directly reports to the Director of Court Services of the Supreme Court of Appeals of West Virginia.

Process Business Analyst

Salary Range: $60,000-70,000

Position Summary: This position works with Court personnel, formatting and integrating multiple sources of Court data from different systems to identify trends, data patterns and key areas that require improvements. This position conducts clear and accurate analysis and produces reports for project teams in a concise manner. This position also works with cross-functional teams to develop and deploy clear processes and procedures. This position directly assists Circuit and Family Courts with process improvements, training and reconciliation of financial issues.

Essential Position Duties and Responsibilities:

Develops and maintains process documentation.
Educates employees on how to properly execute those processes.
Understands business analysis of services, business process planning and improvement.
Develops business process review, solution design, functional software configuration, and testing.
User Acceptance Testing for all development
Evaluates business processes to identify opportunities for process improvement.
Gathers business and functional requirements from key stakeholders when needed for application development
Identifies the business needs and provides solutions or steps to the solutions.
Understands the business need and value proposition and can translate and articulate the requirements as a subject matter expert.
Creates and supports design; and documents and maintains processes.
Resolves attorney E-File questions
Resolves advanced service desk tickets
Performs other duties as assigned.

•

Requisite Qualifications, Education, and Credentials:

Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, or related field. Additional years of qualified experience may replace bachelor’s degree.
Minimum two (2) or more years’ experience in working with trial courts as the Clerk or Deputy Clerk, Minimum 2 years experience in Circuit Court Accounting

Preferred Skills and Knowledge:

Basic knowledge in generating process documentation.
Analytical thinking and problem solving.
Detail oriented and committed to a high level of accuracy.
Excellent organizational, interpersonal and consultative skills.
Strong written and verbal communications skills.
Writing unambiguous, verifiable requirements to a testable level (functional and non-functional requirements).
Experience working in cross-functional teams.
Familiarity with Issue tracking and team collaboration tools.
Statistical and/or spreadsheet applications.
Ability to learn, understand and apply new technologies independently and with training.

Licensure Requirements: NA

Working Conditions (Physical/Mental Demands, and Environmental Factors):

Ability to work nontraditional hours as needed.

Continuing Education Requirements:

Maintain current knowledge on judicial developments and trends in judiciary and court administration through participation in a variety of outside programs, state and nationwide.

Performance Metrics:TBD

Criminal Background Check: Successful candidates must submit to criminal background check.

Compensation and Benefits include:

Competitive salary based on experience and qualifications.
Medical Insurance.
Optional Flexible Benefits Coverage (dental, vision, disability, and excess medical).
Life insurance.
Defined benefit pension plan.
Section 457 deferred compensation plan.
12 paid holidays.
Sick leave.

West Virginia Courts

West Virginia has a Unified Court System,under which all state courts, including the Intermediate Court of Appeals, Circuit Courts, Magistrate Courts, and Family Courts, are supervised and administered by the Supreme Court of Appeals. The Supreme Court of Appeals and its Administrative Office are located in Charleston and housed in the State Capitol Complex. More information about West Virginia’s Courts can be found on our website at www.courtswv.gov.

Equal Opportunity in Employment

It is the policy of the West Virginia judiciary to provide equal opportunity in employment for all persons, and to recruit, select, train, promote, retain, and discipline without regard to race, color, sex, age, disability, religion, sexual orientation, or national origin. Further, it is the policy of the West Virginia judiciary to maintain a professional workplace in which individuals are accorded respect, and an environment free of harassment, including verbal or physical conduct that creates an intimidating or hostile environment for any individual on any prohibited basis. As an employer with an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Plan, the Court complies with government regulations and related Equal Employment Responsibilities where applicable.

Application Process

To apply for this position, please send the following completed Court Employment Application (available on Court website at www.courtswv.gov), along with a letter of interest highlighting applicable experience, and a resume, including references.

All positions of the Supreme Court of Appeals of West Virginia are considered at-will and may

be terminated at any time, with or without notice or cause.

Thank you for your interest in employment with the Supreme Court of Appeals of West Virginia.

Overview:

Do you have a passion for technology and are naturally curious? If you have strong interpersonal skills and are driven to learn and grow, then come join and add value at OneNeck IT Solutions as a Data Center Technician – Operations in Waukee, IA.


**Please note this position is considered an essential worker for our business and therefore will be required to work in the data center facility for all working hours.**


This is a full-time opportunity, working Wednesday from 11:00am to 7:00pm CT, Thursday-Friday from 9:00am-7:00pm CT and Saturday from 7:00am to 7:00pm CT.
Responsibilities:

The Data Center Technician - Operations will operate, monitor, measure, and attain OneNeck IT Solutions’ Data Centers Service Level Commitments, and maintain facility appearance and integrity, especially during assigned shift. This role is responsible for providing assistance to customers and projects, as such situations arise. The data center is a critical aspect of the OneNeck business by ensuring availability, business continuity (no disruption), and security for internal and external customers. The data center must maintain high standards for assuring the integrity and functionality of its’ hosted computer environment and support services.

Monitor and Operate Data Centers critical functions and facilities to meet or exceed Service Levels. Monitor, correct, and report observed infractions of security policies and procedures. Detect and dispatch help for trouble situations within non-local facilities, and attempt remote troubleshooting if possible/practical
Measure and record vital statistics and produce appropriate reports, including shift and weekly reports. Record and maintain accurate incident and change records and logs.
Respond physically to trouble situations within the local facility and conduct troubleshooting (including of telecom circuits) as may be required.
Conduct routine walkthroughs of local facility, correcting both appearance and functional imperfections. Chaperone vendors and guests, as may become necessary.
Assist, as available, project activity including any of the following
Installation, termination, testing and labeling of all cross connects (cat5, coax, fiber) in the Data Center.
Moving and installation of cabinets and relay racks.
Hardware installation including: shelves, power strips, rails, cable management, and customer equipment.
Exhibit exemplary workmanship in such performance
Have a working knowledge of the responsibilities of the Data Center Technician – Security, and be able to assist with those responsibilities, as necessary.
Qualifications:

Required Qualifications

Associates Degree -OR- 2+ years professional work experience.
3+ years technical support experience in a data center and/or HVAC environment and/or electrical field -OR- 1+ years of technical support in a OneNeck Data Center Facility (internal only)
Must have and maintain a valid driver’s license and reliable transportation.
Must live within 30 minutes of the data center.
Ability to work Wednesday from 11:00am to 7:00pm CT, Thursday-Friday from 9:00am-7:00pm CT and Saturday from 7:00am to 7:00pm CT.
Must be able to lift and carry equipment up to 75 pounds; climb equipment and walk on rooftops and cat-walks.

Other Qualifications

ITIL Certification or the willingness to pursue certification within 12 months of hire or work with management to pursue a reasonable alternative within 18 months.
Availability to occasionally work extra hours (including weekends) per an on-call basis.
Excellent communications with others, especially regarding technical matters.
Working knowledge of HVAC, Power, Fire, Security building systems operations and safety.
Working knowledge of telecommunications technologies, systems, and circuits.
Data center skills and experience in installing/moving equipment and cabling on a large-scale basis.
Experience working with various networking hardware such as multiplexers, routers, and switches.
Knowledge of common network protocols such as TCP/IP.
Experience with fault isolation and troubleshooting networks including LAN and WAN.
Familiarity with configuring networking equipment such as routers, switches, and hubs.
Experience with data communication issues, including security, resource management, capacity planning, monitoring, and performance.
Ability to work independently and manage multiple priorities and interruptions.

#OneNeck IT Solutions offers multi-cloud solutions, combined with managed services, professional IT services, hardware and local connectivity via top-tier data centers across the country. OneNeck's team of technology professionals deliver secure, modern platforms and applications for organizations embracing data-driven transformation and secure end-to-end solutions.


Employment at OneNeck is subject to post-offer, pre-employment drug testing.
EEO/AA Employer/Vets/Disability.

Job_description:
Posted
07-Mar-2023
Service line
GWS Segment
Role type
Full-time
Areas of Interest
Construction, Data Centers
Location(s)
Charleston - South Carolina - United States of America, Moncks Corner - South Carolina - United States of America, North Charleston - South Carolina - United States of America, Summerville - South Carolina - United States of America
Job Summary
The Datacenter Automation Systems (DAS) team is committed to the successful implementation of autonomous and semi-autonomous vehicles throughout multiple datacenters. CBRE is seeking a full-time, permanent, CAD Operator with experience in MEP design, manufacturing or data center robotics-centric automation solutions. The DAS CAD Operator will report to the Client-approved location:
Moncks Corner, SC - full time / on site
The DAS CAD Operator requirements may vary according to Client-determined assignments, but most content relates to creating detailed designs for industrial automation equipment and systems in the DAS robotics portfolio at the Client's data centers. This position is part of a multi-disciplinary team creating engineering documentation and design drawing packages. The individual will collaborate with project engineers, technical writers, project managers, and other CAD/BIM Operators. Ideal candidates would be familiar with establishing and managing a design environment. Ideal candidates must be comfortable communicating regularly via video conference, email and internal ticketing systems.

Job Duties:
Acquire clear understanding of product requirements by reviewing, understanding, interpreting and revising technical specifications, blueprints and engineering illustrations, mockups, and prototypes.
Ability to read and interpret design standards and specifications, blueprints, drawings, redlines, etc
Coordinate the CAD design for Navigation Tape and GeoMarker installation package
Installation Drawings
Navigation DesignLayout
GeoMarker datum development
Material Takeoff
Working understanding of construction design package development for field installation.
Ability to translate existing field conditions from documentation and redlines to revise/edit design drawing packages.
Ability to learn software such as Lucidchart to generate shape files for navigation translated from design drawings. .
Capable of managing shifting design production to coordinate with field installation schedules.
Coordinate file management with 3rd party teams for document file transfer.
Maintain audits of latest design revisions against floor plan modifications.
Ability to perform repetitive field measurement tasks for long durations such as bending, kneeling, squatting ,walking, climbing stairs, etc.
Must have excellent organizational skills
Ability to communicate effectively, both orally and in writing

Other duties as assigned.

SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES

No formal supervisory responsibilities in this position.

QUALIFICATIONS

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.

Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

EDUCATION and EXPERIENCE

Bachelor's degree in Architecture, Engineering, Construction Management, or related field. Minimum two or more years' construction administration, architecture, engineering or similar experience.

Preferred experience with some data center infrastructure projects. Experience in mission critical data centers is a strong plus. Preferred experience with robotic process automation.

CERTIFICATES and/or LICENSES

Working towards or eligible for licensure as either a Professional Engineer or Registered Architect is desired.

COMMUNICATION SKILLS

Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Strong organizational and analytical skills. Ability to provide efficient, timely, reliable and courteous service to customers. Ability to effectively present information.

FINANCIAL KNOWLEDGE

Requires knowledge of financial terms and principles. Ability to calculate intermediate figures such as percentages, discounts, and/or commissions. Conducts basic financial analysis.

REASONING ABILITY

Ability to understand and carry out general instructions in standard situations. Ability to solve problems in standard situations. Requires intermediate analytical and quantitative skills.

OTHER SKILLS and ABILITIES

Intermediate skills with Microsoft Office Suite. Ability to read and understand architectural drawings. Working knowledge in MS Project is helpful. Knowledge of leases, contracts, and construction practices preferred. 3+ years of minimum proficiency in the use of AutoCAD and Revit. Knowledge of Best Management Practices CAD/BIM environment. Autodesk Software - CAD BIM Solidworks BIM360 etc.

Basic knowledge of the entitlement/permitting process and construction delivery methods and agreements. Some familiarity with construction best practices, general building codes, and various building types and systems. Passion for being detail oriented and highly organized.

SCOPE OF RESPONSIBILITY

Decisions made with general understanding of procedures and company policies to achieve set results and deadlines. Errors in judgment may cause short-term impact to co-workers and supervisor.

Description
VP of Sales

The Vice President of Sales is responsible for acquiring new accounts and achieving overall revenue growth.

Company Description

Bosch Charleston is a part of a global network with close to 400,000 associates who make products that are “Invented for Life.”

The Bosch Charleston plant has a long history in the Lowcountry and was established in 1974. We Drive. to provide a safe and inspiring environment for our associates. We make a difference and delight our global customers by creating state of the art products.

Over the past five years we have contributed over 1 million USD to Science, Technology, Engineering and Math (STEM) and environmental organizations in the Lowcountry through the Bosch Community Fund. Additionally, Bosch Charleston works closely with our partners to support these initiatives through volunteerism. There are many opportunities to get involved and we hope you will join us as we make a difference in the Lowcountry.

BOSCH is a proud supporter of STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering & Mathematics) Initiatives


FIRST Robotics (For Inspiration and Recognition of Science and Technology)


AWIM (A World In Motion)

Job Description

Product Data Management specialist to ensure implementation of engineering changes per Bosch Business Mobility (BBM) product release procedures. Identify, manage, and track project specific Change Requests (external and internal) from creation, through implementation and close. Ensure maintenance of product master data throughout the product lifecycle.

Scope & Responsibilities



Coordinate Engineering C hange M anagement (ECM) process throughout the Charleston Value Streams.
Key member of Engineering Change Management Review Team (RT), steering and consulting side by side with Engineering and Quality Leads.
Approve Engineering Change Requests (ECRs), Planning and Final Review, as plant representative.
Support Value Streams Teams with internal ECR Kick-Off Meetings while ensuring adherence to ECM guidelines.
Increase transparency of ECM by maintaining a comprehensive change overview and reporting across various levels of the organization as needed.
Define, support, and deploy ECM training across the teams as necessary.
Share best practices across products and regions, with critical eye to ensure lean and effective ECM.
Prepare and distribute monthly reports.
Ensure update of material masters, bill of materials, and other product data.

Qualifications

Basic Qualifications

Bachelor's degree required, engineering or technical discipline preferred.

Preferred Qualifications

Self-driven, high energy and proactive with strong motivational skills who can lead teams toward a common goal.
Individual must have ability to make independent decisions that may be of a complex nature.
Strong organization skills to efficiently manage varying topics with process driven mind-set.
Previous experience leading cross-functional teams with ability to quickly build internal networks.
Strong product and product release process know-how from quotation to start of production.
Proficient with Microsoft Office, SAP or similar change management software.
Professional work experience in automotive or manufacturing industry (i.e. engineering, project management, or similar).
Product life cycle experience.

Additional Information

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

By choice, we are committed to a diverse workforce - EOE/Protected Veteran/Disabled.
